loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed spare parts and supplies needed in her computer shop. It also helped in her variety store and also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household needs. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
Emma would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She will also use the loan in her computer shop. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emma dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Las Abejitas De Qqueuña Group

texts.es: Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ABEJITAS DE QQUEUÑA” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en la comunidad de Queñua en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Elena tiene 23 años de edad y se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales por ejemplo chanchos,cuyes y pollos, a la ganadería y elaboración de artesanía. Ya son varios años que Elena se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Elena en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lanas. Los demás socios se dedican a la ganadería, a la agricultura, a la venta de comida, crianza de animales menores, elaboración de artesanía y otros brindan servicios profesionales. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “LAS ABEJITAS DE QQUEUÑA” from the Arariwa association. They live in the community of Queñua in the district of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo in the southern city of Cuzco.

Elena is 23 years old and she raises animals for example pigs, guinea pigs and chickens, cattle breeding and making handicrafts. It’s been several years now that Elena has been working in this business and it’s going very well for her.

At this time, Elena is asking for a loan to purchase work material such as wools. 

The rest of the members work in: cattle breeding, selling food, small animal breeding, making handicraft and others provide professional services. The members are grateful to those who are part of this dream. The member is committed to make her repayments within the agreed period.

loans.use: to purchase work materials such as wools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for supplies like wiring, putty paint and other materials needed in the maintenance of her repair shop.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Erlinda would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to buy the needed supplies for his farm. His loan also helped in the education of his child while his income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. He and his wife are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs. He also sells frozen foods for additional income.

Felix would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that he will be utilizing to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Felix hopes to be more successful in his business and dreams of giving his family a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of his life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and other supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed materials for her tailoring business. Her income from business is assisting her everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lorena hopes to have more clients and dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: I Nyoman

texts.en:
I Nyoman is a young farmer who runs an agriculture business, in particular vegetable farming. As the backbone of the family, he has an obligation to meet all the needs of his family. In developing his business, there are some obstacles encountered such as limited knowledge of business management as well as limited access to capital. To solve this problem, I Nyoman joined MUK. He also participates in MUK's loan program for small businesses. 

This loan will be allocated to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies. Within 4 months, his vegetables will be ready for sale and the profits will be used to meet family needs and develop the farm. Any remaining profits will be saved for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité, donde mediante el trabajo en equipo que realizan las señoras, y además de la responsabilidad y solidaridad de todas, han logrado fortalecer el grupo.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Rosa, quien se dedica a la elaboración de productos de limpieza, que luego ella sale a vender. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada que lucha por su familia para poder darles todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener. Su sueño es poder agrandar su negocio y seguir dando a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La Sra. Rosa solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos al por mayor para poder seguir haciendo sus productos de limpieza, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar el bienestar de su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas ("United Women") is in its 7th cycle of the committee program. Through the women's work in teams, and also the responsibility and solidarity of them, they have strengthened the group.

One of the members is Rosa, who works making cleaning products, which she later goes out to sell. She is a woman who is very dedicated to the fight for her family, to be able to give them everything that they could not have before. Her dream is to be able to expand her business and continue giving her loved ones a dignified life without hardship.

Rosa is requesting this loan for the purchase of products in bulk to be able to continue making her cleaning products, which will help her complete her business plan. The plan will allow her to improve her income to improve the well being of her family. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Telecila

texts.es:
Telecila tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales patos, cuyes y gallinas de corral desde hace 7 años, para poyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Telecila is 47 old and lives with her husband and children in the Oyotún district, a farming and livestock community located in the Chiclayo province, within the Lambayeque region of Peru.

She has been buying and selling animals such as ducks, Guinea pigs, and chickens for the past seven years, in order to help her husband with the family expenses.  She is asking for this loan of 500 Nuevos Soles to buy balanced feed for her animals.  In this way she can generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Azwar

texts.en:
Azwar lives in north Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Azwar is married and lives with two persons in the family home.

Azwar began working with Ruma one year ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $21 - 22 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekend

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh works in agriculture growing food. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Thanh is 54 years old and she is married with no children. Thanh supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to a build toilet.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Voeun, aged 45, is a married woman and the mother of seven children from Prasat Balangk district, Kampong Thom province. She has been engaged in the farming business for nearly 25 years now and has worked hard to be able to earn enough income to sustain her living. Voeun is delighted because her husband is very supportive in helping her with her farming business. Voeun is photographed with her husband in the photo.
 
Voeun would like to improve her living standards by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan in the sum of 600 USD to build a biogas digester under the National Biogas Program (NPB) funded by HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and generate less smoke from wood or charcoal. Upon construction completion, NBP provides a flat rate subsidy of 150 USD per plant to the borrower’s saving account for the purpose of making a loan repayment. After that, HKL will reschedule a new repayment schedule with the borrower. Accordingly, there is the possibility of a small variation in the loan amount when reporting the monthly repayment to Kiva.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester.

loans.name: Nataly Vannesa

texts.es:
Ella se llama Nataly Vannesa, quien tiene 17 años y se encuentra estudiando AUXILIAR ADMINISTRATIVO EN HOTELERIA en Campo Alto, ella vive en Ciudadela El Recreo con la madre Olga Lucia que trabaja como mercaderista de productos de ferretería, quien es la persona que ha estado pendiente de la formación académica y quien en lo posible ha sido la persona que la ha apoyado para que se siga preparando académica mente  a fin de que en un futuro le pueda ayudar económicamente para solventar las necesidades que se puedan presentar pues no ha contado con el  apoyo del  padre biológico, para suplir las necesidades básicas. 

Nataly Vannesa  estudio en el INSTITUTO TECNOLÓGICO DEL SUR  durante la  trayectoria por dicho plantel académico se destacó por ser una persona responsable y comprometida con los trabajos asignados, una de las metas que ella tiene es poder estudiar a nivel profesional la carrera de PSICOLOGIA, pues estima que puede ayudar a personas que presenten ciertos trastornos a nivel de comportamiento causado por situaciones de violencia u otro tipo de sucesos, es el ideal que se propone, sin embargo por ahora para la madre  no es posible costearle esta carrera a nivel profesional pues por los costos económicos tan elevados no lo puede hacer,  por eso optaron por que la Señorita Nataly Vannesa se inscribiera en CAMPO ALTO para estudiar la carrera técnica de AUXILIAR ADMINISTRATIVA EN HOTELERIA  ya que les informaron que por ser bachiller del INSTITUTO TECNOLÓGICO DEL SUR podía acceder al beneficio académico de estudiar la carrera que cumpliera con las expectativas, pagando mensualmente una suma más económica hasta culminar la formación académica y lograr la obtención del título como AUXILIAR ADMINISTRATIVA EN HOTELERIA.
Lo ideal es que la Señorita Nataly Vanessa pueda culminar la formación laboral como pasante y obtener el título anteriormente mencionado, pues ellas espera que kiva le pueda ayudar y sea consciente de la situación económica por la que ellas están atravesando, ya que un incremento en dicha mensualidad no estaba presupuestado en ningún momento.  
Ella espera contar con la mayor atención y valiosa colaboración con el caso anteriormente expuesto, ya que la formación académica es importante para la formación de una persona que comienza la productividad laboral y se proyecta como un futuro profesional.
texts.en:
This is Nataly Vannesa, 17, who is in Campo Alto studying to be an administrative assistant in hospitality.  She lives in the El Recreo neighborhood with her mother, Olga Lucia, who sells hardware products.  Nataly Vanessa's mother is the one who has been seeing to her education and, as far as possible, has been the one who has supported her so she could continue to prepare herself academically so that in the future she can help financially with any necessities they might have; they haven't had any support with basic necessities from Nataly Vannesa's biological father.

Nataly Vanessa was studying at the Southern Institute of Technology.  She's stresses that she was on the career track there so she could become a responsible person, committed to the tasks assigned to her. One of her goals is to be able to study for a career in psychology because she feels that she can help people who have particular behavioral problems caused by violent situations or other circumstances. That would be her ideal.  However, for now it's not possible for her mother to pay for a professional-level degree. The costs involved are too high for her to manage, so they didn't go that route.  

They decided to have Nataly Vanessa register at Campo Alto to study for a Hospitality Administrative Assistant technical degree. They told her that by getting a degree from the Southern Institute of Technology she would have the benefit of studying for a degree that would live up to her expectations. Plus, she'd be paying a more affordable monthly fee until she finishes up and gets the degree. 

Ideally, Nataly Vanessa will be able to finish her studies and get the aforementioned technical degree. She hopes that Kiva will be able to help her out and be sensitive to the financial situation she and her mother are going through; she had never budgeted for the increase in the monthly expenses. 
Nataly Vanessa is giving the highest attention and making the most valuable contribution to her situation.  Education is the most important part of becoming a person starting a productive career, and she sees herself as a future professional.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of college.

loans.name: Maa Dharani Shg Group

texts.en:
Banita is 21 years old, married and has four children. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Banita. She is a native of the city of Kalahandi, but she lives in the village of Bori in Odisha, India. She is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business growing vegetables and paddy, which she sells in the market. She has already had this business for two years and it is going very well. 

She gathered her neighbors and friends and formed the group Maa Dharani SHG Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Bandita as their president. At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demands.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre La Victoria está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité, donde todas y cada una de las integrantes está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo  para poder dar lo mejor de sí y ayudar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Perla es una de estas mujeres, ella vende huevos y también ensalada de frutas que ella misma hace y que sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora que pone todo de sí para salir adelante.
La Sra. Perla solicita este préstamo para la compra de huevos al por mayor, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "La Victoria" ("victory") Group is in its 3rd cycle of the committee program, where every one of the members is putting forth her best effort to be able to give the best of herself and help her loved ones have everything that they could not have before.

Perla is one of these women. She sells eggs and fruit salad that she makes, and she goes out to sell them as a roving vendor. She is a very hard-working person and above all entrepreneurial. She gives everything of herself to be able to move forward.  

Perla is requesting this loan for the purchase of eggs in bulk, which will help her complete her business plan, which will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy eggs in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Jhaguas Pankarita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JHAGUAS PANKARITA” iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Norma es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de mantas, venta de chompas, artesano chofer, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Norma es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido a máquina; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio primeramente con el tejido a mano, posteriormente decide agilizar su producción es por ello que aprende el tejido a máquina.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en salud y crédito que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jhaguas Pankarita" will start its 19th cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of the Exaltación House. It is comprised of 8 members and directed by a board of directors where Norma is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied; among them are: blanket-making, sweater sales, an artisan, a driver, a neighborhood store, and clothing sales. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small businesses where Norma is a member. She indicates that it is the first year that she is joining Pro Mujer. She joined through the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business in weaving (with a machine). She initially started this business with hand-weaving; afterward, she decided to speed up production, and for that reason she learned to weave with a machine. 

The loan that she is taking out is for increasing capital (the purchase of yarn in bulk), which she will acquire in the stores in the City of El Alto, and after creating products she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family since she is divorced and has four children. 

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health trainings, and the loan that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Tanjung Rijasa Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by the stakeholders in the village. They are interested in loans for pig breeding from MUK. The Tanjung Rijasa group has ten women members. The members of the group are farmers. They work on their land or other people’s land and earn income. To improve their income, in addition to their husband's, they want to run a business at home.

Luh Putu, head of the Tanjung Rijasa, has two adult children. Her husband works as a chili and corn famer. Luh Putu already has pigs, but to improve her business, she needs a loan to buy more pigs. She will use the loan to purchase three pigs and use the rest for food. She maintains pigs for fattening. Luh Putu hopes the business can run smoothly, free from disease, and that she will earn a profit.  Two of the members can't attend the meeting, because they must stay at the temple for a religious ceremony.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and use the rest for food.

loans.name: Maria Rosela

texts.en:
Maria Rosela previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Rosela dreams to have a grocery store someday, and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, needed in her business.

loans.name: Serason Indah Group

texts.en:
The Serason Indah group make their payments on time and are only represented by the head, Ni Made. During the loan period the pigs can grow fat and healthy. The keep the piglets for 3 months and then sell them to the big buyer or breeder from another village.

Ni Made is successful in maintaining her pigs. By feeding them with a super quality feed the pigs can grow fat and healthy. Ni Made can sell them for a satisfactory price. The profit from this business is used for purchasing more piglets for increasing the population of her pigs, as well as to purchase some merchandise for her snack kiosk. 

Ni Made will use her loan to purchase feed for her pigs and merchandise for her kiosk. She plans to sell piglets for pig barbeque. Pigs for pig barbeque require easier care than superior pigs and have faster sales. She hopes her new plan can be more successful.

This is the fourth loan for the Serason Indah group. They still need financial support for their businesses until they are able to continue business with their own capital. All profits from the sales of pork they are saving to use as venture capital.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs and merchandise for her snack kiosk.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Because Tamara is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. 

Tamara was born in 1981. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt. Tamara was facing a financial crisis that led her to start a new project selling goats and their products two years ago. 

She is planning to buy a larger quantity of goats and sheep in order to be more productive and to buy food for them, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep and food for them

loans.name: Onolina

texts.en: "Onolina is a 32 year old mother of 3 children. She has a plantation where she grows crops such as taro, yam, bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been working on her plantation for 2 years but received encouragement from her other village colleagues she can sell her produce to get money. Onolina needs a loan to buy equipments and tools to help with her plantation. She needs to buy a wheelbarrow,chemicals,knives, crowbar, mistblower, shovels and weedspray. She is a new member of SBPD who came seeking financial assistance to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow,chemicals,knives, crowbar, mistblower, shovels and weedspray

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila is 18 years old and a freshly graduated student from high school from Stung Treng province. After graduation Sila is encouraged to continue her studies at the university in Phnom Penh, but the family is experiencing financial difficulties. Because of this reason, Sila is asking for a loan to pay for her education fees. 

Her major is accounting, the major that she loves and thinks is suitable for her personality. During her course Sila aims to find a part-time job in order to help her parents cover her tuition fees. Sila is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via the program like Kiva to allow poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Angeles Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGELES DEL CIELO” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, venta de ropa interior, salón de belleza, cerrajero, venta de DVD’s, tienda de barrio, venta de Bisutería, venta de electrodomésticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lencería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al retirarse de un trabajo anterior y con la finalidad de generar recursos decide emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lencería por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución y las amigas de su banca.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Angeles del cielo" will start its 10th cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Santiago II. It is comprised of 8 members and directed by a board of directors, where Hilda is the secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are various. Among them are sweater knitting, under garment sales, beauty salon, a locksmith, DVD sales, neighborhood store, a trinket shop, and electrical appliance sales. 
 
The loan that they took out will benefit small businesses where Hilda is a member. She indicates that it has been 4 years since she joined Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling under garments. She started this business after finishing another job; she decided to start this business, with the goal of generating income.

The loan that she is taking out now is for the increase of capital (purchase of under garments in bulk) which she will acquire in the fairs of the city of El Alto, and afterward she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has 2 children. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución y las amigas de su banca.

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health trainings that the institution offers and her friends at the bank.

loans.use: to buy under garments in bulk.

loans.name: Samen

texts.en:
Samen is 64 years old, married, and has nine children of various ages. To make a living, Samen has been a farmer for over 30 years and earns about 12,000 KHR per day. Farming is the sole source of her family’s income, which she uses for daily meals and other costs of commodities. One of Samen's daughters financially supports the family with her tailoring business.

This is the first loan for Samen with Kiva’s partner, Hattha Kaksekar Limited. Samen is going to use this loan to buy textiles for her daughter’s tailoring business. Through this loan, Samen hopes to keep her daughter’s business sustainable and thereby increase the income for her family.

loans.use: to buy textiles for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, as well as the maintenance of their van unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes for a continuous growth in her business and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Aussi

texts.en: Aussi is 25 years old and married, with three children who have not started attending school.  They reside in Maabale- a rural area. He is a produce dealer and deals in crops like maize and beans. He has approached UGAFODE for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy produce since it is now the season and the produce is still selling cheaply. He will pay back the loan after earning profits. His dream is to acquire land, and build a commercial house near the trading center. The challenge he faces is the seasonality of the business. He says he is a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to purchase beans and millet to sell.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Shg (B) Group

texts.en:
Sasmita is a 32-year-old lady living in Chheliamal, Kalahandi, Odisha, India with her husband and two children. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Sasmita. She is a housewife and she is completely dependent on her husband. When she learned about the Self Help Group, she decided to form a group and take a loan to start her own business. She gathered some women and started a Self Help Group named Maa Samaleswari SHG. She took responsibility for the group as the president.

Sasmita has a plan to purchase two cows and sell milk in the nearby market. Now Sasmita, along with her group members, has requested a loan. She will use her portion to buy two cows for milk production. She will add some money of her own and will buy cows. After this investment, she will be able to earn 3,000 INR per month.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for milk production.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna , a mother of two has been running a retail store for a living. Her husband is a farmer and she also helps him planting crops. With her generated revenue from the business, her previous loan used for it was successfully repaid. Aside from this, she also earn more amount of income from her banana farm where she had started two years ago. She harvested banana produce twice a month. To improve and sustain the farm, she took a new loan to cover fertilization cost. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.			.

loans.use: to cover fertilization cost

loans.name: Born

texts.en: Born is Ugandan woman, aged 33, and married to Kalyango Paul. They have five children between 5 and 17 years old.  Born is a hairstylist and she operates a ladies salon in Mabale trading centre.  She also does farming, but on a small scale.  She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 to buy cosmetics to use in the salon, which she expects to pay back after making some profits.  She dreams of having the biggest, modern beauty salon in the area, and educating all of her children, since her husband is weak and not supportive.  She is challenged by the seasonality of the business. She hopes this will be overcome if she gets enough funding, so she can diversify to different services. She is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to use in her salon.

loans.name: Jemaimaofa

texts.en: Jemaimaofa is a 24 year old mother with 2 children. She runs a small barbeque business selling to her community and has been doing this for 4 years.Jemaimaofa has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, Sacks of Potatoes, Onion, Sausages, Tomato Sauce, Soya, Plastic Plates, Spoons, Tissues, Foils. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial assistance. With her earnings,Jemaimaofa will look at improving her business and also assisting with her family needs and kids education.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, Sacks of Potatoes, Onion, Sausages, Tomato Sauce, Soya, Plastic Plates, Spoons, Tissues, Foils.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her and was able to buy more products for her variety store. The income she earns from her business assists in paying their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also operates a food stall for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better, since selling more items will result in higher profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia hopes for continuous growth in her business and dreams that her house will be renovated. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy nail polish, cuticle remover, pushers, nail cutters and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase nail polish, cuticle remover, pushers, nail cutters and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Raquel dreams that her business will grow bigger, and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, cuticle remover,  pushers, nail cutters and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Laisene

texts.en: Laisene is a 31 year old mother of 3 children. She runs a small business selling pancake and ice cake (ice pops) in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Laisene has requested a loan to purchase more ingredients for her pancake and ice cake business. Ingredients such as flour,sugar , cordial, plastic cups, baking powder, cooking oil, plastic bags. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Laisene will provide for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bag of flour,sugar , cordial, plastic cups, baking powder, cooking oil, plastic bags

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrifico esta saliendo adelante, comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por su hijo, ya que quiere darle todo para un futuro sin privaciones.
Ella tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, y comenta que su anterior préstamo lo usó en la compra de insumos para la despensa, hoy pide de un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo nuevamente en productos para la venta en su despensa, como ser verduras, lácteos, frutas, carnes y demás, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Teodora is a hardworking person who has made many sacrifices in order to get ahead. She says that all of her efforts have been made because of her son, for whom she wants to provide a future without being deprived.

Teodora has a food pantry where she works every day, beginning in the early morning hours. She says that previous loan was used to buy inventory for her food pantry. Today she is requesting a new loan so that once again she can invest in products to sell at her food pantry such as vegetables, dairy products, fruits, meats, and other items. This will allow her to continue making sales, just as she is doing now.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, dairy products, fruits, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Danie

texts.en:
Danie is 53 years old, married and lives with her family. He had a piggery business for two years and he earns well from this. He has had support his children's education and sustain his family living.
Danie has two years experience in this field. Danie  works hard every day in order to provide income for the family 

Danie requested this  loan to purchase feeds. He is aiming to develop his business and increase the profits so that he may open a bigger place and continue assisting his family with the additional income.

The story of Danie and his business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to purchase feeds

loans.name: Desimforadas

texts.en:
Desimforadas  is 45 years old, a mother of three and is being a common law couple. She had a retail store serving assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a construction worker.
Desimforadas has six years experience in this field. Desimforadas works hard every day in order to provide income for the family aside from her husband's salary.
Desimforadas requested this  loan to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may expand it for greater possibility of increasing sales and income.
The story of Bernadette and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell

loans.name: Edmun

texts.en:
Edmun previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories, and for the maintenance of his Tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his Tricycle unit. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Edmun dreams that his business will grow bigger and hopes that his children will finish their education. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Nyansio

texts.en:
Nyansio is 39 years old and married to Margret. Together, they have produced 5 children ages 7 to 19 and they reside at the Buroroa Trading Centre. Additionally, they look after two orphans who are relatives.

Nyansio operates a retail shop selling general merchandise but he also does some farming. He started this business in 2007 because there were only a few shops in the area serving a large population which was inadequate. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy more stock of household use items since there is a lot of demand by the residents. He has plans of constructing a commercial house to raise his income base.

The biggest challenge he faces is the poor road network, especially when he needs to go shopping in the big town.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise to re-sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 28 years old and single. His main source of income is the sale of motorcycle spare parts; but he also does farming on a small scale.

He has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX.1,000,000 to buy more spare parts in order to generate more income; that will help him fulfill his dream of constructing a modern garage in Burora.

He faces competition from other business men that deal in the same business.

loans.use: To buy spare motorcycle parts for resale

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Victoria está en su ciclo número trece del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Liz forma parte de este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que a través de las ventas varias de comidas rápidas está luchando por mejorar sus ingresos. Liz es una persona muy sacrificada que con mucho sacrificio esta esforzándose por salir adelante.
Liz pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, y demás para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas para la venta.
texts.en:
La Victoria Group is in its thirteenth loan cycle with the women's bank program.  They're doing a poverty-elimination survey so they can improve their economic status through effort, ongoing work, and application of vital behaviors.

Liz is a member of this group.  She's a very hardworking person who's striving to improve her income by selling a variety of fast food dishes.  She's a very selfless person who's making a big effort to get ahead.

Liz is requesting this loan to invest in buying meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients so she can keep on making food to sell.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: John Ray

texts.en:
John Ray provide transportation services in their community,and he earns well from this, the main source of income. He has been running this for more than four years.   He also had a cafeteria and he delegates his hired hands to oversee and cook foods for sale. When he was done or in the late afternoon, he comes  to help them in the business fro some accounting and inventory works.

He was taken photo with his motorcycle used for transportation services. He also used this when making some purchases for his cafeteria.
John Ray is requesting this loan from GDMPC to buy pots and raw ingredients to his cafeteria.  In the future, he wants  to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy pots and raw ingredients to his cafeteria

loans.name: Danita

texts.en:
Danita previously accessed an 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan so that she can buy more items to increase her product inventory, like clothing, footwear, and personal care products. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Danita dreams of being successful in business and hopes to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items like clothing, footwear, and personal care products to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Varaidzo

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Varaidzo from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe, which means 'he who does not sleep". She is married with two children and both are attending school. Varaidzo runs a retail business selling men;s and lady's wear. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says the main challenge being faced is lack of working capital to purchase bulk stocks. Varaidzo has requested a loan of $600 to buy more stocks like jeans and skirts for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay school fees for her children easily. In the future, Varaidzo plans to own her premises.

loans.use: to buy more stock like jeans and skirts for resale

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y trabaja en una entidad del estado en area de administración como asistente, él pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal para pagar la matricula de sus hijos.

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Fortunato lives in Mojopata and works for a government business as an assistant. He belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” and at this time he needs a loan for personal use to pay his children's school tuition.

He is grateful and appreciates the loan, and he promises to make the monthly payments responsbility. (Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district in Paucartambo province, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is a married woman and a mother of four children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in retail sales of cloth and clothing materials. This is the source of her income. Alejandra is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like bed sheets and cloth. With this, she will be able to improve her sales and income. In the future, Alejandra hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like bed sheets, and cloth

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora  owns and operates a business planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She has been working in her farm for more than nine years and she earns well from this. With her generated income, she had successfully repay her previous loan used for farm inputs.

Leonora always find ways to improve their farm and without hesitation, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.  In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en: Vy is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Vy is 27 years old and a mother of three children; one is in school and remaining two kids are too young for schooling. She feeds her family via rice farming and her paid labor for a fee. She has been involved with this business for seven years and it has returned her 31,600 KHR per day. This is the third cycle loan for Vy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the team leader of four for a loan.  The total amount of her entire group is 4,600,000 KHR, which 1,400,000 KHR is her portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that her family condition of living will be better than before.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna earns well from her transportation services and was able to repay her previous loan used buying tires and accessories. While her husband works abroad, she continue expanding her business and was engaged in serving internet cafe in their village. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase another unit of computer. In the future, Lorna hopes to enable her children to finish their studies and to double her income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase another unit of computer

loans.name: Lelave

texts.en: Lelave is a 58 year old widow of 6 children. She runs a small business selling pork cake in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Lelave has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her meat bun business such as, Sacks of flour, baking powder, Soya, chicken leg quarters, onion, and also to help with the payment of school fees. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lelave will use her business profit to help her business and her family.

loans.use: to buy Sacks of flour, baking powder, Soya, chicken leg quarters, onion, and also to help with the payment of school fees

loans.name: Anania

texts.en:
Anania is a married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Trinidad, Bohol. For more than two years now, she has been engaged in a hog raising business. Her husband works as a farmer.

Anania is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Micel Grace

texts.en: Micel Grace is married with three children operates a banana production business while her husband works as a driver to earn a living. For five years in harvesting and selling banana, it helps a lot to support her husband’s income for the family. She had sustained her farm and was able to give allowances to her children in going to school. Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy lakatan banana seedlings  in order to expand her banana farm.. In the future, Micel Grace wants to own more farm to expand her business to improve their income for the family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy lakatan banana seedlings

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a married entrepreneur who helps her husband working in their own farm . For more than four years, she earns well and had successfully repay her previous loan used in her banana farm. She had her workers that helped her in her farm. To improve her farm, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer. She wants to have a comfortable living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en: Originally from Battambang province, Sam is a 28-year-old mother of one schoolchild and under school-aged kids. She struggles for a living via one hectare of rice farming and her paid-working job. This business, which she has been involved in since she was 20 years old, has returned her about 32,000 KHR. Now, Sam is formed a group consisting of two members as second-time borrowers requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. Now, her standard of living is better than before. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income as well as making her standard of living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Thab's Group

texts.en:
Thab is a 57-year-old, married mother of three kids who are in school. She resides with the rest of her entire family in the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province. To cover the necessary expenses for her household, she grows rice and sesame as her main source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages.

Thab is not new with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has formed a group of two to get a new loan. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and her joint borrower is seeking for 1,400,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay the pumped water fee for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield that is better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and pay the pumped water fee for her farmland.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en: Touch, 51 and a mother of four children, is a local villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province.  For her family rice cropping and fish-catching for resale are the main sources of income which generate her about 34,000 KHR per day. This is the fourth cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) while it is her co-borrower's third time. The past three loans, which she has repaid back with success, have enabled her to lift her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to gain good crop yield better than before as well as to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en: Josephina, a mother of two has been running her retail store for more than six years. She earns well that she had successfully repay her previous loan used for the business. To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Her goal for the future is to make improvements to her house as well as her business and to the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 27 years old and married. He has only two dependents who are his elderly parents who are weak and cannot work. He is a produce dealer and deals mainly in maize, beans and coffee which he buys from the local farmers.

He approached Ugafode for a loan of 2,000,000 to buy produce since it is currently selling cheaply in the villages. He plans to sell at a profit and repay the loan.

He dreams of acquiring more land and constructing a good house to live in. He is hard working and thanks Ugafode for the good work they are doing to help the rural poor.

loans.use: to buy millet and beans to re-sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine grows and harvest banana, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband works abroad to find better income. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she had to oversee her farm as well as her pigs. 

Josephine is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer and to finance banana production fertilization costs, since she needs farm improvement.  In the future,she wants to have a better house than he has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have, since today people who are better prepared academically are able to get better jobs. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to finance banana production fertilization costs

loans.name: Abdi

texts.en:
Abdi lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Abdi is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Abdi began working with Ruma three months ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $15 - 16 in sales per day on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekend

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia has been running a business, retail store for many  years. Aside from this, she also had a farm as their main source of income. With her farm, Letecia earns is a sustainable manner. She always find ways to improve it in order to gain more farm produce. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer. She hoped to have a greener farm and to ensure to have a better income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité San Francisco está en su ciclo 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan, y tienen sus actividades que le generan ingresos y que les ayuda para una mejor calidad de vida. 
Son mujeres que tienen ganas y deseos de mejorar la situación de vida tanto en el ámbito económico como así también en el bienestar de ellas en forma individual.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, ella es artesana, elabora artículos artesanales, se mantiene con una actitud de seguir trabajando de manera constante con la ayuda de sus hijos teniendo como propósito ganar más dinero.  Ella se encuentra mejorando su situación y calidad de vida, valora su propio esfuerzo ya que mediante eso ella está notando el progreso dentro de su hogar, teniendo como propósito aumentar sus ingresos. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de forma ambulante y por pedidos,  ella por forma parte del comité, está luchando por los objetivos que desea alcanzar,  se les incentiva con ideas y técnicas de negocios  para poder luchar y  superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Sonia solicita este préstamo para la compra de sus artículos para la elaboración de sus productos artesanales, como ser telas, hilos, agujas y demás, con la intención y búsqueda de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
San Francisco Communal Bank is in its fourth loan cycle with the women's bank program.  All of them work and have jobs that generate income and help them have a better quality of life.  They're women who want to improve their living conditions, their finances, and the well-being of each individual.

One of the members is Sonia, an artisan who makes handicrafts.  She supports herself by working constantly with the help of her children.  Her goal is to earn more money.

Sonia's improving her situation and quality of life.  She values her own effort because that's how she's making progress at home.  Sonia said she sells her work as a street vendor and she takes orders.  As part of the communal bank, she's striving for her objectives and motivating the members with ideas and business practices to be able to fight and overcome poverty.

Sonia's requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other materials to make her artisanal products so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies to make crafts

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her business. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She is a dealer of different products such as different bread, candies, noodles and other products.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy different bread, candies, noodles and other products for delivery. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilibeth hopes to continue operating her business and have more customers. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different  bread, candies, noodles and other products for delivery.

loans.name: Veolita

texts.en: Veolita , a mother of two managed a general store for five years and she earns well to support her husband’s income from employment as a teacher. She had sustained it with the support of the entire family. The couple wants to provide a better education to their children so with this; she had to work more for it. She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Gruhalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Manju is a 30-year-old lady who stepped out and formed a group named Gruhalaxmi SHG a Self Help Group in Chheliamal village in the Kalahandi district, Odisha. They help each other, share their problems and solve them among each other. They celebrate their festivals together in their village. Manju, who is the leader of the group, has eight goats. She purchases the goat kids from the market and takes care of them. She provides vaccine and fodder to them when required. She sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they grow. It takes 8-9 months for her to make them grow and then she sells them. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats grazing in the fields and returns by noon. Then she cooks for her family.  She resumes taking care of her goats by feeding them at home. Her husband helps her to sell and maintain these goats. In this way, she is earning money to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities.

Now Manju has a plan to purchase more goat kids so that she can expand her business. For that reason, she is requesting this loan. She will buy seven more goat kids for her animal-raising business. She is very happy and grateful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: To buy seven more goat kids

loans.name: Hope Foundation Silc Group

texts.en:
Resty, in the back row with her hand raised, is a member of Hope Foundation Silc. She is 43 years old and a mother of five. Her spouse is a businessman, and they live in their own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Resty started her business selling beer, soda and sugar with 300,000 UGX she made from her agricultural work. Customers who fail to pay their debts on time are a challenge for her.

A portion of this 5,950,000 UGX loan through HOFOKAM will go to Resty so she can buy more beer, soda and sugar to sell. Her aspiration is to own a large, well-stocked depot to enable her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy more beer, soda and sugar to sell

loans.name: Orch's Group

texts.en:
Orch is a resident from Moung Russey district of Battambang province in Cambodia.  She is 45 years old and a mother of two school aged children, and three children who help with the family’s business and household chores.  

To cover the daily food consumption in her household, she manages rice cropping and sesame planting as the main source of income.  She has operated this business for 11 years.  

This is the fourth loan for Orch and the first-cycle for her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy insecticide, seed, and to pay labor costs.  She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow her crops on time with a good yield in return.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, seed, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Jaya lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Jaya is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Jaya began working with Ruma more than six months ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $81 - 82 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Ahmad is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Ahmad began working with Ruma two months ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, he has around $13 - 14 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Liliann Estefany

texts.es:
Ella se llama Lilian Estefany, estudia la enfermería porque ante todo le gusta y por realizarse como persona y así hacer realidad los proyectos a futuro, obtener mejores oportunidades de empleo para así hacerlos realidad. 
Liliann estudia enfermería porque ante todo le gusta quiere sentirse realizada cómo persona y como profesional para así darle un mejor futuro A los dos hijos y así poder cumplir las metas, le he interesa el convenio kiva porque le dan la oportunidad de seguir motivada con la carrera y a demás a tener una buena oportunidad de trabajar y estudiar para seguir siendo una persona responsable y entregada laboral mente, quiere ayudar a las personas, sentir que aporta un grano de arena a  la sociedad, hacer lo más mínimo para que los usuarios tengan un buen servicio y una buena atención por parte de la unidad de enfermería significa mucho para ella, porque de niña fue la pasión querer servirle a la salud sentir que esta aportando cosas buenas y significativas a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Her name is Lilian Estefany.  She is studying nursing because, first and foremost, she enjoys it.  She also wants to accomplish something as a person, to make her future plans into reality and to have better employment opportunities to help her plans become reality. 
Lilian is studying nursing because, first and foremost, she wants to feel accomplished as a person and as a professional so she can give her two children a better future.  She also wants to meet her goals.  The Kiva arrangement interested her because it gives her the opportunity to stay motivated in her career, to have better employment and educational opportunities and to keep being a responsible, committed person in terms of her work.  Lilian wants to help people, to feel that she is contributing a grain of sand to society.  Doing what she can to ensure the people she serves get good service and attention from the nursing unit means a lot to her.  Even as a little girl, Lilian's passion was to serve in healthcare and feel that she is contributing good and meaningful things to society.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Sreynoun's Group

texts.en:
Sreynoun, 36 years old and married, is a villager from Battambang province. Rice farming on four hectares of farmland is the family’s primary source of income, while she also works at a second job for extra income.

This is not the first loan for Sreynoun with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has wisely managed her past four loans, which she has fully paid back, in order to improve her lifestyle.

Sreynoun and her joint borrower are seeking a 2,800,000 KHR loan to be divided equally between them. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes her rice field will produce a good yield, which she would use to help support her family.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena vive en la hermosa ciudad de Challabamba y se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo textiles diferentes tipos de lanas y elabora como por ejemplo chullos, mantas, chalinas y otras cosas más. Ella sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y oveja. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Elena lives in the beautiful city of Challabamba.  She earns her living making textile handicrafts from different types of wool.  She makes, for example, woolen caps, blankets, scarves and other items.  Elena still belongs to the communal bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” (Sun Born Of Mojopata) and at this time needs a loan to purchase work materials like alpaca and sheep's wool.  She is grateful for and values the loan, and she promises to very responsibly comply with her monthly repayment plan.  (The Mojopata community is located in the Challabamba District, Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: to purchase working materials such as alpaca and sheep's wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Samaleswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Kaikeya is a 24-year-old lady living with her husband and son in a small village named Medinpur in the Kalhandi district. In the picture, the lady seated first from right with her hand raised is Kaikeya. Her husband is a farmer. He spends all day at the farm. Her son is at school. During the day, she has all day free, so she decided to make a Self Help Group. She gathered some of her neighbor women and made a Self Help Group named Samaleswari SHG. Kaikeya took on the leadership of the group.

Kaikeya has a plan to cultivate watermelon and sell it at the market so that she can make a handsome profit. For this reason, she and her group members are requesting this loan. She will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her watermelon farming. After this investment, she will be earning and supporting her family. She is very happy that she is able do something that is worthy of her leisure time.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her watermelon farming.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar lives in Santo Rosario in the province of Isabela. He is a good farmer and a very responsible client of ASKI and Kiva. He hopes to receive his second Kiva loan. He used the first loan for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds.
He continues his farming activities, and he takes care of his farm perfectly. He is also perfect in agricultural activities, and he cultivates on his land, which his family uses. He also sells the produce to re-sellers.
He is asking for his second Kiva loan in an amount of PHP 15,000, since he again wants to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his business.

loans.name: Dian

texts.en:
Dian lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Dian is married and lives with more than six persons in the family home.

Dian began working with Ruma two years ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has around $44 – 45 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Hanibal

texts.en:
Hanibal lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Hanibal is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Hanibal began working with Ruma one year ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $51 - 52 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Flor Y Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR Y CIELO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silvia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: crianza de ganado, entrega de leche, venta de papa y chuño, agricultor, tienda de barrio, venta de refrescos y cerveza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silvia es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.
