En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta refrescos y de cerveza; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde corta edad ella ayudo a su madre en este negocio y así aprendió los procesos de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza y refrescos por mayor) que adquirirá en las comunidades cercanas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The communal bank "Flor y Cielo" (Flower and Sky) is requesting its first loan from Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. The bank has eight member and is led by a board whose president is Silvia. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses including cattle rearing, delivering milk, selling potatoes and chuño (freeze-dried potatoes), farming, running convenience stores, selling soda and beer. The loan requested will be used to help small business owners like Silvia. It is the first year that Silvia has been part of Pro Mujer and she joined after being invited by one of the promoters who came to visit her at her house. She currently runs a business selling soda and beer. She says that she learned this trade from her parents as from an young age she used to help her mother with the business, and that is how she learned how it worked. She is requesting the loan to be able to buy more stock (beer and soda) that she will buy in the neighboring villages to later sell at her stall. Her business gives her enough money to provide for her family as she is married and has five children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she enjoys the training sessions that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda at wholesale

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Yim, 32, is from Battambang province and a married mother blessed with one preschool-aged son. To help support the family she runs a small pharmacy in the area. She also works another job to supplement her earnings.

Yim’s previous loan was her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has been fully repaid. As a result her living conditions have improved.

Now Yim leads this two-member group that is applying for a 2,600,000 KHR loan through VisionFund to be split equally between them. Yim will spend her entire loan portion to buy more medicine for resale. She hopes that she can grow her business and obtain a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Julio Salvador

texts.es:
Julio vive en San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora que siempre les dan una muy buena acogida a los turistas Nacionales y extranjeros que visitan este Cantón a disfrutar de sus maravillosos paisajes y sitios de descanso como lo son las hermosas hosterías que en encontramos en la vía Florida Santo Domingo. 
En este Cantón en un pequeño recinto llamado San Pedro vive y tiene su negocio el señor Julio un hombre de 53 años tiene una sólida relación en unión libre la esposa no trabaja ella pasa en casa y le ayuda en el negocio ellos tienen 8 hijos el mayor tiene 28 años y el ultimo tiene 11 años 
El señor Julio junto con la esposa se dedican a la producción de cerdos de esta actividad con los papas cuando eran niños trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre su negocio y en la finca para la que presta sus servicios este préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio comprará alimento para los cerdos actuales y comprara más lechones para incrementar la producción, para con ello mejorar su calidad de vida, el señor Julio agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Julio lives in San Miguel de Los Bancos, a canton with a warm and humid climate. It is full of friendly and hardworking people who give a nice welcome to both domestic and foreign tourists who visit this place in order to enjoy the lovely scenery and places of rests, including the beautiful inns located along the Florida Santo Domingo Road.

In this canton, Sr. Julio lives in the small neighborhood called San Pedro where he also has his business. He is a 53-year-old man who is in a solid common-law relationship with his wife. She does not work, but she spends her time at home and helps with the business. They have eight children, with the oldest being 28 and the youngest being 11.

Sr. Julio and his wife raise pigs. When they were younger, both of them engaged in this type of work with their parents. Julio works approximately 10 hours a day at his business and at a farm where he provides his services. This loan will be invested in his business so that he can buy feed for the pigs that are currently under his care. He will also buy more piglets in order to increase production and improve his quality of life. Sr. Julio is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Mayawati

texts.en:
Mayawati runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. Mayawati lives in Cianjur, a semi-urban area about four hours from Jakarta. Mayawati is married and lives with four persons in the family home. In the picture is her husband.

Mayawati began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has around $10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). She took a loan to buya  printer from Kiva to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payment).

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process bill payments

loans.name: Jaya Maa Jhariguda Shg Group

texts.en:
Jasobanti is a 50-year-old lady living in the small village named Ghantasola in the Kalahandi district. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Jasobanti. She is in the afternoon of her life, but still she does not lose her hope or her inner strength of doing something to support her family. She has two children. Her husband, Judhistira, works at a farm as a farmer. She decided to earn money and gathered some women from her village to form a Self Help Group with the help of People's Forum (Kiva's field partner). She succeeded and became the president of her group. Now she is earning and she is a small business lady who invests her money in an agri-allied farm. At this stage, she is supporting her family as an independent person.

She has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farming. She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders across the world for this kind help and support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetable farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Nyakisi Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Felesta, in blue with her hand raised, is a member of a village bank group. She is 56 years old and the mother of six. She started her business selling beer, soda and sugar from the money she earned from agricultural work, her primary activity.

Felesta’s business is expanding, yet faces several challenges: a lack of capital to buy more varieties of drinks, customers who fail to pay their debts, plus competition from other similar businesses. Her group is applying for a 7,000,000 UGX loan to be divided among its members. With her portion she will buy more beer, soda and sugar to sell.

Felesta’s aspiration is to own a large retail shop so she can make a better income.

loans.use: to buy more beer, soda and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Marìa Ofelia

texts.es: Con 49 años de edad Ofelia es una mujer alegre con su negocio, ella vive con su esposo y un hijo,  Ofelia se dedica a la ganadería desde que tenía 15 años y juntamente con su esposo dan el correcto cuidado a su ganado, con el crédito va a comprar una vaca ya que dice que la ganadería es la fuente de ingreso de su familia desde mucho tiempo, lo que esta señora aspira es incrementar su negocio y salir adelante con su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en: At age 49, Ofelia is a woman happy with her business.  She lives with her husband and son.  Ofelia has been raising livestock for 15 years and she and her husband give the proper care to their animals.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a cow because she says that livestock has been their source of family income for a long time.  She wants to grow her business and get ahead with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Luz tiene una despensa bien surtida en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a la costura, confección y arreglo de ropas nuevas y usadas. Como le iba bien en este rubro, todo lo que logro juntar lo quiso invertir en una despensa, fue así como hace cuatro años empezó a cargar su pequeña despensa, en lo que hoy le está yendo muy bien.
Actualmente le está yendo bien tanto en la despensa como en rubro de la costura y lleva ambos negocios con mucha dedicación.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de aceite, jabón en polvo, golosinas, gaseosas, enlatados, etc., con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas en la despensa.
texts.en:
Luz has a well-stocked grocery store in San Lorenzo.  She is a widow, has four children and has been sewing and making and repairing new and used clothing for many years.  When things were going well in this trade, she saved everything she could to invest into her grocery store.  Four years ago she began stocking her small store and things are going well for her now.

Things are going well for her now, both in the store and tailoring, and she is very dedicated to both businesses.

She is asking for this loan to buy cooking oil, powdered soap, snacks, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. so she continue making sales in her grocery store.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Josué Eliseo

texts.es:
Josué tiene la edad de 24 años. Estudio hasta 5º grado de educación básica, esta acompañado. Tiene 2 niños, su compañera de vida se dedica a la venta de pupusas, él por su parte se dedica a la venta de pan, quien cada mañana sale a distintos lugares a vender. Este negocio lo ejerce desde ya casi 6 meses; en el cual esta asociado con un amigo que es quien elabora el pan. Josué un hombre emprendedor y esmerado por salir adelante, necesita el efectivo del crédito para la compra de una motocicleta, la cual le servirá para transportarse con mayor facilidad a la hora de vender su producto. Pues a él le ha tocado alquilar una motocicleta para salir a vender y con esta ayuda ya la tendrá propia sin necesidad de estar alquilándola. 

A futuro  Josué desea tener una casa propia, que le brinde la comodidad y la seguridad para su familia. Él tiene la seguridad que si sigue trabajando de la mejor manera y con todo el empeño posible alcanzara sus metas, para darles un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Josué is 24 years old. He completed school through the fifth grade and is in a relationship. He has two children and his life partner works selling pupusas. For his part, he sells bread, which he does in various locations every morning. He's been working at this business now for almost six months with his friend and business partner who makes the bread. 

Josué is an enterprising and dedicated man. To advance his life, he needs this loan to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to get around more easily when he's making his sales. Up to now, he's had to rent a motorcycle to make his sales, but with this support he'l be able to buy is own and won't have to rent anymore. 

In the future, Josué dreams of having his own house, which will provide his family with comfort and safety. He is certain that if he keeps doing his best with all the determination he has, he can achieve his goals of making a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jessica Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es una joven llamada jessica alejandra de 18 años, que quiere salir adelante en el en el transcurrir de la vida, actualmente se encuentra  cursando el grado once en un colegio distrital y los sábados estudia en un instituto al sur de Bogotá, en el cual cursa el segundo semestre de enfermería, es un gran esfuerzo que esta joven hace  para poder sacar buenas notas y así poder presentar el examen en la universidad nacional, donde quiere continuar los estudios en medicina y así ayudar con los conocimientos a todas las personas que la rodean. 
Pues es muy importante para esta joven y para la familia el estudiar una carrera tan importante como la enfermería, y como lo había dicho anteriormente el sueño de esta joven y con ayuda de los estudios es poder presentarse a la nacional para seguir la carrera en medicina y poder conseguir un buen trabajo para ayudar a la gente que la rodea y a la familia, necesita la ayuda de kiva Porque realmente ella no tiene el suficiente presupuesto que se necesita para poder costear lo que en estos momentos está estudiando, de no poder costear esto se verá obligada a retirarse de los estudios, pues ya que es imposible que trabaje mientras cursa el ultimo año en el colegio, como verán es realmente importante para ella, ya que es un planteamiento para el futuro
texts.en:
This young woman is Jessica Alejandra. She is 18 years old and wants to get ahead in life. She is currently finishing the 11th grade at a district high school. On Saturdays, she studies at an institute in southern Bogota where she is in her second semester of nursing. It is a great achievement for this young woman to get good grades so that she can take the national university exam, which would enable her to continue her studies in medicine and help her with the knowledge she gains from everyone around her.

It is very important for this young woman and her family that she study for a degree in a vital field, such as nursing, since she said that this was a dream of hers. With the help of her studies, she will be able to present herself to the national university so that she can continue to pursue a degree in medicine and obtain a good job. This would enable her to help the people around her and her family.

Jessica needs assistance from Kiva because she does not have sufficient resources at the moment to afford the cost of her studies. Otherwise, she would be obligated to drop out of the program. It is impossible for her to work since she is currently finishing her last year of high school, an accomplishment that is very important to her and would help with her plans for the future.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Saroeurn is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school. She covers her daily cost of living via rice cropping and sesame farming on two hectares each of farmland. She has been involved in her current business for ages. Saroeurn has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles, including this one, with a successful repayment of her past loan that enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, she leads a big group consisting of five members, and she is the leader. For Saroeurn, she will use her portion of loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for labor fees. She hopes that she will gain good crop yield better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil, and meats, among others.

loans.name: Savina

texts.es:
Savina está feliz por el anterior préstamo pues le fue muy bien y ha podido incrementar el capítal del negocio. Ella continúa viviendo en la comunidad de Mojopata y sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Ella continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para fumigar sus campos agrícolas.

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Savina is very pleased with her previous loan because it turned out very well and it helped to increase her business capital. She continues to live in the community of Mojopata and is still involved in agriculture and raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.

Savina is still a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to pay the cost of fumigating her farmland. Savina appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to handle her monthly payments with great responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba, Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to pay the cost of fumigating her farmland.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Dary  quien tiene 30 años y está estudiando salud oral en CAMPO ALTO, ella le gusta cantar y bailar, a la edad de 12 años empezó a trabajar y el gran sueño ha sido ser una excelente profesional en salud oral es la ilusión con la que  ha podido vencer muchos de los obstáculos,  le ha tocado emplearse en oficios varios para poder sacar los estudios de secundaria adelante, ya que proviene de una familia muy humilde y de  escasos recursos económicos.
Actualmente y gracias a la perseverancia y actitud positiva, con muchas dificultades económicas, ya que es madre soltera de un menor de siete años que con el esfuerzo y ardua lucha mantiene estudiando la primaria, por consiguiente vive en un municipio de oriente de Cundinamarca el cual para poder venir a cumplir con las labores académicas todos los domingos los gastos son de $50.000 pesos en cada viaje, ya que el trayecto en distancia es de 3 horas en bus. Durante la semana trabaja de forma informal  para poder llevar el sustento del hijo y poder cumplir con los pagos del semestre, cabe aclarar que vive en una pieza donde duerme con el hijo y cocina en el mismo lugar.
Debido a esto manifiesta que tiene el deseo de adquirir el subsidio con kiva ya que los ingresos no le alcanzan para poder sostenerse en la carrera y así poder lograr el sueño de Auxiliar en Salud Oral.
texts.en:
She is Luzy Dary, she is 30 years old and is studying Oral Hygiene in Campo Alto. She likes to sing and dance, at 12 years old she started working and her big dream has been to be an excellent professional in Oral Hygiene. This hope has helped her overcome many obstacles. She has worked various jobs to be able to do her higher education, as she comes from a very humble family of scarce economic resources.

Now, thanks to perseverance and a positive attitude, with many financial difficulties, she is a single mother of a young child of seven years old, and with effort and fervent struggling, she keeps her child in school. This is why she lives in the east municipality of Cundinamarca, from where to be able to come and do her academic studies every Sunday, the costs are $50.000 pesos each trip, as the journey takes 3 hours by bus.

During the week, she does casual work to be able to provide for her son and be able to pay the fees for the semester. She wants to make it clear that she lives in a room where she sleeps with her son and they cook in the same space.

She wants to get a Kiva loan, as her income is not enough to be able to continue her studies, and to reach her dream of becoming an Oral Hygiene Assistant.

loans.use: to pay one semester of tuition.

loans.name: Kekafile Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KEKAFILE sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOUSSEGUELA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  MINATA   (1ère sur la photo de la gauche  à la droite) compte acheter avec son prêt 1 colis de condiments. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché , à la maison et de  façon ambulante  dans la ville de  TOUSSEGUELA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à TOUSSEGUELA et à KOLONDIEBA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kekafile group are married women who on average are 36 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Tousseguela, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their first loan with the institution and fully intend to reimburse it.

Ms. Minata (first in the photo from left to right) will use her loan to buy one package of condiments. She sells daily at the market, from her home and as an itinerant vendor in the city of Tousseguela.

She is very sought after, especially on fair days. She resupplies in Tousseguela and Kolondiéba, and sells for cash and sometimes on credit to a mixed clientele. 

She expects to achieve an average monthly profit of 5,000 CFA francs. These profits will enable her to reimburse the loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new clothes

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from Hovq village where she lives with her husband and two sons (ages 15 and 13 years old). 
The family is involved in agriculture. They keep a livestock (cow, calves, pig, piglets, chickens and colonies of bees) as well as grow fruit trees (plum, nut, grape, apple and fig).
Lusine's farm is successful enough and provides her with stable monthly income for her and her family's living. Now, by applying for this loan of USD 1500 Lusine would like to increase her livestock by three more calves. 
She will be very grateful if lenders support her farming business and help to develop it further.

loans.use: to pay for three calves

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KOTOTALA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOUSSEGUELA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  KADIATOU  (1ère sur la photo de la gauche  à la droite) compte acheter avec son prêt 4  gros colis de condiments. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché, à la maison et de  façon ambulante  dans la ville de  TOUSSEGUELA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à TOUSSEGUELA et à KOLONDIEBA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kototala group are married women who on average are 35 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Tousseguela, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their seventh loan with the institution and fully intend to reimburse it.

Ms. Kadiatou (first in the photo from left to right) will use her loan to buy four large packages of condiments. She sells daily at the market, from her home and as an itinerant vendor in the city of Tousseguela.

She is very sought after, especially on fair days. She resupplies in Tousseguela and Kolondiéba, and sells for cash and sometimes on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to achieve an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs. These profits will enable her to reimburse the loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Kevin Sebastián

texts.es:
Kevin Sebastian nació en el año 1997, en la niñez hubieron algunos inconvenientes tales como problemas de salud  y muchas otras, la mama maría era una persona que se esforzaba por todos los medios de sacar a el hijo adelante, ya que el hijo presentaba problemas de salud, pero todo esto se detuvo hasta los 4 años de edad del joven Kevin. 
Una doctora en el hospital  fue la que logro detener los problemas de salud que tenia Kevin, así fue como el paso a tener una vida mejor. 
Después a la edad de los 6 años la hermana sufrió una enfermedad llamada, la cual no le permite controlar movimiento de la cintura para abajo. A la vez ella perdió la movilidad en los pies, tras varios tratamientos no parecía alentarse y empezaba a deprimirse, pero Kevin a pesar de la corta edad no la dejaba sola, empezó a subirle el ánimo y poco a poco se encontró un doctor el cual pudo aliviarla, desafortunadamente no completamente, así que a pesar de todos los inconvenientes que Kevin a tenido en la vida a podido salir como todas las personas en la vida. 
Estudio en barios colegios y como en la vida le ha tocado enfrentarse con cosas como enfermedades, entre otras Sobre Kevin nació un motivo y unas ganas por la salud. Así el quiso ser doctor, es la meta y la quiere cumplir, ayudar como lo ayudaron a él. 
Kevin se entero del convenio con kiva y le pareció una buena ayuda económica para el y la mama, ya que el valor al pagar las cuotas seria un poco mas económico  y se puede economizar un poco de dinero.
texts.en:
Kevin was born in 1997.  When he was little, he had to cope with various difficulties, such as health problems among other things.  His mother did all she could to help him get along.  When he was four a doctor in the hospital discovered how to cure his illness and he went on to have a better life.

However, when he was six, his sister suffered a serious illness in which she lost all mobility from her waist down, including her ability to move her feet.  She didn’t respond to any treatment and started to get depressed.  Although Kevin was only small, he never left her alone and always tried to make her feel better.  They eventually found a doctor who could treat her illness in some way; however, she has never fully recovered.  So despite all the difficulties he has been faced with, Kevin has managed to grow up to become a normal young man.

He has studied in various schools and as he has had to face lots of health problems in his past, he was always maintained an interest in working in the health sector.  He wants to be a doctor and be able to help people like he was helped when he was small.

Kevin found out about Kiva and he thought it would provide his mother with financial help as the installments are easier for her to pay.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of higher education.

loans.name: Gnetaga Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe GNETAGA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  37 ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOUSSEGUELA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme KADIATOU  (4ème assise sur la photo de la gauche  à la droite) compte acheter avec son prêt 2 colis de condiments. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché, à la maison et de  façon ambulante  dans la ville de TOUSSEGUELA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à TOUSSEGUELA et à KOLONDIEBA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Gnetaga group are married women who on average are 37 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Tousseguela, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so they can carry out their activities at any time. They are on their first loan with the institution and fully intend to reimburse it.

Ms. Kadiatou (the fourth person sitting from left to right in the photo) will use her loan to buy two packages of condiments. She sells daily at the market, from her home and as an itinerant vendor in the city of Tousseguela.

She is very sought after, especially on fair days. She resupplies in Tousseguela and Kolondiéba, and sells for cash and sometimes on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to achieve an average monthly profit of 10,000 CFA francs. This profit will enable her to reimburse the loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa de 37 años, estudio hasta quinto grado, es mamá soltera de  tres hijas, las cuales dos están estudiando  Con Rosa solo viven sus tres hijas, dos hermanos y la mamá pero de ella solo dependen sus tres hijas.

Rosa posee, un negocio de venta de pan desde hace ya 11 años.  Antes solo le ayudaba a otras personas que tenían panadería a prepararlo, este negocio lo aprendió cuando estaba de ayudante en las otras panaderías, cuando aprendió este oficio ella decidió poner su propio negocio en su casa. En este negocio solo trabaja ella y su hermano  que juntos aprendieron el oficio de hacer el pan , su horario es de las 3 de la mañana a las 7 de la mañana que salen las personas que han busca que le vendan el pan.

 El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar mil ladrillos, 7 bolsas de cemento y unas láminas para construir una habitación para colocar ahí la maquinaria de la panadería. 

Su sueño, es poseer un local más grande y un negocio de panadería muy surtido que le genere mas ingresos y sacar sus hijas adelante ya que una de ellas, esta estudiando  en el instituto y quiero darle el estudio que sea una profesional esto lo lograra con todo su esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37, studied until fifth grade.  She is a single mother with three daughters who are studying at present.  She lives with her daughters, two brothers and her mother.  However, only her children depend on her for financial support.

Rosa has been selling bread for 11 years.  She worked before as an assistant in bakeries and after learning about the business; she decided to set up on her own, working from home.  She works with her brother who learnt the trade with her.  They work from three in the morning until seven, when the customers start coming to buy the bread.  

She is asking for a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy a thousand bricks, seven bags of cement and some corrugated sheets to build a room where she can house her baking equipment.

She dreams of having a bigger place for her business and being able to offer a wider range of food which would help her to earn more income and support her children.  She wants to be able to offer her daughters a good education and is prepared to work hard to do it.

loans.use: to buy 1000 bricks, 7 bags of cement and some corrugated sheets to build a room for some baking equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for her workshop and spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia grows and harvest coconut, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband works in a private company as driver  . She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she had to oversee her tenants as well as her crops. For twenty years, she earns well from this and had provide her family.

Cecilia is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement.  In the future,she wants to improve their house  to live comfortably.  She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion was separated from her husband and she lives with her four children. She prepares snacks and vend it in their village to make  a living. For many years in selling snacks, she had maintain the tastes and sustain it for she had no other way of earning income for her family. To improve the business, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients to prepare burger for sale.She hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare burger for sale

loans.name: Diana Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia Diana Mercedes trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Diana Mercedes works in her restaurant. She makes different dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soup and stir-fry meat dishes. She works from 10am to 5pm. She has been in this business for 7 years and it is going well. Her dreams is to expand the restaurant. She is asking for a loan to buy products for cooking such as chicken, meat vegetables.

She is happy to get a loan and she promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: buy products to cook such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is a farmer living in Kisii area of Nyanza Kenya(an area known for the growth of bananas and sugarcane).She is married and has 3 children all of school going age.She has been doing farming for 3 years with her primary source of income being milk,eggs,crops including bananas,sugarcane.Her biggest challenge is lack of insufficient capital for expanding her farming projects.
Edina chose Juhudi Kilimo because of their fair interest rate.During the training,she learnt how to develop a savings culture.This loan will enable her to get a dairy cow that will increase in milk production and it will be used to bring in more income and also for consumption by her family.

loans.use: For purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita has been selling their farm products in their village aside from her general store. She supplies fruits and vegetables in the market which she acquired from her own farm. She wants better education for her only child.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer and seeds.  She wants to expand her farm to ensure a better source of income for the family. Juanita hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Doris Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doris de 29 años de edad, es universitaria es licenciada en contaduría pública,   madre soltera  de una una hija de 8 años de edad. Ella vive sola con su hija en la casa.

Doris es propietaria de un negocio de papelería frente a un centro escolar, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años.  Ella se dedicó a esto porque vive frente a un centro escolar y ve que ahí si puede haber ingresos para la familia; pero también Doris trabaja como contadora en una Institución que se encarga de capacitar jóvenes con diversos temas en las comunidades,  ella trabaja en la oficina de lunes a viernes de las 8 am a las 5 pm,  pero en el negocio le ayuda una prima y una hermana le cuida la niña cuando ella está trabajando.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar papelería que necesaria en la librería y también quiere implementar la venta de zapatos ahí  en la zona,  ya que el local lo tiene en una zona donde hay muchos visitantes esto lo lograra con los ingresos que tenga del trabajo y con las ganancias que el negocio me le genere. Así también le da trabajo a su  prima y a otras personas más.  

Los sueños de Doris con el sacrificio y el trabajo de todo es poner  un ciber y una zapatería ya que ahí frente a la escuela le queda muy bien ese ciber,  así le va a generar muchos ingresos y enviar a su  hija  a la universidad, cuando crezca y darle una mejor vida que se prepare de igual forma que lo hiso ella con mucho sacrificio.
texts.en:
Doris, 29, graduated from university with a degree in public accounting.  She is a single mother with a daughter who is 8 years old.  She lives alone with her daughter in her house.

Doris has a stationery shop in front of a school, which she has had for four years.  This business provides her with an income for her family.  She also works as an accountant in an organization that helps young people in different areas in the community.  She works in the office from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.  When she is in this job, a cousin helps her out with her shop and one of her sisters looks after her daughter.

The loan she is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy stationery supplies she needs in her shop and in addition, she would also like to set up a shoe-selling business in the area.  She has her shop in a place where there are a lot of visitors and she would set up this new venture with the income she receives from her other jobs.  She would be able to give her cousin and other people a permanent job.

Doris dreams of setting up this shoe shop and also a type of cyber-café, as she thinks that in front of the school it would be very successful.  With a lot of hard work she will be able to earn enough to provide for her daughter so she can have an education like the one she was given as a child.

loans.use: to buy paper supplies for her stationery shop and also to set up a shoe-selling business in the area.

loans.name: Aurelle Diaz's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aurelle Diaz (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 27 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau universitaire. Aurelle Diaz est mariée à un certain Aimé. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Aurelle Diaz vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par Aurelle Diaz et son mari. C’est pour cette raison Aurelle Diaz vend des mèches depuis dix ans environ dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Aurelle Diaz vend aussi des cartes de recharges et des tissus.Aurelle Diaz s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Aurelle Diaz ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Aurelle Diaz (seen with her hand raised in the photo).  She is 27 years old and attended school up to university level.  She is married to Aimé and the couple live with their two children, who both attend school.  Between them, Aurelle Diaz and her husband provide for the needs of their family.

Aurelle Diaz has been selling hair extensions locally for around ten years.  She also sells pre-paid phone cards and fabric.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin, and also in Togo.  In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a second loan with the field partner, Alidé.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and fabric for resale.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en: Nargiza is 50 years old married woman, from village Taleri. She lives with her husband, pensioner father-in-law and son, who is temporarily unemployed. Nargiza and her husband are extensively engaged in agricultural activities, particularly in cattle, goats and milked-cow breeding, in beekeeping, in cultivating a plot of agricultural land, where nuts are grown. Nargiza sells nuts and milk products locally and has her own costumers. She is hard-worker, who takes much effort in reaching her goal, to ensure her family in good living condition. Nargiza also has small stationary store near the village school and generates some income. 5 years ago Nargiza was involved in making lemonade in glass bottles and couldn't compete with the lemonade output in plastic bottles. Now she requested a money for purchasing the installation for producing lemonade in plastic bottles, that is more profitable and Nargiza will be able to generate significant income. She will be really grateful for the help Kiva lenders could provide, as Nargiza will be involved in very profitable business and greatly increase her family's living condition.

loans.use: To start producing lemonade in plastic bottles

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
María de 55 años de edad, es maestra y  madre soltera en la relación procreo dos hijas una de ellas está en la universidad y la otra ya se casó. María vive con la  hija soltera,  una hermana y la nieta,  por lo tanto solo la nieta y la hija dependen de ella. 


María solo se dedica a dar clases en la escuela desde hace 16 años,  ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque le gusta enseñarle a las persona los conocimientos obtenidos. El trabajo le queda a una distancia de 30 minutos,  viaja en bus y tiene el horario de las 7:30 am a las 4 pm  

Con el préstamo solicitado comprara una computadora a la hija,  ya que la que tenia se le arruino y se le ha presentado esa necesidad de adquirirla.  El préstamo para que su hija pueda tener la computadora,  ya que la hija está estudiando tercer año de docente en la universidad Nacional y la necesita para los deberes que ahí le dejan esto ayudara mucho ya que con los créditos les ayudan muchos en las emergencias a las personas.

Los sueños de María es que su hija termine la universidad y que sea profesional como  ella lo ha anhelado,  ya que hoy en día hay que preparar  mucho los hijos con un nivel académico superior para que en la vida se puedan defender.
texts.en:
Maria, 55, is a teacher and a single mother.  She has got two children, one at university and the other is married.  She lives with her single daughter, a sister and the sister’s granddaughter.  Both the daughter and the granddaughter count on her for financial support.

Maria has been teaching in the school for 16 years.  She decided to study to become a teacher because she enjoys teaching people what she has learnt.  Her work is a 30-minute bus ride from her home and she works from 7.30 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon.  

With the loan she is asking for, she will buy a computer for her daughter, because the one she had before is broken and she needs a new one.  Her daughter is studying in the third year at the university and she needs it for her homework assignments.  This loan will help her a lot, as they do many people who are in urgent need of financial help.

Maria dreams of seeing her daughter finish university and become a professional like she always wanted to be.  She believes that nowadays, you have to prepare your children with a high level of education so that they can get along in life.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouma est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Produits Cosmétiques ; Légumes, Tissus, Farine, Savon et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Kadiatou 1 ère assise de la gauche vers la droite est  vendeuse de Légumes (Banane Plantain). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure des bananes plantains  au grand marché. Elle les vend à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabougnouma comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadiatou compte réaliser  135 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabougnouma is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 38 years of age, are married and have at least four children.

This group of women trade diverse items such as cosmetics, vegetables, fabrics, flour, soap and various other items. To expand their activities, members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their second group loan.

Kadiatou (first sitting from left to right) sells vegetables (plantains). She intends to use her loan to buy plantains as the need arises at the big market. She sells them from her home and at the market to a diverse clientele.

While other members of the Sabougnouma group expect to achieve an average profit of 120,000 CFA francs each over this loan cycle, Kadiatou expects to achieve 135,000 CFA francs.

In addition to repaying the loans, they use part of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their stock-in-trade. They want to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to ensure adequate stock levels.

loans.use: buy plantains

loans.name: Annielle's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Annielle (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 37 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Annielle est mariée à un certain Vincent. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisés et à leur charge. Annielle vit avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par Annielle et son mari. Pour ce faire Annielle vend des produits vivriers depuis dix ans environ dans sa région. Annielle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Annielle ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Annielle (seen in the photo with her hand raised).  She is 37 years old and attended school up to secondary level.  Annielle is married to Vincent and the couple live with their child, who currently attends school.  Between them, the couple provide for the needs of their household.

Annielle has been selling food products locally for around ten years.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.  Annielle and the other members of the group would like to strengthen their businesses so they have requested a second loan from the field partner, Alidé.  The previous loan was fully and correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en: Marlita has been running her grocery store while her husband does farming to make a living. with her generated revenue from the business, her previous loan used in buying more stocks was successfully repaid. To increase sales, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods for sale. Marlita wants to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita manages a crab production business in their village and her husband does fishing too to make a living. With her generated income from the business, she had successfully repay her previous loan used for buying more sea foods. To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional seafood for sale. She is always working toward her great ambition of improving the living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seafood for sale

loans.name: Quipus Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “QUIPUS” iniciará el vigésimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, elaboración de cotillones, venta de verduras, instalación de sistemas electrónicos, elaboración de bordados, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de artículos de automóviles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace dios y ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de bordados; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde adquirio las estrategias de este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hilos por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de las fronteras Bolivia - Perú y posteriormente a la elaboración lo en las comunidades del Departamento de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella está casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y el crédito que ofrece la institución y las amigas de su banca.

En al imagen podemos identificar que una socia esta ausente, ya que se fue a su negocio con urgencia.
texts.en:
The QUIPUS Communal Bank will start its 25th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo II Centre. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors where Sonia serves as president. The members’ businesses include: clothing sales, party favor sales, fruit sales, installing electrical systems, embroidery, cosmetic sales, food sales and car parts sales. 

This loan will help their small businesses, including Sonia's. She says that 18 years ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of a friend who was a member of the institution. Now she has an embroidery workshop, she says that she learnt this trade from a previous job, where she picked up the tools of the trade.

She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy fabric wholesale, which she will get in the fairs on the Bolivia-Peru border, and after creating products she will sell them in her sales space. This kind of work allows her to make the income to support her family, as she is married and has two children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training and the loans that the institution offers and the friends from her bank.

In the photo, we can verify that one member is absent, as she had to go to her business urgently.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Villy

texts.en: Villy has been selling their farm products like copra in town aside from her husband's income from driving. Her children were still studying in their elementary and secondary  grades and she had to earn for their needs. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She wants to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family. Villy hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn, a mother of three, when her husband works as a company driver has been operating their own farm to make a living. With her generated income, she was able to provide her family and was successfully repay her previous loan used for weeding and fertilization of farm. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer in order to boost the farm to gain more farm produce. In the future, Arlyn wants to make improvements to her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mbene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe de 3 femmes, a été crée le 16 novembre 2010. Les femmes qui le compose font du commerce comme activité principale et entretiennent de bonnes relations.
Mbéne debout à droite de la photo est âgée e de 62 ans. Elle est veuves et mère de 5 enfants, dont 3 garçons. 
Avec le prêt elle compte acheter 10 sacs de café à 20000f le sac. Elle revend le café en détail et le sac peut lui revenir à 22500f.
Les objectifs visés par ses bénéfices est de venir en aide à ses enfants, de subvenir à leurs besoins.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' loan association to which this group of three women belongs, was created on 16 November 2010. The women who make up the group are mainly retail traders and maintain good relations.

Mbene (standing on the right of the photo) is 62 years old. She is a widow and the mother of five children, of whom three are boys. 

With the loan she intends to buy 10 bags of coffee at 20,000 francs a bag. She then retails the coffee and can make up to 22,500 francs a bag.

The profits will serve the objective of helping her children meet their needs.

loans.use: buy coffee

loans.name: Conforte's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EDJROMAHU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Conforte (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Conforte est mariée à un horloger du nom de Germain. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Conforte vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par Conforte et son mari. Pour ce faire Conforte vend du pain depuis vingt ans environ dans sa région. De façon secondaire Conforte  vend aussi divers produits. Conforte s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Conforte ensemble avec les membres du groupe EDJROMAHU sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Edjromahu Group is made up of three women who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Conforte (seen in the photo with her hand raised).  She is 36 years old and did not attend school.  She is married to Germain, who is a watchmaker, and they live with their four children who all attend school.  Between them, the couple provide for the needs of their family.

Conforte has been selling bread locally for around twenty years, and she also sells various other products.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.  Conforte and the other members of the group would like to strengthen their businesses, so they have requested a second loan from the field partner, Alidé.  The previous loan was correctly and fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy bread for resale.

loans.name: Sreten

texts.en: Sreten wants to thank all of the lenders for his loan, which he used to purchase construction materials in order to finish his house. With the completion of his renovations finally, he has managed to improve the living conditions for his family, which was and continues to be very important to him. He is still working as a teacher and is the main source of income for his family. Due to the satisfaction he had with the loan and the loan process, he is asking for a second loan now in order to purchase 2 cows and food for them. He is planning on selling the milk and milk products in order to add additional income to his family. He is very hard working and is always willing to do what he needs in order to care for his family’s needs. He would like to thank all of the lenders again.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows and food for them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Marcelline's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marcelline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 46 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Marcelline est mariée à un conducteur de moto du nom de Clautaire. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marcelline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges familiales sont supportées par Marcelline et son mari. C’est pour cette raison, Marcelline vend des plateaux d’œufs par la méthode de distribution depuis trois ans environ. Marcelline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Marcelline ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Marcelline is the representative of the group (the person raising her hand in the photo). She is 46 years old and attended school up to secondary level.

Marcelline is married to a motorcycle driver named Clautaire. The couple has six children, all attending or having attended school and who are their dependents. Marcelline lives with her ​​husband and children. Family expenses are shared by Marcelline and her husband.

For this reason Marcelline has been selling trays of eggs through the distribution method for the past three years. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets.

To bolster her business, Marcelline - along with the other group members - is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: buy trays of eggs

loans.name: Germaine's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNIGNIGBE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Germaine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Germaine est mariée à un certain Adolphe. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Germaine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par Germaine et son mari. Pour ce faire Germaine vend des œufs et des légumesà son domicile depuis trente ans. De façon secondaire Germaine vend aussi des boules d’akassa (pâte à base de farine de maïs fermenté), de l’igname frite. Germaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Germaine ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANGNIGNIGBE sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Wangnignigbe Group is made up of three women who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Germaine (seen in the photo with her hand raised).  She did not attend school, and is married to Adolphe.  The couple live with their four children, who all attend school.  Between them, they provide for the needs of their family.

Germaine has been selling eggs and vegetables from her home for thirty years.  She also sells 'boules d'akassa' (a thick paste made from fermented maize flour) and fried yam.  She buys her provisions at a market in Benin.

Germaine and the other members of the group would like to strengthen their businesses, so they have requested a second loan from the field partner, Alidé.  The previous loan was correctly and fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy eggs and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Brisas Group

texts.es:
Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Brisas”
Totonicapán is a busy highland town nestled in the mountains of the Sierra Madre Mountains in southwest Guatemala. Approximately 98% of the population are Mayan Kiche which is also the language that they speak. This town is renowned for textile production and when one travels to the weekly market, there are dozens of colorful and very beautiful “cortes” or typical skirts that the women wear. They also use this fabric to sew aprons and men’s shirts. There is a very high demand as the quality of the “cortes” or fabric is very high.
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Brisas” was formed in Totonicapán several years ago and is composed of nine women. They are requesting a new loan with Friendship Bridge and will use the funds to boost their textile production. The ladies are successful with their businesses and have watched their clientele increase in recent years. Happily, they are earning additional income and the standard of living for their families.
The current President of the Trust Bank is 25 year old Alicia who makes beautiful, high quality aprons. Alicia is from a large family and has nine siblings. She is able to contribute to the family expenses which means alot to her. This industrious young woman is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase additional fabrics. Her customers are very faithful to Alicia and love to purchase items from her. Alicia wants to take advantage of the high demand right now before Easter which is a huge celebration in Guatemala. But Alicia has bigger dreams and she just went back to high school to realize them. After graduating in the very near future, Alicia wants to attend college with the goal of being a lawyer. Her parents have been most supportive of her goals and she feels very fortunate.
On behalf of all the women n the Trust Bank, Alicia expresses gratitude to KIVA investors throughout the world. It is difficult and nearly impossible for a woman like Alicia to get a loan. Organizations like Friendship Bridge are a vital lifeline for impoverished women to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. The micro-credit program of Friendship Bridge, which not only includes loans but also educational trainings, offers them a most vital opportunity to face a brighter future benefiting themselves, their families and their town of Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Brisas”
Totonicapán is a busy highland town nestled in the mountains of the Sierra Madre Mountains in southwest Guatemala. Approximately 98% of the population are Mayan Kiche which is also the language that they speak. This town is renowned for textile production and when one travels to the weekly market, there are dozens of colorful and very beautiful “cortes” or typical skirts that the women wear. They also use this fabric to sew aprons and men’s shirts. There is a very high demand as the quality of the “cortes” or fabric is very high.
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Brisas” was formed in Totonicapán several years ago and is composed of nine women. They are requesting a new loan with Friendship Bridge and will use the funds to boost their textile production. The ladies are successful with their businesses and have watched their clientele increase in recent years. Happily, they are earning additional income and the standard of living for their families.
The current President of the Trust Bank is 25 year old Alicia who makes beautiful, high quality aprons. Alicia is from a large family and has nine siblings. She is able to contribute to the family expenses which means a lot to her. This industrious young woman is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase additional fabrics. Her customers are very faithful to Alicia and love to purchase items from her. Alicia wants to take advantage of the high demand right now before Easter which is a huge celebration in Guatemala. But Alicia has bigger dreams and she just went back to high school to realize them. After graduating in the very near future, Alicia wants to attend college with the goal of being a lawyer. Her parents have been most supportive of her goals and she feels very fortunate.
On behalf of all the women n the Trust Bank, Alicia expresses gratitude to KIVA investors throughout the world. It is difficult and nearly impossible for a woman like Alicia to get a loan. Organizations like Friendship Bridge are a vital lifeline for impoverished women to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. The micro-credit program of Friendship Bridge, which not only includes loans but also educational trainings, offers them a most vital opportunity to face a brighter future benefiting themselves, their families and their town of Totonicapán.

loans.use: Buy supplies to increase production of textiles

loans.name: Liberte De Petitanse Group

texts.fr:
Jacky est  le coordinateur de son groupe Liberte de Petitanse, Il est  marie et il a  2 enfants. Il habite dans la region nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l'éau portable est très limité.

Jacky dirige son commerce d'artisant pendant les 3 dernieres années. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Il vend de l'artisanat, ce prêt sera acheter des matières premières et des articles fabriqué.

Des autres membres de Liberte de Petitanse  ont besoin d’un  emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses,  produit alimentaires,  etc. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera a voyager dans les autres pays de l’amerique.
texts.en:
Jacky is the coordinator of the 'Liberte de Petitanse' Group.  He is married and has two children.  He lives in the north of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very scarce.  He has been running a craft business for the past three years, and hopes that this loan will help him to build his business.  He sells hand-made items, and will use his loan to buy raw materials and other items.

Other members of the group will use their loans for their retail businesses, such as cosmetic products, fizzy drinks and food products.

Jacky says that his aim is to increase the size of his business and be able to travel to other Latin American countries.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and other items for his craft business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: .buy pants, shirts etc. at wholesale prices

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva operates her own rice farm while her husband works as a welder in a private company to make a living. Her farm produce better income and with her revenue, she had successfully repay her previous loan used for farming. Aside from this, she had a piggery that she had managed. To improve it, she took a new loan to buy feeds. The profit from her farm will be used to improve their living situation and farm expansion.

loans.use: to purchase feeds

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Lydia (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 26 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Lydia est mariée à un électricien du nom de Jean Baptiste. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Lydia vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges familiales sont supportées par Lydia et son mari. C’est pour cette raison, Lydia exerce comme activité la coiffure de façon ambulante depuis cinq environ. Lydia fait aussi du pédicure manucure de la même façon. Lydia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Lydia ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Lydia is the representative of the group (the person raising her hand in the photo). She is 26 years old and and has not attended school.

Lydia is married to an electrician named Jean Baptiste. The couple has two children, both in school and under their care. Lydia lives with her ​​husband and children. 

Family expenses are shared between Lydia and her husband. For this reason Lydia has been active as an itinerant hairdresser for the past five years. She also provides manicure and pedicure services in the same manner. Lydia gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets.

To bolster her business, Lydia - along with the other group members - is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: buy nail polish

loans.name: Horongna Group

texts.fr:
Horongna est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Produits Cosmétiques ; Balais, Tissus, Couture et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe. 
Ramata  assise devant est une vendeuse de produits cosmétiques (Pommade, Savon et des portes monnaies). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter ces produits cosmétiques à Koutiala. Elle les vend à la maison et au marché à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Horongna comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Ramata compte réaliser  130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Horongna is a group of married women from Koutiala who live in large traditional families, with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They average 33 years of age and four children.

The women in this group sell various products, such as cosmetics, brooms, fabrics, notions, and others. In order to bolster their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their eighth group loan.

Ramata is the woman sitting in the front in the photograph. She sells cosmetics (balsam, soap, and wallets). She intends to use her loan to buy these products in Koutiala. She sells at her home and at the market, to a diverse clientele.

Whereas the other members of Horongna intend to turn an average profit of XOF 120'000 during this loan cycle, Mrs. Ramata intends to reach XOF 130'000.

In addition to repaying the loans, the women use part of their profits to cover personal expenses and increase their working capital. They wishes to strengthen their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to make sure they don't suffer from low stock.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Olga Valérie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Olga Valérie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Olga Valérie est mariée à un plombier nommé Franck. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisés et à leur charge. Olga Valérie vit avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par Olga Valérie et son mari. C’est pour cette raison, Olga Valérie vend des couches et des chaussures depuis deux ans environ. Olga Valérie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Olga Valérie ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Olga Valerie is the representative of the group (the person raising her hand in the photo). She is 36 years old and attended school up to secondary level.

Olga Valerie is married to a plunber named Franck. The couple has one child, who attends school and is under their care. Olga Valerie lives with her ​​husband and child.

Family expenses are shared by Olga Valerie and her husband. For this reason she has been selling disposable diapers and shoes for the past two years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin and in Togo.

To bolster her business, Olga Valerie - along with the other group members - is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: buy disposable diapers and shoes

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita  owns and operates a farm raising crops,planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over many years and earns well from this. With her income, her previous loan used for their farm was successfully repaid.Recently, she is requesting a new loan  to purchase fertilizer in order to improve the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Affoussatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Affoussatou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 41 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Affoussatou est mariée à un commerçant nommé Hermann. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisés et à leur charge. Affoussatou vit avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par Affoussatou et son mari. C’est pour cette raison, Affoussatou vend des produits vivriers (mil,sorgho, maïs) depuis trois ans environ. Affoussatou  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Affoussatou ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Affoussatou, is the woman raising her hand in the photograph. She's 41 years old, and has a middle school education level. She's married to a merchant named Hermann. They have one school-attending child in their care.

Affoussatou lives with her husband and child. The various family expenses are covered by her and her husband. For this reason, she's been selling food products (millet, sorghum, corn) for about three years.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. In order to bolster her business, Affoussatou, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy food products (millets, sorghum, corn)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy printing material and ink

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. Felicitas has been engaged in a rice-farming business for more than 20 years now. She helps her husband in tilling their farm. Felicitas is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield. In the future, Felicitas dreams of making her business a successful one.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the farm.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey thanks Kiva lenders for contributing to his previous loan. With the loan, he is now a proud owner of an expansive area on which he will build his residential house. He is applying for another loan that he will use to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm.

Since 2004, Joey has had a business growing rice for sale. He started this business with the hope of earning enough money to provide for the family's needs and pay the school fees for his children.

He is mainly challenged by the rainy season, which affects the farm negatively, but he believes that this will not be a challenge anymore if he boosts the fertility of the soils. 

Joey believes that in the long run, he will be able to earn enough money to provide for all the needs of his family, especially the educational needs of his children, so that they can compete favorably for jobs in the job market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: A citizen of the province of Battambang, Rat is a 32-year-old married mother of four. For her family, rice farming and paid working jobs are the main source of their income. She has had her rice-farming business for ages and it now returns to her nearly 20,000 KHR per day. This is a fourth-time loan for Rat and her co-borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Rat has fully repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 700,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for labor costs. Rat hopes to gain a good crop yield that will be better than in the past.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương has a retail business selling lagim. She is thirty years old and married with three children. Hương lives with her three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has already successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a latrine. Her family shares their neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system.

In the future, Hương hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet, bathroom and water filter system

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
 
Lina is a thirty-two-year-old married woman from Qalqilia city. She lives with her husband and four kids (three sons and one daughter) in a very simple house. Her husband has a used home appliances store. He buys used appliances from homes, repairs them and then resell them.

Lina took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband buy more used home appliance products to resell. By taking this loan, Lina's husband will be able to improve his store and also his income.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more used home appliances to resell

loans.name: Joveflor

texts.en: Joveflor has been working in her own farm to make a living. With her income, her needs meet and was successfully repay her previous loan used for the farm successfully. She always find ways to earn more farm produce . Without hesitation, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer . With this investment, Joveflor is assured to gain an abundant harvest in the future. She wants to have a better living situation with her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle and van. Her earnings were a big help in personal, household and business expenditures.
