She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain the tricycle unit. She will also use the money to pay for the maintenance of her van. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia hopes to be successful in business and dreams of having a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sheeting to improve the roof of his house

loans.name: Srey Noeun

texts.en:
Srey Noeun is thirty-six years old and living in a rural area of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She has been married for the past fifteen years but unfortunately does not have any children. Srey Noeun hopes that she will be blessed with a child one day. Srey Noeun is in the agricultural business of growing and selling rice. She runs this business with the support of her husband and sells soft drinks in her village to earn additional income.

With the purpose of improving her household income, Srey Noeun is asking for a loan of USD 1,000. She will add this to her existing savings to buy part of a mango plantation from a local farmer. She expects this to boost her earnings and profits when the mangos are ready to be collected for sales. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy part of a mango plantation from local farmer.

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en: Saroeurn is a rural villager located in Battambang province. She is a married mother of two school children. She tackles her family’s hardships via rice farming and her paid working job. She has been involved in her current business for ages and it has generated about 36,000 KHR for her. This is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to support her business and improve her livelihood at a gradual pace. Now, she leads the group consisting of two members to get a new loan. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Saroeum will spend her entire loan portion to pay land leasing fees. She hopes to achieve double the yield she had last year.

loans.use: pay land leasing fees

loans.name: Tsaguri

texts.en: Tsaguri, who is 62 years old pensioner woman, lives in village Rupoti. She lives with her pensioner husband, son, daughter-in-law and 2 small grandsons. Tsaguri's son is an artisan, gets private orders and monthly generates 280 GEL approximately. The family runs agricultural activity, particularly they have 2 milked cows, produce cheese and sell it locally. Also Tsaguri and her husband cultivate a plot of family owned vineyard, produce wine and sell it in local market. For further development, her business needs some investment as the income is insignificant for 6 members-family. With the requested money Tsaguri wants to set up poultry farm, purchase chickens and after growing them sell in a good price. This will be great support for this hard-working woman and her family, giving them chance to live better and increase the productivity. Tsaguri awaits your support.

loans.use: To set up poultry farm

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et  qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que le bois de chauffe, savons, poissons  et articles divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. 
Minata  1 ère debout de la gauche vers la droite est une vendeuse de bois de chauffe dans ce groupe Danaya.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Elle se procure de ces bois en brousse et dans les villages environnants de Koutiala. Elle les vend à la maison à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Minata compte réaliser  125 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women from Koutiala, who know each other well. They live in large traditional families, with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 34 years of age and have at least four children.

The women of this group sell various products, such as firewood, soaps, fish, and other items. To expand their businesses, the members of the group decided to join the loan program from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their seventh group loan.

Minata is the woman on the left in the photograph. She sells firewood and intends to use her loan to buy truckloads of firewood. She gets her supplies in the bush and in the villages surrounding Koutiala. She sells at her home to a diverse clientele. 

Whereas the other member of Danaya Group intend to turn an average profit of XOF 115'000 each during this loan cycle, Mrs. Minata intends to reach XOF 125'000.

In addition to repaying the loans, they will use part of their income to cover personal expenses and increase their working capital. The members of the group wishes to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to avoid low stock levels.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  Médine un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Awa fait la vente de tomate dans ce groupe de femmes Benkadi. Elle est débout en première position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  10 paniers de tomate pour la revente au détail sur place et à  Médine à une clientèle composée de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi group are married women, aged 52 on average and with an average of five children. Most of them live in traditional families in Médine, a working-class neighbourhood in the city of Sikasso (in the 3rd administrative region of Mali).

This is the group's fourth solidarity loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to satisfy customer demand.

Awa, a member of the Benkadi group and pictured on the far left, sells tomatoes. She will use her loan to buy 10 baskets of tomatoes to resell to individuals, mainly women, from home and in Médine. She sells her tomatoes for cash and on credit.

Awa expects to make 42,000 CFA francs a month on average, part of which will be used to repay the loan and interest, and part of which will go into her savings.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Issa,  né vers1970 à Nimporodioula, père de 11 enfants et marié, il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Médine un quartier populaire de le ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur Issa mène des activités d’achat et de vente de céréales  il y'a plus de 16 ans, il s'approvisionne dans les marchés des localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Il est à son neuvième prêt  avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Les prêts précédant ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 40 sacs de 100 kg de céréales, Après l’achat il les stocke durant un moment dans son magasin à domicile avant la revente. La vente s’effectue au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Issa was born in around 1970 in Nimporodioula, and is married and the father of 11. He lives at home with his wife in a traditional household in Médine, a working-class neighbourhood in the city of Sikasso (in the 3rd administrative region of Mali).

Issa has been buying and selling cereals for more than 16 years and buys his supplies in the village markets around Sikasso. 

Issa is requesting his ninth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to satisfy growing customer demand. He has repaid all the previous loans successfully.

This loan will help Issa buy 40 100-kg sacks of cereals. He then keeps the cereals in his store at home before reselling them. He sells his cereals at the market to a customer base that includes both men and women.

Issa hopes to make an average of 100,000 CFA francs a month. This will allow him to pay off the loan and interest, and the remainder will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Sokhna Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe de 3 femmes a été crée le 14 novembre 2009. Il regroupe des membres qui vivent dans le même quartier et ceux des environs. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaires entre elles. Leur principale est le commerce.
Binta, assise à droite de la photo et lavant la main est âgée de 64 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 8 enfants dont 4 garçons.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter des draps et des pagnes, qu'elle revend dans les grandes villes. Elle place ses marchandises chez ses clients et à la fin du mois elle passe récupérer l'argent. Elle réalise ainsi un bénéfices très conséquent, elle achète un drap à 8000f et revend à 12000f.
Avec les bénéfices, elle renforce son épargne dans le banc et prend en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
The banc villageois to which this group of three women belong was set up on 14 November 2009 and its members come from the same neighbourhood or the local area. 

The group members get on well and support each other in their businesses. Binta, pictured sitting on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 64 years old. She is a widow and the mother of eight children, four of whom are boys.

Binta will use the loan to buy sheets and traditional cloth pagnes, which she sells in the large towns. She passes her goods on to customers, and then returns at the end of the month to collect payment. In this way, she can make a good income: she buys a sheet for 8,000 CFA francs, and resells it for 12,000 CFA francs. 

Binta will use the money she makes to increase her savings at the banc villageois and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy sheets and pagnes.

loans.name: Juan Alexander

texts.es:
Juan de 32 años de edad,  es casado, padre de  cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos estudian cuarto grado, su nivel de estudios es de tercer grado,  porque por ayudar a su familia no pudo estudiar lo suficiente. Su esposa y sus hijos dependen completamente de él, directamente, su esposa solamente se dedica a cuidar a los hijos de ambos y a los oficios del hogar, él se dedica a la mecánica desde hace más de diez años, el trabajo lo aprendió porque un amigo le enseño, el camino de su casa hacia su trabajo esta a  unos cuatro kilómetros.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una motocicleta ya que por ocasiones sale  cansado y tarde de trabajar y con la motocicleta le será más fácil desplazarse hacia su hogar y trabajo, esto mejora su vida ya que tendrá más comodidad.

 Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y se superen, que tengan lo que él no pudo tener, como es el estudio ya que para él es muy importante superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 32, is married and has four children; two are in the fourth grade. He studied up to the third grade, when he had to quit studying in order to help his family. His wife and children depend on him. His wife works taking care of their children and of the household chores. Juan has been working as a mechanic for more than ten years, something he learned from a friend. He works about four kilometers from home.

He is requesting a loan at CREDICAMPO to buy a motorcycle. Sometimes he finishes  late and is too tired, so the motorcycle will make it easy for him to move between his house and his work. This will make his life more comfortable. He dreams of seeing his children finish their studies and progress, so that they can have what he could not have for himself, such as a good education, which he thinks is important to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en:
Nathalie is a 28 year-old married lady with no children, who has been working in her printing center and photocopy services shop for the past four years.  Nathalie is a sworn translator.  Her business is going on just fine especially since it is located next to the national university and such services are highly requested by almost all of the university students.

Nathalie is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner AL Majmoua to buy a special updated and new released photocopying machine that is necessary for her business development and to meet her customers' needs and requests.  Nathalie is very anxious about this loan, because it will help her in expanding her business and responding to the increasing number of customers' requests.

loans.use: To buy a special updated and new released photocopying machine that is necessary for her business development and responding to her customers' needs and requests

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thuý operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.  Thuý is 21 years old and she is married with 1 child.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thuý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  Thuý has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thuý has been involved in this business for 3 years.  The main hardship that Thuý faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family shares a neighbor's latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thuý hopes to maintain  a successful business, to build a new house, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.  His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan and he will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in his inventory.  The more items displayed at the store, the better.  More items to sell will result in more profits.  His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children.  He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Virgilio dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes his family is always in good health.  He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell this easter season.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en: Aseel is 20 years old.  She lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her family, which consists of 7 members.  Aseel is a university student majoring in history.  She is in her first year, which is the beginning of her study journey.  She is planning to work in her field after graduation to help her family financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis, which why they cannot help in paying her upcoming semester fees.  Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Shera  Bano

texts.en: Shera Bano is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Hajiran

texts.en: Hajiran is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been running a nursery business (plant sale outlet) with her husband. The man shown in the photo is Hajiran’s husband. They have been doing it together for the last eight years. She started her business with just a few plants to sell but as the time passed, she has made progress in her business and now enjoys a regular list of customers. For the growth of fresh flowers and plants, Hajiran has applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more seeds of different flowers and plants and packs of insecticides and pesticides. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history. She wishes to utilize part of revenues on the expansion of her business and wishes to spend the part of income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds of different flowers and plants and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been running business selling ‘samosa’. It is a fried or baked pastry with a savory filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, lentils or chicken.  She is expert in making good taste samosa and earns enough through this business to contribute in the family income. In order to inflate her sales she needs to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She wishes to spend the part of revenue on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school uniforms wholesale

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es: Catalino tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia  junto a su hermana y su sobrina. ÉL se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad y a la comercialización de plátanos, limones y cocos. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Catalino desea construir un pequeño cuarto para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera poder tener este financiamiento dado que no cuenta con los recurso económicos para hacer el desembolso. Confía que con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo logrará cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
Catalino, 41, lives in his own house with his sister and his niece.  He makes a living and supports his household by providing security services and selling bananas, limes, and coconuts.

Catalino wants to build a small room, so he's asking FUSAI for this loan to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood.  He hopes to be able to get the loan because he doesn't have the financial resources to make the payment.  He's confident he'll be able to repay the loan with the income he earns from his job.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal and wood

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. She is doing business selling wood, which is used in various purposes like furniture, papers and baskets. She has been efficiently doing this with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. They serve well in their community. She needs to have an increase in her earning to carry out everyday expenditures of her family. To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000. She will be using the loan to buy good quality wood in large quantity to cater to more customers. She wishes to use the part of profits on providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality wood in large quantity.

loans.name: Allaha  Rakhi

texts.en: Allaha Rakhi, age 38, is a married woman.  She has three children.  She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She is running business selling corns with her husband for many years. By the time she has become popular in her community and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she applied a loan of PKR 40,000. It will allow her to purchase stock of corns to resale.  She expects boost in her earnings through her larger sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase stock of corns.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 48-year-old married woman. She deals in business selling cloth. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Najma is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Najma expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en: Raheela is a 43-year-old married woman. She is running a business of boutique.  She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then after doing sewing sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of cloth, spools of threads and needles. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth, spools of threads and needles.

loans.name: Shahmeem

texts.en: Shahmeem, age 28, is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 38 years old and has eight children. Marivic is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marivic has been farming vegetables for 21 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Necita

texts.en:
Necita works hard to support her family. Necita is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Necita requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her sewing business.

Necita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Necita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her sewing business

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 36-year-old married woman. She deals in business selling cloth as she purchases variety of cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Currently she is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Nasaria

texts.en: Nasaria is 53 year old married woman. She has been doing business selling fruits and vegetables for the past two years. She is very enthusiastic lady and manages to earn reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of two children. She is responsible for their food, health and education. For the improvement for her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase sacks of apples, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Shfqat

texts.en: Shfqat is 35 years old married woman. She is been in business of beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over the time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She needs to deal more customers time after time. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities so she applied a loan of PKR 40,000 through Kashf Foundation.  She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en: Zubida is 58 years old married woman and the mother of 4 children. She initiated her business selling animals to support her family. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 40 years old married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Her son also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for a loan of PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is 42 year old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing a business selling vegetables for the past twenty years. He is very enthusiastic in his business of selling vegetables to earn reasonable amount of money to support his family.  They have seven children and are responsible for their food, health and education.  For the improvement of her husband’s business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and gingers. This will help her husband to meet market demand consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and gingers.

loans.name: Presetacion

texts.en:
Presetacion is 50 years old and married with eight children. With three children currently in school, Presetacion works very hard to provide for them.

Presetacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Presetacion has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Presetacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 50-year-old married woman.  For about 10 years she is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Al- Batool** 2 Group

texts.en:
Al- Batool**2 is a group that consists of four members. All of them are females living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.
Tahani is a 22-year-old single woman, living with her family in their old house. She is the leader of the group. Tahani is a university graduate, but due to the hard condition in the country, she couldn't find a job. Now, she is still unemployed. Tahani is very a ambitious woman and works very hard to improve the living condition of her family. Over time, their house became in miserable condition. It needs to be renovated and this needs a lot of money. The income of her father is not enough, therefore Tahani applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to help her family in renovating the house.
Tahani looks forward to finishing all the renovation of her house in order for it to be in better condition.

loans.use: to revonate the house.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 38, is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling bed sheets and covers for last two year. She purchases a variety of bed sheets in bulk from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality material in her community. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 50.000 from Kashf Foundation to buy variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy variety of bed sheets, covers and spreads.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz, age 33, is a married woman.  She deals in business of animals’ sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary business needs and accessories to expand her working sector and design more beautiful items to attract new customers and further develop her business.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his three siblings and his parents in Wihdat, Jordan. Alaa is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems. He is in his third year and is planning to work in his field of study after graduation. However, he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina works hard to support her family. Agustina is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Agustina requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Agustina has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Agustina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aissa

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois dont fait parti cette femme, a été crée le 28 décembre 2011.  Il regroupe des femmes très dynamiques qui font régner l'entente et la solidarité dans le banc. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Aissa est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère et 5 enfants dont 2 garçons. 
Avec le prêt elle va acheter un bœuf à 150000f qu 'elle va engraisser pour les revendre à 300000f. Elle aussi du commerce comme activité parallèle; elle va renforcer sa boutique en riz, sucre, savon et autres produits alimentaires.
Avec les bénéfices , elle va renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois et prendre en charge ses besoins et celui de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aissa is a member of a "banc villageois" which was created on the 28th of December, 2011. The "banc villageois" brings together very dynamic women who ensure an atmosphere of understanding and solidarity. Their main activity is retail.

Aissa is 59 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children, 2 of whom are boys. She will use part of this loan to buy a head of cattle for 150 000 francs, which she will fatten and resell for 300 000 francs. She also runs a shop and part of the loan will be used to increase her inventory of rice, sugar, soap and food products. She will use the profits to build her savings with the "banc villageois" and to take care of her needs and those of her children.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle and various products for her shop.

loans.name: Mbayang's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 femmes, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 23 mai 2002. 
Amy est âgée de 56 ans. Sur la photo elle est en position debout et a levé la main car étant elle la vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont une fille.
Avec le prêt elle va s'investir sur l'embouche et le commerce comme activité parallèle. Ainsi elle compte acheter 2 bœufs à 200000f chacun, 6 moutons à 25000f chacun. Elle va aussi acheter pour son commerce du riz, du sucre, de l'huile, des chaussures avec les 100000f.
Les bénéfices servent à renforcer son activité et satisfaire les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
This group of 7 women belongs to the "banc villageois" which was created on the 23rd of May, 2002.

Amy is 56 years old. As the featured borrower, she is standing and raising her hand in the picture. She is married and the mother of 6 children, one of whom is a girl. She will use this loan to invest in her livestock-fattening business and her retail activities. She plans to buy 2 head of cattle (at 200 000 francs each) and 6 sheep (at 25 000 francs each). She will also buy some rice, sugar, oil and shoes for her retail business with the other 100 000 francs. The profits will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 2 head of cattle, 6 sheep and various products for her retail business.

loans.name: Mbana

texts.fr:
Madame Mbana, âgée de 40 ans, s’active dans le commerce depuis plusieurs années. Elle a démarré avec ses économies au moment ou elle vendait de l’encens et cela lui a permis d’acheter des chaussures pour les revendre à crédit. L’argent récupéré, elle calcule un bénéfice qui l’incite à associer la vente de sacs à main.
Mbana habite avec ses parents, car elle est encore célibataire ; et elle donne une participation régulière pour la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Elle veut diversifier son activité et vendre des produits cosmétiques dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mbana is 40 years old and has been working in retail for several years. She started her business selling incense using her savings and was then able to buy shoes which she resold on credit. The profits she received from the sale of the shoes encouraged her to start selling handbags too.

Mbana lives with her parents as she is still single; she contributes regularly to the family's daily expenses. In the future, she would like to diversify her business and to sell beauty products.

loans.use: to buy handbags, shoes and incense for resale.

loans.name: Maisoon

texts.en:
Maisoon is 45 years old, married and has three children. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. She decided to start selling home products three years ago after she noticed the financial crisis her husband was facing. 

Maisoon requested a loan, which she will use to buy more home products and blankets in order to raise her income and sales.

loans.use: to purchase home products and blankets

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Alma has a broom making business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her broom making business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Alma has been in this business for 31 years. Alma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her broom making business

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is 25 years old young woman, from village Dzedzileti. She lives with her husband, father-in-law and grandmother, who gets monthly assistance from local government. The only source of family's income is from agricultural activity. Particularly, they engaged in cattle, cow and bull breeding, in producing cheese and selling it locally. They also cultivate a plot of agricultural land and entirely generate 300 GEL per month. Nino finds it hard to pay all daily expenses and meet basic needs with only this income and has great desire somehow to improve her family's style of living. She requested a money and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. She will use money for starting trading business with food products. Nino will buy products at wholesale prices and will sell door-to-door with family owned mini-bus in her and nearby villages. This will help family gain significant income for covering daily costs. Nino will be grateful for the help Kiva lenders will provide and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To start food production sales

loans.name: Maa Dharani Devi Shg Group

texts.en:
Lalita is a believer and also a mother of two children. They belong to Sukunabhata village of Kalahandi district. In picture the lady standing with her hand raised is Lalita. 

She has the responsibility of her family on her and she understood that it was not going to be a smooth life with only the income of her husband. So she stepped out of her home to earn money. She formed a self-help group with some other women of her village named Maa Dharani Devi SHG with the support of People's Forum. She took charge of her group as the president. Now she is a 33-year-old lady who is completely independent herself and supporting her family and her husband financially. Currently she is engaged in vegetable and flower cultivation and selling.

She has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farming and flower business. She hopes to build a house for her family and wants to educate her children. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farming and flower business.

loans.name: Evelita

texts.en:
Evelita works hard to support her family. Evelita is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Evelita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Evelita has been in this business for 29 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig fattening business.

In the future, Evelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: La Merveille Group

texts.fr: wilhermine est une brave commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «La Merveille», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère 4 enfants, dont 3 étudient et 1 est encore gamin. La cliente est vendeuse de divers articles et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une maison du marché central de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des pantalons, chemises, et autres habits. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation  des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Wilhermine is a hard-working retailer and a member of the La Merveille business group. An experienced and dynamic entrepreneur, she is 33 years old, married and the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom attend school (one is too young). She sells various different products and is the member of a shop. She displays her merchandise at the local market in the center of town. She started her business with capital she received from her husband who is also a retailer. Later, she benefited from a loan from the MFI Hekima and has been in business for 5 years.

This new loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts and other clothing. She would like to expand her business, build a house, feed her children and make sure they get an education. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for enabling women entrepreneurs excluded from classic banking channels to become self-sufficient, especially in this difficult time after the conflicts in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts and other clothing.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Shg (C) Group

texts.en:
Maa Samaleswari SHG Self-Help Group consists of nine members who are all women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start some business activities where they could provide the basic household consumables, vegetables, fruits, etc. to their customers. 

One of them is Pratima, the lady standing with raised hand in the picture, who was selected as their president. Pratima is a 25-year-old lady living with her husband and her three children who are at their schooling. Her husband works as a farmer. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which she has requested a loan. She says on the behalf of the group, "We are grateful to the Kiva and its lenders for providing us this opportunity to grow."

loans.use: To purchase grocery items in bulk directly from the wholesalers.

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Flordelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Flordelyn is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

Flordelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Bijayalaxmi is a 31-year-old illiterate woman who lives in Kasurpada village in Kalahandi district, Odisha. In the picture, the lady standing in a red saree in the front row holding a register is Bijayalaxmi. She is a mother of four children. Her husband, Khitrish, is a farmer. 

It had been difficult for her to manage her family with her husband’s income. Then she got to know about Kiva and she formed a self help group named Maa Santoshi SHG with some other women of her village. She performs as the president of the group with the support of other members. 

Their group has decided to take a loan from Kiva and start agricultural businesses like vegetable, flower, and paddy cultivation. All the members of this group are involved in different livelihood activities. Bijayalaxmi requested this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes she will be financially literate, stable and independent and live a much better life than before. She is grateful to Kiva for this help.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es: Reina tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad. Reina se dedica a la venta de ropa y mangos dese hace 15 años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Reina desea construir un servicio sanitario para lo cual necesita un financiamiento ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacer el desembolso. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de  ladrillo,cemento, arena y para pagar la mano de obra que le realizará la construcción del servicio sanitario.
texts.en:
Reina, age 53, lives in her own house with her two grown children.  Reina has been selling clothes and mangoes for 15 years.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman.  She does everything possible to give her family better living conditions.

Reina wishes to build a bathroom.  In order to do so she needs a loan because she does not have the financial resources to make the expenditure.  She is therefore requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, and sand, and to pay for the labor to build the bathroom.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand, and to pay for the labor to build the bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, like skirts and dresses, in bulk.

loans.name: Rokhy

texts.fr:
Rokhy, une dame de 40 ans, s’active dans la vente d’huile de palme et de pate d’arachide. Elle a démarré le commerce dès le bas âge, au temps ou sa mère vendait au marché, elle l’accompagnait. Elle a donc appris le métier petit à petit. Voulant renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un petit crédit de 100 000F, afin d’acheter 2 bidons d’huile de palme de 20 litres chacun, et un demi baril de pate d’arachide. Elle part revendre dans le marché, soit en gros ou par détail.
Rokhy est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion de la dépense familiale : parfois elle s’occupe du panier de marché, dès fois de la facture d’électricité.
Elle désire un jour reprendre le commerce de sa mère en y associant ce qu’elle fait, mais pour cela, elle aura besoin d’un fond plus consistant et donc l‘appui de UIMCEC.
texts.en:
Rokhy is 40 years old and sells palm oil and groundnut paste. She started working in this business at a very young age, when she would accompany her mother who sold products at the market. She therefore had a gradual introduction to the business. She is requesting a small loan of 100 000 francs so that she can strengthen her business by buying 2 20-liter cans of palm oil and a half-barrel of groundnut paste. She resells it at the market, either to retail or wholesale customers.

Rokhy is married and is the mother of 4 children. She supports her husband with the family expenses; sometimes she pays for the market costs, sometimes she pays the electricity bill. She would one day like to resume her mother's business and to add her own activities to it, but in order to do that she will need more consistent funds, which is why she asking for UIMCEC's support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and groundnut paste for resale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 27 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. He has one child who is in school.

Henry has a green grocery business that he has been doing for the past 3 years. He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy more vegetables, tomatoes and onions to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 60 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. He is supporting his grandchild who is aged 15 years.

Charles has a farming business that he has been running for the past many years and has applied for his third loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the money to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure to use on his farm. 

Charles hopes to boost his farming business so as to increase his family's income and standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Humprey

texts.en:
Humprey is 66 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. He has four children and five grandchildren. 

Humprey has a cake baking business that he has been running for the past three years. He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy cooking ingredients, e.g. eggs, baking flour, etc., to use in his bakery. He is optimistic that his business will do better and he will be able to meet the demands of his clients.

Humprey hopes to expand his business to a large scale confectionery shop.

loans.use: to buy eggs, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old, married, and together with his wife, he is blessed with one child aged four years old.

David is in a business of spinning wool in Ndunyu Njeru which he has been running for four years. He has applied for a first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy stock of wool. With the anticipated profit, David plans to buy a spinning machine.

In the near future, David hopes to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase wool for spinning.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa is a conservative lady, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Wafaa was born in 1975. She is a married lady living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. She is a mother of 5. Wafaa's husband is a plumber and she decided to support him in covering their children's needs 1 year ago by selling  blankets in order to raise their income. Because of her sense of responsibility, she decided to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of blankets and adding accessory sales to her business. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 30 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Melanie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melanie has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Zinalkan

texts.ru: Зиналкан 57 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Зиналкан - среднее образование, вместе с мужем Зиналкан занимается сельским хозяйством с 1996 года, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зиналкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 20 овец, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 1,60 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает - картофель, сеют зерновые культуры и эспарцет. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зиналкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зиналкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку квартиры.
texts.en:
Zinalkan is 57 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising two children. Zinalkan has a secondary education. She and her husband have been engaged in agriculture since 1996, with a livestock purchase of 15,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Zinalkan currently has on her homestead: two dairy cows, one steer, 20 sheep, and two horses. Monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk. She also works 1.60 hectares of land, where she mainly grows potatoes, cultivates cereals and sainfoin.

The resulting crop will be sold to wholesalers. With the aim of further developing her homestead, Zinalkan turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan - to purchase cows for increasing her livestock count. Zinalkan plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the count of domestic animals, and plans to save money to purchase an apartment.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Maryrose

texts.en:
Maryrose is single and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Maryrose requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Maryrose has been in this business for 4 years now.

Maryrose would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Ann Taj Shg Group

texts.en:
From a small village of Khurda district, Odisha state, India, 11 women stepped out and made a self-help group having the name of "Ann Taj SHG" to earn some money from different activities to support their families. All the group members are engaged in different business activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, etc. 

Dulhari, age 45, is a married lady with one daughter. The lady seated with her hand raised is Dulhari. To provide her living, she has been planting rice and farming for 12 years. Her farming earns an income of 3,500 INR per month. Now she is the leader of this group, and they are seeking their first loan with People's Forum (Kiva’s partner) for 275,000 INR. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her rice will gain a good crop yield for her to earn a profit to support her business.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Dasaratha

texts.en:
Dasaratha is a 30-year-old differently able man who lives with his parents and elder brother in a small village of Odisha, India. He owns a betel shop near his house and earns 3,000 INR per month. His father is a farmer engaged in vegetable and paddy cultivation, and he helps him in his business. His family income is only 8,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient for monthly household expenses.

Dasaratha has a plan to add more stationery items and cosmetic items in his betel shop and also wants to make repair of his shop cabin so he can fulfill the demands of customers and can make a reasonable profit. He has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR to purchase stationery items, cosmetics and to pay repairing costs for his betel shop. He hopes after this investment he would be able to make a profit of 8,000 to 10,000 INR per month.

loans.use: to purchase stationery items and cosmetics and pay repairing costs for his betel shop.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina was born in 1990. She is a married lady living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Her husband is a glass maker and she decided to support him in improving their living conditions 3 years ago by selling cosmetics in order to raise their income. Because of her sense of responsibility, she decided to expand her business, buying new types of cosmetics and hair coloring materials in order to raise her profit. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy new types of cosmetics and hair coloring materials.

loans.name: Chakratirtha Dms Group

texts.en:
The "Chakratirtha DMS," a newly formed group, is made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and do some crop cultivation. 

Bandana is the lady in the picture who is seated with her hand raised, the featured borrower of the group. She is 34 years old and she has two children. She cultivates and sells paddy rice and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than seven years. Her father helps her in this business.

With her new loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers for her paddy farming. With her profits, she plans to increase her savings so as to better establish her business. Other members of this group are engaged in different businesses like milk selling, fish selling, vegetable selling, etc.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for her paddy farming.

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en: Achraf is a 27-year-old single man. He has been employed by a wedding planning company for nine years. He is working hard to develop his skills and start his own business. He specializes in the wedding Zaffeh, a traditional Lebanese dance specialized for weddings, which takes place at the beginning of each wedding when the groom comes and take the bride from her parent's house and then they both arrive at the hotel and restaurant as an entry dance. He is very talented in his domain with a very good reputation. Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car so that he can move from one wedding to another in a better and faster way. Because this is a low income business, Achraf is also a police officer in his region and he is working hard to start his own well-developed business which will develop his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to buy a car to use in his wedding planning business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old single man who started a business of delivering hookas to homes and businesses a year ago. He has a small cafe where he provides his customers with special hooka tastes and drinks.

Ali is working hard on increasing his delivery hooka-renting and he applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase the number of hookas he owns in addition to buying a special espresso machine to provide his customers with special tasty hot drinks.

Ali is well known in his region with a good reputation and special quality and prices. His friends recommend him to a good number of customers who recommend him to others too.

Ali is working hard to diversify his services in the future, to attract more customers and develop his living.

loans.use: To increase the number of hookas he owns, in addition to buying a special espresso machine to provide his customers with special tasty hot drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and repair parts for his store.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 37-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his wife and two children, a son and a daughter, in a small simple house. Abdallah opened a small restaurant a few years ago where he makes traditional meals. It is a good business and he has his loyal customers. 

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw materials for his restaurant. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to increase his sales and productivity.
 
Abdallah appears in the photo while he was in his restaurant

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for his restaurant.

loans.name: Doudou

texts.fr: Doudou est un jeune débrouillard, âgé de 36 ans qui s’active dans la vente de charbon de bois depuis plusieurs années maintenant. Voulant augmenter la quantité de l’offre, Doudou fait recours à l’IMCEC pour un crédit de 50 000F afin d’acheter une quinzaine de sacs de charbon pour revendre. Doudou est marié et père de famille et grâce aux revenus de son commerce, il arrive à nourrir sa famille, à épargner pour réaliser un jour son rêve, de devenir un grand fournisseur de charbon à travers tout le pays.
texts.en:
Doudou is a young self-starter who is 36 years old and has been selling charcoal for several years already. Doudou is turning to UIMCEC for a 50 000 franc loan so that he can increase his amount of merchandise by buying 15 bags of charcoal. 

Doudou is married and a father. It is thanks to the income from his business than he is able to feed his family and to save up so that he can one day achieve his dream, which is to become a large supplier of charcoal throughout the whole country.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two young children ages 5 and 2. Ginalyn has been in the rice farming business for more than 5 years now.
 
Ginalyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her productivity thus augmenting her sales and income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Merlie Fe

texts.en:
Merlie Fe is 42 years old and married with two children.

Merlie Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Merlie Fe has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns additional income from direct selling avon and natasha products.

Merlie Fe aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Vivian is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vivian has been farming rice for 8 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal was born in 1980. She is a married lady living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. She is a mother of three. 

Nawals' husband is working in agriculture, and she decided to support him in covering their children's needs three years ago by selling accessories and cosmetics in order to raise their income. Since she has a sense of responsibility, she decided to expand her project by adding variety to her products such as souvenirs and to buy new types of cosmetics. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy new types of cosmetics and to add souvenirs to her business.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria Juana es una cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Maria Juana tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y dos hijos. Ella es una microempresaria que hace 5 años inicio un taller de costura donde maquillan ropa para distintas empresas. Es un taller con seis maquinas de coser, una maquina de corte de etiquetas, ella tiene algunos empleados que le ayudan con los pedidos.
Con el crédito planea contratar 1-2 personas más y comprar una maquina ya que su negocio esta creciendo. Sus principales logros han sido iniciar y crecer su negocio , comprar algunas maquinas y poner la confección directa en su taller.
texts.en:
Maria Juana is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story.

Maria Juana, age 48, lives with her husband and two children.  She is a small businesswoman.  Five years ago she started a seamstress shop where they produce clothes for different businesses.  The shop has six sewing machines and a label cutting machine.  She has some employees who help her with the orders.

She plans to use the loan to hire one or two more people and to buy a machine because the business is growing.  Her main accomplishments have been to start and grow her business, to buy some machines, and to set up clothes production in her shop.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Noor Al- Koboul Group

texts.en:
Noor Al- Koboul is a group that consists of four women living in Taiz, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 170,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB.

Maryam is a 45-year-old widowed woman and a mother of six children. Her oldest child is 20 years old, and the youngest one is 12 years old. Maryam is an uneducated woman, living with her children in miserable conditions in their own house. She is the leader of the group. 

After the death of her husband, she became the sole breadwinner of her family. In that time, Maryam began thinking about a good income source for her children. She began as a door-to-door seller. Maryam has started up her business one year ago, selling clothes, perfumes, incense and other simple goods. Due to the fact that she is the sole breadwinner of her family, the money which she earns  from this business is not enough to improve her business, and most of what she earns goes to the family expenses; therefore, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to buy more goods. 

Maryam looks forward to opening a savings account for her children and renovating their old house. Her dreams are sending her children to a private school and then building a new house.

loans.use: To buy incense, perfumes and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old and married to Francis. Together they are supporting two children who are in school.

She is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which she has been practicing for ten years. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy fertilizer and seeds during this planting season. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay the loan amount and school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to apply for a much bigger loan to expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old and from Kitiri. He is married. They have two children who are aged 8 years and 5 years old. 

Daniel is a farmer and has been in it for many years. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy seedlings, chemicals, etc., to add to his stock. Daniel will use the profits to repay the loan and expand his farming business.

He hopes to borrow more loans in the future to enable him to expand his farming business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and chemicals

loans.name: Manmohan

texts.en:
Manmohan is a 31-year-old differently able man who lives with his father, mother, elder brother and elder brother's wife in a small village of Odisha, India.

He owns a betel shop near his house and earns 4,000 INR per month. His father is a farmer who helps him in his business. His family income is only 8,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient for monthly household expenses.

Manmohan has a plan to add more household items, stationery items and cosmetic items in his betel shop so he can fulfill the demands of customers and can make a reasonable profit. He has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR to purchase stationery items, cosmetics and basic household items for his betel shop. He hopes after this investment he would be able to make a profit of 8,000 INR per month.

loans.use: To purchase of stationery items, cosmetics and basic household items for his betel shop.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 41 years old and married. She lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She operates a retail shop in her village as her main source of income, which she has been doing for 14 years. She earns additional income from agriculture. She earns well for her family.

Ny is requesting a loan for $500, which she will use to arrange a religious ceremony in the village as she has inadequate capital to make it possible. With this loan, she will be able to manage the costs of expenditures incurred in the preparation.

loans.use: to arrange a religious ceremony in her village.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is 29 years old, from Naivasha, and is married to Charles. They have three children who are still young. Lillian has a general shop business that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to increase her stock by buying soft drinks, eggs, bread, milk, etc.  She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, bread, milk, etc. to increase her stock.

loans.name: Eseza's Group

texts.en:
Eseza's group is comprised of five hardworking women. Eseza is 20 years old, and lives in the town of Kaliro, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Eseza has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells first hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Eseza has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Eseza to generate greater profits and provide for her baby. Eseza hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Eseza is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 29 years old and married. He operates a hardware business that sells a variety of construction supplies, which he has been doing for four years. He earns an estimated monthly income of 50,000 KES. 

Bernard requested his second loan from VisionFund for 60,000 KES, which he will use to purchase and transport paint. He is likely to earn more from the sales of paint as the town has a number of buildings under construction. He plans to use the proceeds to repay the loan as well as cater to the family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase paint to sell

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thuý has a retail business selling books, textbooks, student supplies. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Thuý is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thuý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thuý has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business's profit, Thuý hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Koinake

texts.en:
Koinake is a 37-year-old married gentleman who supports a family of five people. He has practiced wheat farming for the last 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 49,000. 

He is servicing a second loan of KES 65,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Jane, and they are blessed with two children, ages 9 and 4 years old.

He owns and operates a general shop store, a business he has been doing for eight years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He has applied for his third loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Robert anticipates using the gains from his business to pay his loan, educate his children, as well as boost his business.

In future, he hopes to buy a plot and build his own house.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his general store.

loans.name: Melenia

texts.en: Melenia is a married woman, who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She sells tomatoes in the market seven days a week and twelve hours a day, plus she does farming for additional income.  Melenia started this business to have a source of income, and she needs money to buy more tomatoes to sell. Melenia hopes to expand the business; however, she faces the challenges of competition, and perishability of her products. Melenia is a hardworking woman and appreciates the services being offered.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ghalyah

texts.en:
Ghalia is a 38-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus. She is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a worker with a low and unstable income. For the past two years, Ghalia has worked on her farm where she raises sheep. She makes dairy products and resells them in the local market. 

Ghalia took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her farm. By taking this loan, Ghalia will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. 

Ghalia appears in the photo on her farm

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 25 years old and from Nyahururu. She is blessed with one child, age 3 years.

She owns and operates a clothes and dressmaking business, which she has been doing for two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has applied for a KES 30,000 loan from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the funds to buy more clothes to sell.

Catherine anticipates using the gains from her business to pay her loan, as well as boost her business.

In future, she hopes to expand her business in other parts of the country.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luz Argelia

texts.es:
La señora Luz, quien es ama de casa con 38 años, casada y con dos hijas decidió hacer un alto en la vida y tomo una gran decisión de hacer por ella un esfuerzo de estudiar, Por qué se dio cuenta que el progreso va de la mano con el estudio y si hoy en día una persona no se capacita el entorno laboral se ve estancada, sin progreso para la persona y la familia.
