Luz tomo la decisión de estudiar en el instituto Campo Alto en el área de la salud, específicamente servicios farmacéuticos ya  que una persona graduada de este instituto le recomendó  Campo Alto y además a  Luz le gusta el área de la salud.
Cuando se enteró cuanto valía el semestre se desilusiono por el costo, pero un día le comentaron del subsidio con el convenio kiva. Ella se puso muy contenta y hablo con el esposo, ya que podría por medio de kiva tener un subsidio que le ayudaría a pagar cuotas menos pesadas.
El esfuerzo de luz y la familia es grande, pues ya que el esposo es el único que trabaja y sostiene el hogar y las dos hijas, también se encuentran estudiando ella se traslada desde Soacha donde reside hasta la sede de Teusaquillo, muchas veces sin tener para el transporte también ha sido una lucha.
Luz tiene mucha fe que cuando termine de estudiar tendrá un trabajo estable, una calidad de vida mejor para ella y la familia y decir además que con la ayuda de Dios y subsidio kiva podrá salir adelante.
Luz es una persona echada para adelante con muchos sueños y mucho amor a la familia construyendo una mejor sociedad, ella solicita este convenio para que no le queden las cuotas tan altas y la meta de estudiar en este instituto siga en pie.
texts.en:
Luz, who is a 38-year-old homemaker, is married with two daughters. She decided to take a break in life and made a big decision to make an effort to study. She realized that progress goes hand in hand with study, and if these days a person does not receive training, the work environment becomes bogged down, without progress for the person or the family.

Luz made the decision to study health in the Campo Alto institute, specifically pharmaceutical services, since a person who graduated from this institute recommended Campo Alto, and also Luz likes the subject of health.

When she found out how much a semester cost, she was disappointed because of the cost, but one day someone mentioned the subsidy agreement with Kiva. She became very happy and spoke with her husband since she could, through Kiva, receive a subsidy that would help her make less difficult payments.

Luz and her family struggle since her husband is the only one who works and supports the home and the two daughters, who also study. She travels from Soacha, where she lives, to the Teusaquillo campus, many times without money for transportation, which has also been a struggle.

Luz has a lot of faith that when she finishes studying she will have a stable job, a better quality of life for herself and her family, and says that furthermore, with the God’s help and the subsidy from Kiva, she will be able to come out ahead.

Luz is a person driven by many dreams and much love for her family to create a better society. She is requesting this loan so that her payments are not so high and so the plan to study in this institute continues.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Antonius

texts.en:
Antonius is a 47-year-old very hardworking gentleman from Nyahururu. He is married and blessed with five children aged 22, 20,16,13 and 2.

Antonius owns and operates a dressmaking shop, a business he has been doing for twenty years, with a monthly income of 40,000 KES. He has applied for his fourth loan of 112,443 KES from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the funds to buy a motorcycle to provide transport services to increase his income. 

Antonius plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his two businesses and educate his children. In future, he hopes to buy a plot of land and build houses to rent for more income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to increase his income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pottery containers

loans.name: Nawaf Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Nawaf Hodeidah Group is a group consisting of four women, living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of YER 110,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Wahba is a 38-year-old, married woman, with three children. She is the leader of the group. Wahba is a university graduate but, because of the hard conditions in the country, she couldn't find a job. Despite her miserable condition, she didn't surrender to her condition, but she decided to help her husband in the expenses of the family. 

Wahba started up her business for two years as a door-to-door seller, selling simple goods. Now, she sells women's clothes in her area, but this business needs to a lot of money in order to purchase more clothes. Her money, which she accumulates, is not enough for that and most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. 

For this reason, Wahba applied for a loan of YER 30,000 from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and other goods. Wahba looks forward to expanding her business through buying accessories, makeup, incense, perfumes, and many kinds of clothes. Her dream is to support her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of clothes and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Tròn

texts.en:
Tròn operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Tròn is 44 years old and married with four children. She lives with her four dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Tròn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Tròn faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares their neighbors' latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Tròn hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Roshiel

texts.en:
Roshiel is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of a three-year-old child. Roshiel has been in the rice farming business with her husband for more than two years now. This is the source of her income.

Roshiel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her crop yield and profit. Roshiel dreams of expanding her business in the future. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матлюбе 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Матлюбы - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Матлюба занимается полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Матлюбы, на сегодняшний день имеется: 0,51 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, хлопок и овощи для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Матлюба обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку семян картофеля, семян хлопка для посевных работ и удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Матлюба планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Matlyuba is 40 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three children. Matlyuba has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Matlyuba practices crop farming. She started this business 15 years ago with 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Matlyuba's hard work, she currently has a 0.51 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows potatoes, cotton and vegetables for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Matlyuba turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy potato and cotton seeds for sowing as well as fertilizers for cultivating the land. Matlyuba is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Matlyuba plans to invest the earnings from the loan in home repairs.

loans.use: to buy potato and cotton seeds as well as fertilizers.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old and single with three children. She is responsible for paying school fees for them since their father is not helpful, as he is a drunkard. Jane is in the business of selling local brew, but she also does agriculture to supplement her income. She hails from a very remote area. 

Jane has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Ugafode to complete her house where she resides with her children. She describes herself as a hardworking and honest person. Jane notes that the challenge she faces in her businesses is bad weather, which affects her agricultural projects.

loans.use: To complete construction of her house

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 35-year-old very hardworking gentleman. He is married to Julieta and is a father of three children. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last three years with a monthly income of about KES 30,000. 

Edward learnt about VisionFund Kenya from some of his colleagues who are funded by the organization.

He has acquired his first loan of KES 87,880, which will help him in purchasing his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more, due to the increased flexibility and already established customer base.

Edward plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Ndèye Fatou

texts.fr:
Âgée de 29 ans, cette emprunteuse appelée Ndèye Fatou, s’active dans la vente de denrées alimentaires depuis 2 ans. Elle a installé une petite table devant chez elle, ou elle vend du sucre, du thé, du lait et divers autres produits alimentaires. Elle est mariée et c’est dans le sens d’appuyer dans la gestion de la dépense familiale quotidienne qu’elle s’est lancée dans ce petit commerce ; car les revenus de son époux sont très minimes dès fois même inexistants. Elle vient solliciter un petit montant de 50 000f afin d’augmenter la marchandise pour que les bénéfices soient meilleures.
Ndèye Fatou, si elle avait les moyens, agrandirait son commerce pour maximiser le profit et pouvoir améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
This borrower is Ndèye Fatou, age 29, a reseller of foodstuffs for the past 2 years. She has a small table set up in front of her home where she sells sugar, tea, milk, and various other food items. 

Ndèye Fatou is married, and she started this commercial activity to help with the household’s daily expenses as her husband’s income is very modest, sometimes non-existent. 

She is seeking a small loan of 50,000f to increase her stock and bolster her profits.  

If she could afford it, Ndèye Fatou would like to expand her activity and to maximize her profits and improve her family’s situation with respect to food.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase spare parts and supplies needed in her shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy materials and supplies needed in her welding shop business. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her family always has good living conditions. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and supplies needed in her welding shop business.

loans.name: Merveille A Group

texts.fr: La cliente Cecile est une brave commerçante et membre du  collectif  d’affaires « Merveille A», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est   vendeuse de boissons. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt du quartier commercial de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de ses épargnes de son salaire. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 30 caisses de Fanta sucré, 50 caisses de bière Primus, 10 caisses de Miitzing, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits et petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout ; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Cecile, age 45, is a brave merchant and member of the business group “Merveille A”. She is an experienced and enthusiastic entrepreneur, and the married mother of 5 children who all go to school. Her husband is a driver.

Cecile sells drinks. She displays her stock at a warehouse in the commercial sector of the city. She started her business with capital from savings on her income. She later turned to the Hekima MFI for financial assistance. She has been practicing this activity for 4 years. 

Cecile will use this new loan to buy 30 cases of Fanta, 50 cases of Primus beer, 10 cases of Miitzig beer, etc. Her goals are to build a house and to look after her children’s needs with respect to food and education. 

Cecile wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping small entrepreneurs to become self-sufficient who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these difficult times following the war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 30 cases of Fanta, 50 cases of Primus beer, 10 cases of Miitzig beer, etc.

loans.name: Edrona

texts.en: Edrona is a 44-year-old, single women, living in Kasese, Uganda.  She is charged with a responsibility of looking after four children who all go to school.  She has a business on a busy street where she sells cassava flour. She started the business to pay school fees. Edrona hopes to increase her stock, but inadequate capital to expand her business is a challenge she faces. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Louis Marie Cédric

texts.fr: Louis est un homme de 24 ans,célibataire et père d'un enfant de 3 ans. il possède un boutique de vente de vivres frais depuis 8 ans dans un quartier de la ville. il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d'accroître ses ventes.les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Louis is a 24-year old man, single and the father of a three-year old child. He has a grocery store in one of the town’s neighborhoods and has been running it for eight years. He is seeking a loan to increase his merchandise stock in order to meet customer demand and grow his sales. The resulting benefits will be reinvested in his business and help to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his store.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Dung has been involved in this business for 3 years. She is 30 years old, and married with two children.  Dung lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Dung’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Dung faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet. With her business profits, Dung hopes to buy land of her own, to travel for vacation within the country, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 26-year-old man from Nyahururu.

He has farmed for two years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He has applied for his second loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, and plans to use those funds to purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

He anticipates using his gains to repay his loan, boost his farming activity and improve his living standards.

In the future, he hopes to buy land and build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Raikhan

texts.ru: Райхан 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Сын занимается строительством, дочь - замужем. У Райхан - средне-специальное образование, окончила медицинское училище, по специальности -медсестра. Трудовую деятельность начала в местной больнице, в которой работает по сей день. По характеру Райхан очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Райхан дополнительно занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Райхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, чтобы обеспечить скот кормами выращивает клевер на земельной доле мерою в 0,5 ГА, также арендует у односельчан 2,5 ГА земли, где выращивает картофель, кукурузу и ячмень. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Райхан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Райхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Raikhan is 53 years old, married, and together with her husband has brought up two children. Their son is engaged in construction and their daughter is married. Raikhan has a secondary-specialized education and she graduated from a medical school with a nursing specialty. She began her career at a local hospital, in which she still works to this day. By character, Raikhan is very responsible, sociable, and cheerful.

Together with her husband, Raikhan is additionally engaged in raising livestock and crops, having begun 33 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Raikhan currently has one dairy cow on her homestead, and in order to support the livestock with feed she grows clover on a plot of land measuring 0.5 hectares, and also rents 2.5 hectares of land from fellow villagers, where she grows potatoes, corn and barley. The resulting crop will be sold to wholesalers. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Raikhan turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan - to purchase cows to expand her livestock count. Raikhan plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Aidinkhan

texts.ru: Айдинхан 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Трое детей - школьники, а самый старший находится на заработках в России.  У Айдинхан - среднее образование, вместе с мужем Айдинхан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айдинхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 3 овцы, также обрабатывает небольшую земельную долю, где в основном выращивает -перец, капусту и морковь. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айдинхан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айдинхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на оплату обучения детей в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en:
Aidinkhan is 40 years old, married, and together with her husband is bringing up three children. Three children are in school, and the oldest is working abroad in Russia. Aidinkhan has a secondary education. Together with her husband, Aidinkhan raises livestock and crops, having begun 23 years ago with a livestock purchase of 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Aidinkhan today has on her homestead: five dairy cows and three sheep, and also works a small plot of land, where she mainly grows peppers, cabbage and carrots. The resulting crop will be sold to wholesalers. Monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homstead, Aidinkhan applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan - to purchase cows for expanding her livestock count. Aidinkhan plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money to pay tuition for her children in higher education establishments.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Staff La Frontiere Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nsimire est une brave commerçante trésorière et membre du groupe d’affaires «Staff la frontière», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 44 ans, marié et mère de 2 enfants, dont 1 étudie et 1 autre a terminé ses études. La cliente est vendeuse en gros de boissons. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un dépôt relais sur la route secondaire de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 13 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est un  commerçant ambulatoire. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 caisses de Fanta sucré, 100 caisses de bière Primus, Miitzing, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Nsimire is a brave shopkeeper who is the treasurer of the borrowing group "Staff la frontière" ("the border Staff") as well as an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur. Nsimire is 44 years old, married and mother of 2 children, 1 of whom still attends school while the other has completed their studies. 

Nsimire is a beverage wholesaler. She sets up her wares at a rest stop on one of the main roads in her town. She began her business with capital from her husband. Later, she received a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been in business for 13 years. Her husband is a door-to-door seller.

This new loan will allow Nsimire to purchase 50 cases of sweetened Fanta, 100 cases of beer such as Primus, Miitzing, etc. With this, she hopes to increase her capital and educate and feed her children. In closing, Nsimire very gratefully thanks Hekima for their support of autonomy for small business owners who are left out of the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult time of conflict in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to purchase 50 cases of sweetened Fanta, 100 cases of Primus beer, Mitzing, etc.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 28-year-old, very hardworking gentleman who is newly married to Leah. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last four years, with a monthly income of about KES 25,000. He learned about VisionFund Kenya from some of his colleagues who are funded by the organization.

Antony has acquired his first loan of KES 87,880, which will facilitate him in purchasing his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more due to the increased flexibility and already established customer base. He plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. 

Antony hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his new family.

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 46 years old and from Nakuru; she is married, and blessed with three children who are all adults.

She has been doing poultry keeping for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has applied for her third loan of KES 75,000 from VisionFund Kenya; she plans to use the funds to start her mushroom project, so as to increase her earnings.

Peninah plans to use her profits to pay her loan, and as well as to expand her new mushroom project.

loans.use: To purchase mushroom seeds for her new mushroom project.

loans.name: Niavoute

texts.fr: Madame Niavoute, âgée de 56 ans vend des produits alimentaires divers. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. Avec le crédit sollicité, elle envisage d’acheter du pain de singe, de l’arachide, du manioc pour revendre. Vu le nombre de ses enfants, et afin de pouvoir les prendre en charges, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce pour appuyer son mari et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Niavoute est une femme très active, et elle a comme ambition d’acquérir une maison et d’y installer sa famille pour qu’elle soit dans le confort.
texts.en:
Mrs. Niavoute, age 56, is a reseller of various food products. She is married with six children. 

She plans to use her loan to buy “pain de singe” (baobab fruit), groundnuts and cassava for resale. With many children and the need to support them, she started this activity to help her husband and to improve their family’s food situation.  

Niavoute is very active. Her goal is to buy a house for her family to settle in and be comfortable.

loans.use: to buy pain de singe, groundnuts and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Hòa

texts.en:
Hoà is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two additional dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Hoà raises poultry and cattle, which she has been doing for six years. The main hardship that Hoà faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine.

Hoà requested her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. With her business profit, she hopes to earn enough money to provide for her children, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 53-year-old married man from Nyahururu.  He and his wife, Alice, are blessed with four children ages 20,18,15 and 12 years old.

He has owned and operated a shoe shop for ten years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

He has applied for his first loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and plans to use the funds to buy more shoes to sell.

Francis anticipates using the gains from his business to repay his loan, educate his children, and boost his business.

In the future, he plans to expand his shoe shop and buy land and build houses for rent.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell.

loans.name: Tâm

texts.en:
Tâm is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She lives with 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district which is a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  Tâm operates a food stall/restaurant to sell fish.  Tâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Tâm first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tâm faces in her life is not having a latrine for her family.  They currently  share neighbor's latrine.  She requests a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet .

In the future, Tâm hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet .

loans.name: Xinh

texts.en:
Xinh operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Xinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 39 years old, and is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Xinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Xinh faces in her life is not having latrine, so her family shares the neighbor's latrine.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build toilet.

In the future, Xinh hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Felix, and they are blessed with two children, ages 10 and 4 years old.

She owns a nursery school, a business she has been doing for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya, and plans to use the funds to expand her school.

Esther anticipates using the profits from her business to pay her loan, educate her children, and boost her business as well.

loans.use: To expand her nursery school business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 36 years and from Nyahururu. She is blessed with two children, ages 5 and 3 years. 

She owns and operates a clothing selling business, which she has been doing for two years. Eva earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has applied for her second KES 40,500 loan from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the funds to buy more clothes to sell. 

She anticipates using the gains from her business to pay her loan, as well as boost her business.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business in other parts of the country.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and kapenta.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Mong Kul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Rom is a widowed mother of four children and aged in early 60s. To support the family, she runs a small grocery stall and raises pigs as the main source of her income. She has been involved with this business since she was 20 years old. 

She is the ex-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) whose past loan has been completely repaid, and it has enabled her to provide sufficient food for her family. 

Now, she has teamed up a group of two to get a new loan. She is seeking a 500,000 KHR, while her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion buying more grocery items for resale, pig’s feed, as well as build a pigpen. She hopes to increase her family’s income and improve her condition of living better.

loans.use: to buy pigs feed as well as build a pigpen.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kanyshbubu

texts.ru: Канышбубу 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Канышбубу - высшее образование, работает в местной школе-библиотекарем. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Канышбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 26 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канышбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 35 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канышбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канышбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en:
Kanyshbubu is 44 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising four children. Kanyshbubu has a higher education and works in a local school as a librarian. As a main source of income for her family, Kanyshbubu raises livestock, having begun 26 years ago with a livestock purchase of 15,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Kanyshbubu today has on her homestead: four dairy cows, one horse, and 35 sheep. Monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Kanyshbubu applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan - to purchase calves to increase her livestock count. Kanyshbubu plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the number of domestic animals, and plans to save money to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Jarkynay

texts.ru: Жаркынай 31 год, замужем, воспитывают двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 2013 году, начала бизнес в торговле детскими вещами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Жаркынай имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Жаркынай смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Жаркынай обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Жаркынай планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на обучение своих детей.
texts.en:
Jarkynay is 31 years old, married, and is raising two children (1 daughter, 1 son). In 2013, she began a business trading children's things, using as starting capital a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Having managed to develop her business and to attract regular customers, Jarkynay has an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work in the business, Jarkynay was able to increase her inventory and develop her business.

With the aim of further improving and expanding her business, Jarkynay turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan - to grow her inventory. Jarkynay plans to invest income from the loan in inventory and to save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes for retail sale

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a 30-year-old, very hardworking, gentleman.  He is married to Hannah and a father of one. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last two years, with a monthly income of about KES 24,000. He learned about VisionFund Kenya from some of his colleagues who are funded by the organization.

Bernard has acquired his first loan of KES 87,880 that will facilitate him in purchasing his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more, due to the increased flexibility and his already established customer base.

He plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan, as well as boost his savings account. He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman, who is determined to achieve his goals and improve the living standards of his family

loans.use: to purchase his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cassava

loans.name: Kipngetich

texts.en: Kipngetich is 53 years old, married, and blessed with six children between eighteen and six years of age. He is employed in the motorcycle transport industry, a business he has run for the last 14 years. The business earns him a monthly income of about KES 18,000. He came to know of VisionFund Kenya through a World Vision office in his area. Kipngetich has acquired his first loan of KES 100,173 that will enable him purchase a powerful motorbike, suitable for transportation in his area, especially when it comes to accessing remote rough road areas. He plans to use the proceeds to repay the loan and pay school fees for his children. Kipngetich's one dream is to own a taxi and expand his transport business

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sofronias

texts.en:
Sofronias is a merchant from San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the retail business for more than 15 years now. He buys and sells fruits and vegetables in the market. Also, he grows vegetable in his backyard.

Sofronias is asking for a loan to buy seedlings to plant and fruits and vegetables to resell. With this, he will be able to improve his stocks, thus allowing him to sell more. In the future, Sofronias hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to plant and fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Serapiona

texts.en:
Serapiona is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman with five children. Serapiona has  farmed for more than 10 years. This is the source of her income. 

Serapiona asks for a loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the productivity and harvest of her farm. 

In the future, Serapiona wants to expand her farming business so that it will generate more revenue to meet the needs of the family especially to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène est une femme de 51 ans célibataire mère de 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 et 26 ans, deux de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle a aussi à sa charge sa belle fille. Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 20 ans déjà. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'acheter 2 sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et dois pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour refaire les locaux de son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hélène is 51 years old, single, and the mother of five children aged between 6 and 26. Two of them still attend school. She is also responsible for her stepdaughter.

She opened a restaurant that she's been running for 20 years already. It's thanks to this business that she takes care of her family.

Buying ingredients for her restaurant from retailers is not very profitable for her, hence the importance of this loan for her business. Indeed, it will enable  her to buy 2 sacks of peanuts, one sacks of rice, and the wood she needs to cook her meals.

This will avoid daily trips and save money on taxi, and increase her profits. She will reinvest part of her profits to renovate her restaurant, and the remainder will help her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of peanuts, 1 bag of rice, and wood needed to cook her meals

loans.name: Chailim's Group

texts.en:
Originally of the Banteay Meanchey province, Chailim is 32 years old and married. The main source of her income her occupation is as a teacher; she also sells desserts for extra income. Now the main challenge for her is she lacks money for supporting her business of cake making. 

Chailim is the group leader of three borrowers in their fourth cycle; they are requesting 1,400,000 KHR each with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). 

Chailim has managed to repay her past loan wisely to improve her living conditions better than before. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy ingredients to make more desserts to sell. 

She hopes to increase her income better than before.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making more desserts to sell.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is a female Ugandan, aged 41 years, married with seven children aged between 6 and 20; five of them attend school. She is the one responsible for paying their school fees and other necessities.

Jennifer is a farmer who grows crops like rice, maize, and beans on subsistence level, but she also rears goats. She has approached Ugafode for a loan of 800,000 UGX to buy rice for sowing, since it is her major source of income.

Her dreams is to improve her home by building a bigger and better family house. Her main challenge is bad weather, which affects her business/crops yields. She hopes to makes a big harvest this season.

She describes herself as hardworking and honest woman.

loans.use: to buy rice for sowing.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Niño Jesus está en su 2do. ciclo del programa de comité, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 19 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que están luchando por mejorar su vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marcelina, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con aspectos de su vida aun en rojo. Ella trabaja en la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y luego sale a vender, y de esa forma se gana la vida de una forma digna y honesta. Ella es una persona muy dedicada a su familia y es por ellos que está luchando para darles lo mejor.
Marcelina pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, pollo, condimentos y demás, y de esa forma seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Niño Jesus” group is in its second cycle of the committee for women program where are all of the members committed to working and helping each other to get ahead.  They are working on the elimination of poverty survey, where two of the 19 ladies are below the poverty line.  That is to say, they are struggling for a better life.

She sells food that she cooks herself and earns a living in this dignified and honest manner.  She is very dedicated to her family and strives to provide the best for them.

Marcelina is one of the members who showed a level one on the poverty scale, meaning that she is still in the red in several areas of her life.

Marcelina is asking for this loan so she can buy ingredients such as vegetables, meats, chicken, condiments, and other things so she can continue serving her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish; she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 38 years old, and is married with three children. Hoa lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. This is Hoa's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hoa faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares the neighbor's latrine.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hoa hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is a 34-year-old farmer who is married to Kadek, a 27-year-old woman.  They have been blessed three children; Riko, 6, in second grade of elementary school; Mei, 5, in early children education; and the last one is Lovi, 2 years old, who does not attend school yet.
 
Robinson has one acre of land, planted the paddy and the corn. He has been involved in the agriculture business for the last five years. He started farming by using the small capital to buy the seeds and the insecticides. The income generated from the harvest enables him to meet his family needs.

At the moment, he intends to buy more fertilizer and insecticides; he then requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold, and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their Jeepney unit, and to buy some equipment in their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Dante dreams that his business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. He meets with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his family's Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 25-year-old, very hard-working gentleman, married to Esther, and a father of one child, age two. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last four years, with a monthly income of about KES 31,000. He learned about VisionFund Kenya from a staff member who works within the organization.

Duncan has been advanced his first loan, in the amount of KES 87,880, which will facilitate him in purchasing his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more money, due to the increased flexibility and already-established customer base.

He plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as to boost his savings account. He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goals and improve the living standards of his young family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en: Sokchea, 40 years old, is a borrower from Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children; one is in school and one is too young for schooling. To support her family, she grows rice and cassava, and raises pigs to earn a decent income. This is the third loan for Sokchea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans with success, and improved her lifestyle better than before. Now, the main challenge for her is that she lacks of money to support her son in university. To overcome this challenge, she is seeking an education loan to cover school fees for her son, who wants to pursue a Bachelor Degree in Electronic Engineering. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mansoor Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Mansoor Hodeidah is a group of four women, living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Salamah is the leader of the group; she is an uneducated woman. Salamah is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. 

Salamah decided to help her husband to improve the living standards of their family, so she had a business for five years as a door-to-door seller. She began in selling clothes to the people in her area, but from this business she couldn't earns good money.

Therefore, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to change her business to purchase some juice materials, such as a juice- squeezer, a sack of sugar, many kinds of tangs and other necessary materials in order to begin of making juices for people. 

She looks forward to expanding her new business by opening a small cafeteria for selling drinks in her area. 

Salamah hopes to support her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase goods and a juice-squeezer for making drinks

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 4 Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa 4 está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo.
La Sra. Maria, es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, y hasta muy entrada la noche. Es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo lucha por salir adelante.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, verduras, lácteos, panificados y demás para su venta. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
“Kuña Guapa 4” is in its fourth cycle in the committee for women in the city of Concepcion, an area a bit distant from the central zone and growing.  It’s an area that’s difficult to get to and this group strives for growth in order to give a better atmosphere to the area where they live.

Maria is one of the members and is a merchant.  She has a grocery store and works it every day, beginning early in the morning and going late at night.  She is a hardworking woman who works hard to get ahead with lots of sacrifice and effort.

She is asking for this loan to buy beverages, food, vegetables, dairy, breads, and other things to sell.  She wants to grow her business this way and provide her family with what they need to have a live without depravity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado San Francisco está conformado por 17 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, donde en este ciclo solo 15 de ellas está retirando préstamo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lurdes, que se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité ya que mediante eso ella pudo emprender una  actividad bastante buena en su propia casa debido a que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de  comestibles y bebidas en general, de esta manera ella lucha por salir adelante, y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Lurdes solicita de este préstamo para la compra de bebidas para la venta que lo hace de forma constante y también por pedidos, lo que le ayudará  a salir de la pobreza generando mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
This committee called San Francisco is made up of 17 woman inspired by a better quality of life.  There are only 15 members requesting loans in this cycle

Lurdes is one of the members who is happy to be part of the group because she was able to start a good business in her own home.  She makes and sells food and beverages and works hard to get ahead and help her loved ones this way.

Lurdes is asking for this loan to buy beverages, which she sells regularly and to order.  This helps her increase her income and break from poverty.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Corazones Unidos Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZONES UNIDOS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Pamela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller electricista, servicio de construcción, librería, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte, venta de tenis, venta de comida, venta de pañales

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Pamela es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de editorial; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al trabajar de empleada del taller, pasado el tiempo su Jefe le traspaso el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papel por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros que le ofrece la institución.

En la imagen no se encuentra una de las socias porque se realizaba consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “CORAZONES UNIDOS” communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación center.  The group is made up of nine members and directed by a board of directors, where Pamela serves as the president.  The members are involved in various businesses, including an electrical workshop, construction services, a bookstore, clothing sales, transportation services, sneaker sales, food sales, and diaper sales.

This loan will help their small businesses, including Pamela’s.  She is beginning her first cycle with Pro Mujer, having joined on a friend’s invitation who is also a member.  She has a printing workshop and says that she started in this business by working in the shop and in time the boss passed it on.

She will use this loan to increase her capital and buy paper in quantity in El Alto and then sell it from her shop.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health care and savings that the institution offers.

One of the members does not appear in the image because she was at a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy paper.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 4º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el cual quieren conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuentra.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Graciela, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que está en un nivel medio de ingresos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y también cuenta que ella es cocinera, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus ingredientes para la realización de sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, jamón, etc., lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Guapa and is in its fourth cycle in the committee for women program, where they are also part of the elimination of poverty program in order to learn about each of their situations.

Graciela is one of the members and she showed a level two on the poverty scale in the last survey, meaning that she is of mid-level income.  She tells us that she is a cook and works hard and also follows the advice from her advisors who monitor the training and also encourage the women to strive to overcome their poverty.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to make her foods such as vegetables, condiments, beef, chicken, ham, etc.  This will help her solidify her business plan which will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Rosa Lisbette

texts.es: Señora Rosa, acompañada con dos hijos  en edades de 14 y 9 años, su negocio es una sala de belleza en el domicilio,  tiene 4 años de existencia del negocio a cargo por lo que ha visto mejoras, debido a que antes salía a trabajar a domicilio, hoy en día solamente atiende en su sala de belleza, también brinda trabajo a un trabajador y a su hija, de esta manera se ayudan mutuamente. Piensa invertir en pinturas, tinte, rasuradoras, entre otros.
texts.en: Rosa is married and has two children, ages 14 and 9.  She has a beauty salon in her house and has had it for four years.  She used to go outside the home to work, but now she only tends to her beauty salon.  She also provides jobs to one employee and to her daughter.  They help each-other this way.  She will buy colorings, tints, razors, and other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Alberto es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está casado y tiene dos hijos, por los cuales esta pareja está luchando para poder darles todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener.
Alberto es dueño de una fábrica  de tejas y ladrillo con su padre en cual trabaja hace más de 20 años. Es una persona muy trabajadora que con gran esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en leñas y tierra para poder seguir con la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Alberto is from the city of Encarnación.  He is married and has two children for whom this couple is striving to give them what they were not able to have.

Alberto has a tile and brick factory with his father who has been working there for 20 years.  He is a hardworking man and getting ahead with great effort.

He is asking for this loan to buy firewood and soil so he can continue making tiles and bricks and continue working in this way.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is getting so he can continue growing.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase white soil, sand, and charcoal wood to make bricks.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Meet Umu, who is in her late twenties, from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. For the past four years,  Umu has established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 A.M. until 5:30 P.M., six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and a proper business location.

Umu requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soaps to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living, and increase her business. In the future, Umu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soaps to expand her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 25 years old, married, and has one child. He is a very hardworking gentleman. He is employed in the motorcycle transport industry, which he has been doing for four years in the outskirts of Bomet town, Kenya. He earns an approximate monthly income of 28,200 KES. 

Nelson requested his first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 111,421 KES, which he will use to purchase his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more due to the increased flexibility and established customer base. Nelson will use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. He hopes to buy a taxi from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase leaf fertilizer, soil fertilizer, pepper and tomato seeds, and pay for labor. For macro tunnel farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Maria viene trabajando muy bien en forma conjunta en la comunidad organizando actividades para fortalecen el comité, y que ayudan a su comunidad, ya que es una muy rural, y que aún está en crecimiento.
Todas se dedican a actividades de cría y venta de animales de corral, todas ellas son mujeres que pese a ser muy humildes siempre luchan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Una de ellas es Olga, una persona muy luchadora y emprendedora.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para poder seguir con la cría y venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
The Santa Maria committee works well together in the community, organizing its activities to strengthen the committee because it helps the community, which is very rural and growing.

They all raise corral animals and are very humble ladies who always strive to improve their living conditions.  Olga is one of them and is a very hardworking and enterprising lady.

She is asking for this loan to buy balanced feed for her animals so she can continue raising and selling them.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Manduara Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Manduara está en su ciclo número sexto del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto y la ayuda mutua. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Emilia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ha ido mejorando a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa. Ella tiene una mercería donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, artículos de bazar, calzados y demás, y con lo cual ayuda y mantiene a su familia.
La Sra. Emilia solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas, artículos de bazar y demás productos para su mercería, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called Manduara and is in its sixth cycle in the committee for women program, where all its members work and help one another get ahead through their team efforts and mutual help.  They have been working on the elimination of poverty survey in order to learn about each one’s situations. 

Emilia is one of the members who demonstrated a level three poverty level in the last survey, meaning that she has improved through her efforts, continued work, and behavior as a successful woman.  She has a haberdashery where she sells all sorts of items like clothing, accessories, shoes, and other things with which she helps and supports her family.

Emilia is asking for this loan to buy clothing, accessories and other merchandise.  This will help her solidify her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 50 years old and married to Simon. Their children are eighteen years of age. Hellen operates a shop that sells mobile phone accessories. She also operates a money transfer business in Narok town, Kenya. She has done these businesses for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of approximately 60,000 KES.

Hellen learned about VisionFund Kenya from a staff member who works for the organization. She has been advanced a second loan of 120,000 KES after successfully paying off the first one. She will use the funds to restock her shop with mobile phone accessories, as well as top up her float for the money transfer business.

Her dream is to put up several such shops in the growing town.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories and increase float for money transfer business

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es: José tiene 34 años de edad y junto a su compañera de vida se ganan la vida mediante la elaboración y venta de zapatos artesanales desde hace mucho tiempo. José es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor y responsable quien solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un corredor en su vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: José is 34-years-old and has worked alongside his wife selling handmade shoes for a long time. José is a hard-working, entrepreneurial and responsible man who is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a hallway on his home, for which he needs material such as bricks, cement, sand and iron. He hope to receive this support so that he can improve his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to build a  hallway in his home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Mary from Waterloo in the rural Western Area near Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children. Some years ago, Mary established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create income for her daily living expenses. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Mary requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, biscuits, pure water, and soft drinks to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Mary plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, biscuits, pure water, and soft drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Wilson Alejandro

texts.es: Wilson tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Wilson trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su familia lo necesario. Wilson desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos ya que  no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso por su cuenta pero si con la capacidad de pagar las cuotas mensuales que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Wilson is 29-years-old and lives in his own house alongside his life partner and their three-year-old daughter. Wilson works as a company close to where he lives and this pays for the household expenses and allows him to give his family what it needs. Wilson would like to improve the roof of their house because it has deteriorated, and for this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to be able to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails. He cannot afford to make the inicial investment himself; however, he will be able to make the monthly payments to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and nails to repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Isaac Group

texts.fr: La cliente Salumu est une commerçante depuis 20 ans présidente et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Isaac ». Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 46 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants, tous étudient.  Elle est vendeuse divers habillements. Elle installe son business dans une boutique du centre commercial de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des pantalons,  robes, complets pour garcons, filles, etc. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu du  ristourne. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite  accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux hommes et femmes entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Salumu, age 46, has been a reseller for 20 years. She is a member and the president of the business group “Isaac”. She is an experienced entrepreneur, and the widowed mother of 3 children who all go to school. 

Salumu sells clothing. She runs her business from a shop at a local shopping center. She is seeking a loan from Hekima to bolster her activity. She plans to buy pants, dresses, children’s clothing, etc. She started her business with member dividends. 

Her goals are to bolster her working capital, and to ensure that her children are fed and educated. 

She wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for wisely choosing to offer financial assistance to male and female entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system and without asking for collateral, especially in these difficult times following the war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, children’s clothing, etc.

loans.name: Revolution De Ferrier Group

texts.fr:
Yvrose est la coordinatrice de son groupe Revolution de ferrier. Elle est mariee elle est possede d'enfants. Yvrose voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir aven duit du Charbon. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Yvrose a dirigé son commerce de Charbon pendant les 17 dernières années.

Des autres membres Revolution de ferrier ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, vetement, chaussures, produit alimentaires, etc. Yvrose dit que ses défis principal est de venie une grande commercant. Yvrose habite dans la région de ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité.
texts.en:
Yvrose is the coordinator of her group "Revolution de ferrier". She is married and has one child. Yvrose would like to use this loan to invest in charcoal. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. She has been running her charcoal business for the last seventeen years. 

Other members of "Revolution de ferrier" have need of a loan for such businesses as charcoal, clothing, shoes, grocery items, etc. 

Yvrose says that her main challenges include [becoming] a major merchant. Yvrose lives in the Ferrier region Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Hoy Antonia tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con ayuda de su marido quieren dar a sus hijos todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo remodelar su estudio contable  para poder seguir dando un buen servicio.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de sillas y escritorios, con lo cual podrá seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Antonia is 39 years old and a very hard-working woman. With the help of her husband, Antonia wants to give her children everything that they themselves could not have. Antonia tells us that, with her previous loan, she was able to remodel her office in order to continue offering good service. 

Antonia is now applying for another loan in order to buy chairs and desks with which she will be able to keep on offering her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for her accountancy office.

loans.name: Mubeheza Group

texts.fr:
Angèle fait partie du groupe  Mubeheza et  habite à Cibitoke. C’est une veuve de   54 ans. Elle a 8 enfants âgés   de 12 à  35  ans, dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  poisson (ndagala)  depuis 1 an. 

Elle est  à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de poissons (ndagala) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  faire l’élevage de chèvres et de vaches et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Angèle is part of the group Mubeheza and lives in Cibitoke. She is 54 years old and a widow. She has eight children, from 12 to 35 years old, of whom five are students. 

Angèle has been doing commerce in fish (ndagala) for a year. 

She is on her second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of ndagala to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to raise goats and cows and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of fish (ndagala) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Ingris Celeste

texts.es:
Ingris es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Hola, soy Ingris, tengo 20 años de edad y con deseos de estudiar medicina. Vivo actualmente en Santo Domingo Este. Nací y crecí en Tamayo provincia Bahoruco, soy una de 4 hermanos y vivo con mis padres. Mi papa trabaja en el ministerio de agricultura y mi mama es ama de casa.  Los dos se han esforzado en darnos buena educación e inculcarnos buenos valores.

Quiero estudiar en la universidad central del este UCE. La carrera de medicina porque me gusta y deseo ser doctora, para poder ayudar a mi familia y mi comunidad.   Anteriormente curse las materias básicas en otra universidad pero por situaciones familiares me vi en la necesidad de suspenderla.

Quiero tener la oportunidad de terminar mi carrera en la meta que me he puesto, para seguir avanzando en el desarrollo de mi futuro. En caso de no calificar para este préstamo no tendré la oportunidad de estudiar en esta universidad, también cambiaria mi vida completamente para bienestar mío porque no podré terminar mi carrera para ayudar a mis padres.

Tengo como meta llegar a ser una buena doctora, en lo familiar es progresar para ayudar a mis padres y hermanos, salir adelante y ser un ejemplo para ellos. En cuanto a lo personal es crecer y ser un gran profesional, trabajando con pasión, entrega y profesionalidad dando ayuda a aquellos que no pueden tener un servicio médico de calidad por no tener buenos recursos.  Mi finalidad es poder darle un trato personalizado a todas las personas sin distinción.  Me encantaría trabajar especializarme en pediatría y trabajar en el Hospital Robert Reid Cabral, ayudando a esos niños que tanto lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Ingris is a young medical student and is requesting a loan to be able to pay her educational expenses. This is her story. 

"Hello. I'm Ingris, and i'm 20-years-old and I want to study medicine. I currently live in East Santo Domingo. I was born and raised in Tamayo in Bahoruco province, and I am one of four siblings. I live with my parents. My father works in the Ministry of Agriculture and my mother is a homemaker. Both my parents have gone to great lengths to give us a good education and to instill good vales in us. I want to go to the Central Eastern University (UCE) to study.  

I am interested in studying medicine because I enjoy it, and I would like to become a doctor to be able to help my family and my community. Previously, I took the core subjects at another college, but due to family reasons I had to stop going. I want to have the opportunity to finish my degree. This is my goal so that I can keep moving forward and developing myself in the future. If I do not qualify for this loan, I will not be able to go to college and it would change my life completely because I won't be able to help out my parents. My goal is to become a good doctor and to move forward to help out my parents and my siblings and to be an example for them. Personally, I want to become a great professional and to work with passion, commitment and professionalism helping those who cannot afford quality health services. My goal is to be able to give personalized attention to anyone who needs is, irrespective of their financial situation. I would love to specialize in pediatrics and to work in the Robert Reid Cabral Hospital, helping the children in need there."

loans.use: to pay higher education expenses

loans.name: Roylakhon

texts.ru: Ройлахон 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Ройлахон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ройлахон занимается полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ройлахон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: земельный надел размером 5,0 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу, подсолнух, перец, помидоры, огурцы, арбузы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, а точнее Ройлахон намерена заняться откармливанием скота с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене, Ройлахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Ройлахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Roylakhon is 52 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. Roylakhon has completed secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Roylakhon grows produce, having started 23 years ago with 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Roylakhon’s hard work, her farm now includes a land plot of 5 ha [12 acres] , where she grows potatoes, corn, sunflowers, peppers, tomatoes, cucumbers, watermelons. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, and more specifically to start raising livestock for later resale at a marked-up price, Roylakhon has applied to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan to buy cows. Roylakhon plans to use the income from her loan for an additional livestock increase. She also plans to save up for building a new house.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Paola Catherin

texts.es:
Ella es katerin una joven con muchos sueños y esperanzas, ella anhela estudiar pero los padres no le pueden colaborar económicamente y además vive muy lejos de la ciudad, katerin quiere estudiar algo relacionado con la salud oral. Ella piensa que “Una sonrisa vale más que mil palabras” y aun así ella no renuncia en cumplir el gran sueño.
Quiere estudiar este programa porque desea cumplir el más grande anhelo, para poder superarse y ayudar a los padres más adelante. Para ella seria gratificante que KIVA la apoyara a lograr  este gran sueño y convertirlo en realidad, Ya que la familia y ella no posee los  recursos necesarios para pagar la mensualidad.
texts.en: Catherin is a young woman who has many hopes and dreams. She wants to study, but her parents cannot afford to pay for her studies and she also lives far away from the city. Catherin would like to study something connected to oral health.She believes that "A smile is worth a thousand words" and she does not want to give up her dreams. She wants to study so that she can fulfill her dream of bettering herself and helping out her parents in the future. For this reason, she is grateful to KIVA for supporting her and helping her to turn her dream into reality, as her family cannot afford to pay the monthly payment.

loans.use: to pay for a month's education costs

loans.name: Jessica Natalia

texts.es:
La señorita Jessica Natalia requiere el subsidio del convenio de kiva porque es una gran ayuda para pagar cada semestre en la institución campo alto  para que  pueda  ingresar a la carrera técnico laboral de auxiliar en  administración hotelera,  ya que esta es una oportunidad que brinda campo alto para empezar a estudiar la carrera que solicito y con ayuda del convenio es una oportunidad mas para que pueda  salir adelante por los propios medios, esta oportunidad le ayudara a que cuando este  terminando pueda conseguir un trabajo para realizar la carrera profesionalmente  y ejercerla con satisfacción.
