Ella  podría ser beneficiada en el ámbito familiar ya que ella les podría ayudar en los gastos de la casa y seria un ejemplo a seguir para  las personas que la conocen, a nivel personal seria un logro que ella estaría cumpliendo para que pueda salir adelante sin depender de nadie y llegar a alcanzar muchos logros mas, a nivel profesional ella se vería beneficiada ya que ella podría ejercer la carrera sin ningún impedimento y podría ser una gran administradora hotelera con sueños y metas por seguir cumpliendo  y un gran ejemplo a seguir para los familiares y un gran orgullo. Ella es una mujer responsable, con gran carisma y respetuosa que quiere salir adelante y ser una gran profesional con gran reconocimiento.
texts.en: Jessica Natalia requires a Kiva loan because it would really help her pay for each semester at the Campo Alto institution so she can enter the hotel management degree program, since Campo Alto has provided this opportunity to study in the field she requested. With the aid of the loan agreement this would be an opportunity for her to get ahead by virtue of her own work, and this opportunity will help her when she finishes and is able to obtain a job in her field of study and do her job with a sense of fulfillment. This could benefit her in her family life since she would be able to help with household expenses and would set a good example for the people in her life. On a personal level it would be an accomplishment that would enable her to get ahead without having to depend on anybody and go on to achieve many more goals. On a professional level it would benefit her because she would be able to work in her field free of obstacles, be a great hotel manager with more dreams and goals to accomplish, set a great example for her family, and be a great source of pride. She's a responsible, charismatic, and respectful woman who wants to get ahead and be a great, renowned professional.

loans.use: To pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Geraldine Mary

texts.es:
Geraldine es una joven estudiante de Ingeniería Civil, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Geraldine tengo 18 años de edad. Actualmente vivo en  La Vega con mi madrina quien es mi tutora legalmente y trabaja como profesora en un centro privado. Soy hija única aunque tengo dos hermanos de crianza.

Desde pequeña siempre he sido muy proactiva y decidida, destacándome como líder dentro de los grupos y obteniendo las mejores notas en los cursos debido a la educación y principios que he recibido de mi madrina. 

Actualmente estoy cursando el tercer cuatrimestre de Ingeniería Civil en la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI), lo que me motivó a estudiar este tipo de carrera es la capacidad que poseen los ingenieros para construir obras junto con esto la adaptación rápida a nuestro mundo tan cambiante implementando la tecnología para la elaboración de las mismas. 

El interés de la solicitud de este préstamo es la necesidad y anhelo que poseo por ser profesional lo cual me permitirá desarrollarme como una mejor persona dentro de la sociedad aparte de que fue una promesa a mi madre antes de ella fallecer. En caso de no recibir el préstamo me sentiría desalentada ya que no cuento con los recursos económicos necesarios para continuar estudiando aun así buscaría otras opciones para seguir estudiando. 

Por último, mi deseo es que luego de graduarme poder pertenecer a una firma de contratista o constructora del país para poder desarrollar lo aprendido.
texts.en:
Geraldine is a young civil engineering student. She is requesting a loan to be able to cover her educational costs. 

This is her story:

My name is Geraldine. I am 18 years old. I currently live in La Vega with my godmother who is my legal guardian and who works as a teacher in a private school. I am an only child although I grew up with two "brothers". From a young age, I've been very proactive and determined, standing out as a leader in groups, and getting high marks in my classes thanks to the good upbringing given to me by my godmother. 

Currently, I am in the 3rd semester of the civil engineering program at the Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao [Catholic Technological University of Cibao]. I was interested in studying this field due to the capacity that engineers have for constructing things in our constantly changing world, and implementing the technology needed for this. 

I am requesting this loan as I truly wish to become a professional, which will allow me to better myself as a member of society. This was also a promise I made to my mother before she died. If I do not receive this loan, I will be discouraged and will not have sufficient funds to continue studying in this program, although I would still seek other ways to continue studying. Finally, my desire is to work for a construction or consulting firm after I graduate in order to build on what I have learned.

loans.use: to cover the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru:
Дилфузе 40 лет.  Она рано овдовела и  осталась одна с 4 детьми.  Несмотря ни на что она не потеряла веру в себя в возможность того, что сможет поднять своих детей  и  вырастить из них достойных своего общества людей.  Дилфуза положительная трудолюбивая женщина, она не боится трудностей. Она имеет многолетний опыт по разведению крупного рогатого скота. Это занятие помогло ей дать чувство уверенности в завтрашнем дне. Конечно подрастают дети и помогают ей  во всем , но Дилфуза хочет дать детям образование, чтобы в будущем получив хорошие специальности дети смогли  обеспечить себя и в старости были для нее опорой.
 Для этой цели конечно ей нужно много трудится. Дилфуза  обратилась в «Арванд» для приобретения кредита так как для покупки скота ей не хватает денежных средств. Она хочет увеличить  поголовье скота и приобрести  теленка.   Она заранее  благодарна за финансовую поддержку от Кива.
texts.en:
Dilfuza is 40 years old. She became a widow very early on in life and was left alone with four children. Despite this, she did not give up on herself and knew she could raise her children and bring them up to be dignified people in their community. Dilfuza is a positive, hardworking woman. She is not afraid of difficulties. She has many years of experience in raising and breeding cattle. This activity helped give her a sense of confidence in the future. Of course, her children grew up and help her with everything. Dilfuza wants to give her children a higher education so that, getting good degrees in the future, her children will be able to provide for themselves and will be able to support her in her old age.

She, of course, needs to work very hard to achieve this goal. Dilfuza is requesting a loan from Arvand to purchase cattle, as she does not have enough funds to buy them on her own. She wants to increase the size of her herd and purchase a calf. She thanks Kiva in advance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Elizabeth , tengo 19 años de edad, soy la mayor de dos hermanas, vivo con mis padres, en el sector Villa francisca de La Vega. Aunque mis padres trabajan nuestra situación económica no es muy buena, ya que no tienen un empleo con una buena remuneración económica.
Desde pequeña siempre me he interesado por la carrera de doctora en medicina y a pesar de las negativas de algunos familiares y amigos me he atrevido a seguir adelante para cumplir mi gran sueño, es por esta razón que en enero de 2013 inicié mis estudios en la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI), actualmente llevo 3 cuatrimestres y he cursado 16 materias más algunos laboratorios.
El préstamo de esta fundación es necesario porque con el costearía el más grande de todos mis sueños. De no recibirlo lamentablemente tendría que cambiarme de carrera que sería algo así como darme por vencida y abandonar mi sueño para cambiar mis proyectos. La bendición más grande que puedo recibir además de estar viva es la aprobación del préstamo porque gracias a el me realizaré como profesional y al mismo tiempo cumpliría mi sueño.
Mis metas académicas son graduarme con honores y en el mínimo de tiempo para comenzar así a realizarme como profesional en el área de la salud, ayudar a los que me necesiten y sobre todas las cosas servir de ejemplo para mis familiares, amigos y vecinos para que ellos se den cuenta de que cuando se quiere salir adelante se puede gracias al favor de Dios y de fundaciones como esta.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a young medicine student and is applying for a loan in order to cover the costs of her education. 

This is Elizabeth's story:

"My name is Elizabeth and I am 19 years old. I am the eldest of two siblings and live with my parents in the Villa Francisco de La Vega area. Although my parents work, we do not have a very good financial situation as they do not have jobs where they earn very much.

"From a young age, I have been interested in studying medicine and, in spite of the negativity from some family members and friends, I have decided to move forward in order to achieve my great dream. For this reason, in January 2013, I started my studies at the "Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao" (UCATECI). I have now completed three terms and sixteen modules, as well as some lab classes.

"The loan from this foundation is necessary as it will cover the costs of my biggest dream. Without it I would, unfortunately, have to change my studies, leaving me defeated and forcing me to abandon my dream and change my plans. The greatest blessing that I could receive - other than being alive - is having this loan approved. Thanks to this loan I will be able to become a professional and, at the same time, achieve my dream.

"My academic goals are to graduate with honours and start working in healthcare as soon as possible. I want to help those who need me and, above all, be a role model for my family, friends and neighbours, so that they realise that when one wants to prosper, one can, thanks to God and foundations such as this one."

loans.use: to cover further education costs.

loans.name: L'espoir Group

texts.fr:
Roland est le coordinateur de son groupe L'Espoir 4, 5 & 6. Il es un commercant. Tous les membres de ce groupe vivent dans la région DE BOR DE MER où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Roland a dirigé son commerce pendant 6 années. Avant de commencer ce commerce Il était un etudiant. 

Roland voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les produit divers(cosmetiques, chaussures, vetements). Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son commerce de produit divers. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme Divers produit. Il dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Roland is the coordinator of his group L'Espoir 4, 5 & 6. He is a merchant. All the members of the group live in the DE BOR DE MER region, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Roland has been running his business for six years. Before starting it, he was a student. 

Roland would like to use this loan to invest in diverse products (cosmetics, shoes, clothing). He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Other active members have need of a loan for doing commerce, such as general merchandise. He says that his main challenges include becoming a major merchant.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, shoes, clothing, etc. to resell

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 46-year-old Dora from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Dora runs a retail business. She sells charcoal. She has been running this business for 3 years. She works at the business 7 hours per day and 6 days per week. Dora says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Dora has requested a loan in order to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 años y 17 años de edad. Juan es albañil independiente y trabaja muy duro en construcciones para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Juan desea mejora las condiciones de su vivienda es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la humilde vivienda y para construir un muro de retención para lo cual necesita materiales como: tejas, madera, hierro, cemento, arena y ladrillos.
texts.en: Juan is 39-years-old and lives in his own house with his wife and their two children who are 15- and 17-years old. Juan is a self-employed builder and works very hard to provide for his family. Juan wants to improve the condition of his house, and for this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof of his humble home and to build a retaining wall. For this, he will need materials such as tiles, iron, cement, sand and bricks.

loans.use: to buy tiles, wood, iron, cement, sand and bricks to repair the roof of his home and to build a retaining wall

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu. She is in her late twenties and is from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children. She started her provision business just after she left school. She began her business because she wants to create income to educate her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes purchasing power is very slow.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more provisions such as milk, sugar and mayonnaise to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions such as milk, sugar and mayonnaise to expand her business.

loans.name: Roeurb's Group

texts.en:
Roeurb is 60 years old, widowed, and has one child. She is a rural villager from Banteay Meanchey province. The main sources of her income are from farming rice and and making baskets. She earns 20,000 KHR per day.

Roeurb's group requested a loan from VisionFund. As the leader, Roeurb will use her loan to buy seeds, insecticide, and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain a better crop yield than before so as to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ebenezer De La Rue Group

texts.fr:
Viergena est la coordonatrice de son groupe Ebenezer La Rue. Elle habite dans la région de Ouanaminthe d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle est marie et elle a deux enfants. 

Viergena a dirigé son commerce de produits divers pendant les 8 dernières années. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans achete produits divers, que des vêtements, des cosmétiques, des chaussures. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour faire du commerce comme vendre des produits alimentaires, charbon et des produits cosmetique. 

Viergena dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce et ayant une entreprise prospère.
texts.en:
Viergena is the coordinator of her group "Ebenezer La Rue". She lives in the Ouanaminthe region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. She is married and has two children.

Viergena has been running her business selling general goods for the last eight years. She would like to use this loan to invest in various goods, such as clothing, cosmetic products, and shoes. Other members of the group have need of a loan for businesses, such as grocery items, charcoal, and cosmetics. 

Viergena says that her dream is to expand her commerce and to have a prosperous enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, clothing, shoes, and other products to resell

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian, a sus 60 años de edad, se caracteriza por su carisma y don de gentes, es una mujer viuda que ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, especialmente después de la dolorosa muerte de su esposo. 
Desde hace 25 años inició su propio taller de confección, en el que fabrica prendas de línea propia, logrando obtener reconocimiento por la calidad de sus diseños y la agilidad con la que elabora y entrega las prendas; de esta manera ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para sustentar las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para el fortalecimiento de su negocio, con el dinero comprará una máquina recubridora y unas guías de confección, esto le permitirá agilizar y optimizar su producción, logrando un producto terminado con excelente calidad, lo que le permitirá fidelizar su clientela y generar mejores ingresos por ventas.
Mirian manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio e informa que su edad no es un impedimento para lograr lo que se propone, pues es consciente que esto le ayudará a mejorar el nivel de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Mirian is 60-years-old and is known for being charismatic and good with people. She is a widow who has raised her two children through effort and dedication, particularly after the death of her husband. She has been running her own sewing business for 25 years where she designs and makes clothes.  She has gained recognition for the quality of her designs and the fact that she produces the clothing very quickly. This is how she has been able to provide for her family over the years. She is requesting the loan to strengthen her business through buying an overlocker machine and some sewing manuals which will help he to increase her production and produce excellent quality clothing. This will give her more loyal customers and will improve her income through sales. Mirian says that her greatest wish is to see her business grow and believes that her age is no barrier to achieve the goals that she sets herself which will help to to improve her quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a overlocker machine and some sewing manuals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase various goods (shoes, cosmetics, clothing, etc.) to resell

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is 44 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom attend school. She is a villager from Banteay Meanchey province. She has been a farmer for 24 years and earns 34,200 KHR per day. 

Mao's group is requesting a loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Rom, 34, is a mother of five children all of whom are in school. She lives in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To cover her daily cost of living, she grows rice and pineapple as her main source of income. This is not her first cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan, which she has fully repaid back with success, enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she is a group leader of three borrowers to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pineapple seedlings to expand her business. She hopes to collect a better yield so that she earns extra income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pineapple seedlings to expand her business.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey is a farmer who plants rice as the main source of income in one area of the Battambang province. She is 45 years old and a mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Her other child helps with the household chores and the family’s business. Srey earns additional income by selling sweets. These businesses generate Srey about 32,000 KHR per day. 

Srey has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three loans which she has fully repaid back. Her past loans have helped Srey to uplift her lifestyle better than before. Now, she leads a group of two seeking a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She highly hopes that her rice will produce better crop yield than before

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es: Dorila, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos con su esposo con quien vive en una aldea de San Rafael, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, hace 15 años comenzó a cultivar café, el cual vende en los mercados locales de la zona. Lleva 5 ciclos de préstamos con el actual que es por 15,000 Lempiras, este préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para el cultivo de café. Su meta es crecer como productora y tener  una vivienda mejor.
texts.en: Dorila is 40-years-old, married and has three children. She lives with her family in a village in San Rafael, Lempira. She has always worked in basic grain farming and 15 years ago decided to start growing coffee which she sells in the local markets. She has received and paid back five loans. She will use the current loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy fertilizers and to pay the labor costs of coffee growing. Her dream is to grow as a coffee grower and to have a better home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for the labor costs of coffee production.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of four grown children. Jose has been in the farming business for more than 14 years now. This is the source of his income.

Jose is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this, he will be able to grow healthy crops thus augmenting his harvest and yield. In the future, Jose hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Sokly's Group

texts.en:
Sokly is a rural villager from the Kampong Cham province aged 31 years old. She is also a mother of two children, one school age and one too young for schooling. The only source of her income is cassava farming which she has been involved in for ten years. This business returned her 20,000 KHR per day.

Sokly just joined VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokly is going to use her portion to buy cassava seedlings and pesticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees. She hopes to gain a good crop yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and pesticide and to pay for plowing and labor fees.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the work they are doing, especially contributing to his tuition.

Mathew has approached UGAFODE for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to stock more drugs in his drug shop. Mathew's major challenge is competition from well-established clinics and drug shops who offer the same services that he does.

Mathew's dream for the future is to construct a big hospital with all the facilities so that he can deliver better services to the community. He is a hardworking man according to community members.

loans.use: to buy drugs for his clinic.

loans.name: Ty's Group

texts.en:
Ty is originally from a village located in Kampong Cham province and a married mother blessed with one young son. She is 25 years old. She and her husband are growing rice and cassava as their main source of income. She also raises pigs to earn additional income for her family. She has been with this business for 6 years and it has earned her 27,300 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth cycle loan for Ty with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past five loans have been fully repaid. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay a plowing fee and to buy pig feed. She hopes her business will enable her to build a decent house for her household.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Simplifia

texts.en:
Simplifia thanks the Kiva lenders for lending to him before. His output increased and so did his profits which eased his repayment. He will use this loan to buy organic fertilizers. He is grateful about the partnership and will do all it takes, including good repayments, to maintain the relationship. He is hardworking and honest.

The photograph also includes the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Turibamwe Group

texts.fr:
Turibamwe est un groupe de clients travaillant dans la province de Cibitoke. Les clients Joseph( sur la photo en T-shirt rouge) et J. paul juste à droite de Joseph, ont été exclus du groupe après la prise de photo.
Christophe est le représentant  groupe. Il a 42 ans et est mariée  à Jeanne, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés   de 3 mois à   15 ans, dont 5 étudient.

Il fait le commerce des habits depuis 15 ans. 

Il est  à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait construire une belle maison, acheter une bicyclette  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Turibamwe is a group of clients working in the province of Cibitoke. Clients Joseph (in a red T-shirt in the photo) and J. Paul (just to the right of Joseph) have been excluded from the group since the photo was taken. Christophe is the group's representative. He is 42 years old and married to Jeanne, a farmer. Together they have seven children, from 3 to 15 years old, of whom five are students.

Christophe has been doing commerce in clothing for fifteen years. He is on his second Turame loan. With the Kiva loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of clothing to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming year, he would like to build a nice house, purchase a bicycle, and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, oregano, eggs, fish and other products.

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zirirane est une brave commerçante et membre de la banque communautaire «Baraka Alanine»,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans, mariée à un chauffeur de transport en commun et mère de 8 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse  de divers habillements. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché  de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des jupes, boubous, des chemisettes, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son appuie aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Zirirane, is a good and honest merchant and a member of the communal bank "Baraka Alanine". An energetic entrepreneur, she is 45 years old, the mother of eight children (all students), and married to a taxi driver. This client is a vendor of various clothing. She displays her merchandise at a market in town. She started her business with initial capital from her husband. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for ten years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase skirts, boubous [traditional long flowing outfits], short-sleeved shirts, etc. Thus, she would like to build a house and provide education and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its support of small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult period post-conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, boubous, short-sleeved shirts, etc.

loans.name: Sabine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de  Sabine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 45 ans n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Sabine est mariée à un certain Sylvain. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sabine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par Sabine et son mari. Pour ce faire, Sabine vend des pâtes alimentaires, de la tomate en boîte, du sucre et du savon de façon ambulante depuis dix neuf ans. Sabine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Sabine ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is composed of four persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Sabine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 45 years old and did not attend school. She is married to man named Sylvain. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. She lives with her husband and children. 

The diverse family expenses are covered by Sabine and her husband. To do so, she has been hawking pasta, canned tomatoes, sugar, and soap, for nineteen years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business, Sabine along with the other members of her group are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase pasta, canned tomatoes, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Fanny Marlene

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado es un Cantón muy hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tenemos muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con mucha amabilidad
En este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio la señora Fanny una mujer luchadora de 26 años ella es madre soltera su hija tiene 9 años por la que cada día desea superarse para darle lo necesario para su preparación diaria, ella estudia en la escuela fiscal del Cantón, 
Tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en general de este negocio aprendió desde niña junto con los padres, trabaja un promedio de 15 horas diarias sin descanso ya que no tiene quien le ayude en el negocio empieza su día a las 6 de la mañana a 8 o 9 de la noche. Este préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio comprando más víveres para que sus cliente encuentren todo lo que necesiten y poder brindarles un mejor servicio, la señora Fanny agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Ecuador's Pedro Vicente Maldonado canton is very beautiful. The climate is warm and the people here are friendly and hard-working. This canton is a tourist spot as across it there are many hostelries to rest and be given very friendly treatment.

And it is here in Pedro Vicente Maldonado that the pluck 26-year-old Fanny lives. She is a single mother to a nine-year-old daughter, for whom every day Fanny wants to do better to give her daughter everything that she needs. Fanny's daughter attends a local public school.

Fanny has a small shop selling general supplies. She learned this trade as a girl, alongside her parents. Fanny works an average of fifteen hours per day, with no break, as there is no one to help her. Fanny works from 6am until 8 or 9pm. Fanny will invest this loan in her business, buying more supplies so that her customers can find everything that they need and so that she can offer them better service. Fanny is grateful to "Fundación Alternativa" and to Kiva for this support and opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more products and supplies.

loans.name: Silvia Irene

texts.es: Silvia de 34 años de edad es madre soltera y habita junto a su hija de 7 años de edad en casa propia. Silvia se gana la vida mediante la venta de tortillas las cuales elabora y luego pone a la venta dos veces al día. Silvia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su hija mejores condiciones de vida. Silvia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada y madera para poder proceder lo antes posible a la mejora.
texts.en: Silvia is 34 years old and a single mother. She lives with her seven-year-old daughter in a house that she owns. Silvia makes a living selling tortillas, which she makes and goes out to sell twice daily. Silvia is an enterprising and plucky woman; she does everything in her power to give her daughter better living conditions. Silvia is applying for this loan from "FUSAI" in order to invest in repairing the roof of her home, as it is in bad condition. To do this work as soon as possible, Silvia needs to buy materials such as galvanised laminate sheeting, and wood.

loans.use: to buy galvanised laminate sheeting and wood in order to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es:
Felipe de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de básica en la escuela del cantón donde vive, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, son padres de  cuatro hijos, todos están acompañados, son independientes porque todos trabajan. 

Don Felipe, se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y la ganadería, trabajo familiar por años, también vende queso, cuajada y crema. El crédito será destinado a la agricultura, compra de abonos y fertilizantes.

Espera a futuro dejarle a su familia un capital, con el cual pueda seguir trabajando y en un lugar propio.
texts.en: Felipe is 64-years-old and studied up to second grade of elementary school in the village where he lives. His wife is a homemaker and they have four children who are all now independent and married. Felipe works in farming and cattle rearing - something that his family have done for years. He also sells cheese, curds and cream. He will use the loan to buy manure and fertilizer for farming. He hopes to be able to leave his family enough money so that they can continue working and in a place of their own.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es:
Juan Sebastian empezó a estudiar en Campo alto la carrera de auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos en el primer semestre del año 2013 porque desde un principio siempre se había interesado en temas relacionados con el funcionamiento del cuerpo humano y finalmente porque decidió estudiar para aportar a el objetivo principal que es estudiar medicina luego de esta carrera. 
Estudiar esta carrera le da a Sebastián una oportunidad para aprender mientras trabaja en una farmacia cosas relacionadas con la carrera de medicina y al mismo tiempo aplicar cosas que aprenda en medicina en el espacio laboral con los clientes.
No obstante, para cumplir la meta Sebastian aprovecharía cualquier apoyo financiero que podría recibir y mejor aún un convenio Kiva para poder tener el subsidio en un apoyo económico para el estudio.
texts.en: Juan Sebastian started studying the degree of pharmaceutical assistant in Campo Alto in the first semester of 2013 as he has always been interested in how the human body works and because he decided that when he finishes this degree, he wants to study to become a doctor. Studying this degree give Sebastian the opportunity to learn while he works in a drugstore and therefore to be able to apply what he has learned about medicine when he deals with customers. Nevertheless, to achieve this goal, Sebastian would really appreciate any financial support available and especially from Kiva so that he can pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school fees

loans.name: Villa Itaipu Group

texts.es:
Villa Itaipu  es un grupo que se formó con la unión de 19 mujeres, están en su 8vo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres. También están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, con lo cual podrán saber la situación de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder seguir trabajando por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nelly, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestibles. A parte de las capacitaciones correspondientes y de los seguimientos ellas están mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y tratando de ganarse la vida de una forma honesta.
texts.en:
Villa Itaipu is a group made up of 19 women in their 8th cycle of the committee for women and who are also participating in the elimination of poverty survey to learn about their situations and be able to continue working to better each of their lives.

Nelly is one of the members who makes and sells food.  They are improving their quality of life through their training.

She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, condiments, beef, chicken, and other things so she can continue with her sales and trying to earn an honest living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Coralia

texts.es: Doña María,de 50 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 2 hijas que viven con ella aun, y es dueña de una tienda ubicada en su casa desde hace varios años, ella esta solicitando este crédito para ampliar su producto en su tienda ya que le hacen falta muchos productos como aceite, golosinas, aguas gaseosas, pañales para adulto y bebe artículos de consumo diario, también quiere invertir en su venta de refacciones y comidas que tiene los fines de semana en la Universidad de San Raymundo, ya que le piden comidas ha veces no tiene muchos ingredientes y además comprar una mesa para que los estudiantes puedan comer allí, ella espera que fape le pueda apoyar ya que sus hijas están estudiando y necesitan del apoyo de ella y su esposo no gana lo suficiente para ayudarla.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and married. She has two children who still live with her. For several years she has been the owner of a store located in her home.

She is requesting this loan in order to expand the inventory of her store, as she needs many products such as cooking oil, candy,  soft drinks, diapers for adults and babies, as well as basic household necessities. 

She also wishes to invest in her business selling snacks and meals, which she does on weekends at the University of San Raymundo.  Her customers ask her for meals, and sometimes she doesn't have many ingredients. She also wishes to buy a table so that the students can eat there. 

She is hoping that Fape can help her, as her daughters are going to school, and need her support, and her husband does not earn enough to help her.

loans.use: To buy basic household necessities.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus cuatro hijos de 8 años, 10 años, 12 años y 15 años de edad. Herminia se dedica a la venta de pollo menudeado de manera ambulante. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y no es seguro.
texts.en: Herminia is 40-years-old and lives in her own house together with her four children who are 8- 10- 12- and 15-years-old . Herminia is a street vendor and sells chicken. She has worked in this business for a long time and has a lot of experience and more and more customers every day. To improve her quality of life, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair the roof of her home as it is not is good condition and it is unsafe.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair the roof of the family home

loans.name: Delphine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Delphine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 40 n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Delphine est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Thomas. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Delphine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par Delphine et son mari. Pour ce faire, Delphine vend des brosses à dents végétales, des pâtes dentifrices et des brosses à dents modernes de façon ambulante depuis dix ans. Delphine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Delphine ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Delphine (with her hand raised in the photo), is 40 years old and did not attend school. She is married to driver named Thomas. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. She lives with her husband and children. 

The diverse family expenses are covered by Delphine and her husband. To do so, she has been hawking plant-based toothbrushes, toothpaste, and modern toothbrushes for ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business, Sabine along with the other members of her group are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes and toothpaste

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery fue muy dedicada a lo que hacía desde muy pequeña, se esforzó mucho para  lograr lo que se  proponía y hoy en día conserva esta característica. Entró a estudiar la carrera de Auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos en Campoalto en el primer semestre del año 2013 porque le agradaba la idea de trabajar en algo que pudiera aportar un poco más a las personas que en solo satisfacer la necesidad y por otro lado también porque siempre le había interesado todo lo relacionado con el cuerpo humano y el funcionamiento. 
Como siempre lo ha sido, ella hace lo posible por dedicarse a la carrera con el fin de salir adelante y cumplir la meta que se propuso al inicio: aprender tanto como sea posible estudiando y laborando en droguerías para reunir bases y cualquier cosa que pueda contribuir a el desarrollo como persona integral en todos los aspectos de la vida.
Durante este proceso Luz Mery aprovecharía de la mejor forma la ayuda que le pueda dar kiva, ya que podra demostrar  las capacidades y así crear una buena imagen de sí misma y poder salir adelante, no solo con ayuda financiera sino que también con ayuda a posesionarse en una gran empresa en la que ella pueda aportarle  y la empresa pueda aportar a las metas.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is very dedicated to what she has been doing since she was very small. She exerts herself greatly in order to achieve what she proposes, and today she maintains this characteristic. She entered CampoAlto in the first semester of 2013 to study for a career as an assistant in pharmaceutical services, because she liked the idea of working in something that supported people a little more than just satisfying their needs, and also because she has always been interested in everything about the relationship of the human body and its functioning.

As she has always done, she does whatever is possible to dedicate herself to her course of studies, with the aim of advancing and meeting the goal that she proposed at the beginning: to learn as much as possible by studying and working in drugstores to compile the essentials and anything that can contribute to her development as a whole person in all aspects of life.

During this process, Luz Mery would take advantage in the best way of the help that Kiva can give her, since she will be able to demonstrate her abilities and thus create a good image of herself and be able to advance, not only with the financial help but also with the help of positioning herself in a great endeavor in which she can support herself and the venture can support her goals.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school fees

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana tiene 42 años de edad y se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 13 años y 6 años de edad. Ana es una mujer visionaria quien desea lo mejor para su familia. Con mucho entusiasmo solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un pequeño cuarto en el costado de su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro y así poder dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old and has been working as a housekeeper for a long time. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children, ages 13 and 6. Ana is a woman with vision, who wishes the best for her family. 

With a great deal  enthusiasm, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the construction of a small room at the side of her dwelling. With the amount requested she will buy bricks, cement, sand and rebar, and this way be able to begin construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand and rebar, in order to build a room.

loans.name: Sinisigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sinigui est composé de 6 femmes mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogames et polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Kanadjiguila (commune du Mandé dans le cercle de Kati) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, fruits (bananes, mangues et pommes), habits, ustensiles, jus et condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits (bananes, mangues et pommes). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une charretée de mangues, 4 cartons de pommes et 50kg de banane à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à kanadjguila à une clientèle mixte. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Sinigui is composed of six married women equally in monogamous and polygamous households. The women average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in the Kanadjiguila district (Commune du Mandé, in Cercle de Kati). The women know one another through community ties. The group members have small-scale businesses involving fruit (bananas, mangoes, and apples), clothing, utensils, juice drinks, and condiments. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Fatoumata (the woman sitting in the middle in the photo) is famous for selling fruit (bananas, mangoes, and apples). She intends to use her loan to purchase a cart load of mangoes, 4 boxes of apples, and 50 kg of bananas, in Bamako. Sales are made retail to a mixed customer base in Kanadjguila. 

With this loan, Ms. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to purchase a residential plot of land with this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages wholesle

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 48 year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She runs a small sari-sari, or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Her husband is a fisherman.
Josefina is asking for a loan to buy more stock for the store, such as canned goods, candies, noodles, soaps and toiletries and new fishing nets. With this, she will be able to improve her sari sari store, thus allowing her to attract more buyers. Her husband will be able, as well, to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
In the future, Josefina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the store, such as canned goods, candies, noodles, soaps and toiletries and new fishing nets

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: Doña Rosario de 49 años de edad es de  san Martin, desde hace mas de 3 años tiene una tienda de consumo diario en dicha localidad. El sueño de Rosario es surtir mucho mas su tienda ya que es la única que hay en su localidad y tiene mucha demanda, el problema es que por falta de capital no puede comprar por mayor su producto y por eso es que solicita el crédito. Agradece a Fape y Kiva el apoyo que le han brindado y se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en: Rosario, 49, is from St. Martin. For more than 3 years, she has had a shop for basic groceries in her own location. Rosario's dream is to stock her store because it is the only one in her area and she needs to meet a high demand. The problem is her lack of capital. She cannot buy wholesale products, therefore, she is requesting a loan. She thanks Kiva and FAPE for the support they are providing and agrees to be responsible with her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 34 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Joseph, and they are blessed with seven children aged 18, 16, 14, 12, 10, 8 and 6 years old.

Ann does pig farming, a business she has been doing for five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the funds to purchase more pigs for her farming business.

She plans to use the gains from her business to repay her loan, educate her children and boost her pig farming business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her pig farming business.

loans.name: Ya Alimamy

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Ya Alimamy from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has six children.  She began this business to be independent and take care of her family.  

Ya Alimamy runs a retail business.  She sells charcoal. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business eight hours per day and seven days per week. Ya Alimamy says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operating area.

 Ya Alimamy has requested a loan in order to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 27-year-old hard-working gentleman, married to Ann and a father of two. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the last three years earning a monthly income of about KES 30,000. He learned about VisionFund Kenya from some of his colleagues who are funded by the organization.

Philip has acquired his first loan of KES 87,880 which will enable him to purchase his own motorbike. He will be able to earn more due to the increased flexibility and already established customer base.

Philip plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan as well as boost his savings account. He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goals and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Gbassay from Waterloo1 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with seven children, five currently attending school. 

Gbassay runs a retail business selling charcoal and wood for resale. She has been running this business for 16 years. She works at the business seven hours per day and six days per week. Gbassay says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Gbassay has requested a loan to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in and around the food and customer service industry his entire life. His father made his living working in restaurants, and Daniel has worked for hotels and restaurants all over San Diego. As a first-generation college student, Daniel pursued a business degree with a background in accounting and economics at San Diego State University, eventually transferring to National University, where he had more flexibility to work while earning his degree. 

Last year, Daniel’s brother-in-law, who has been a sushi chef for over 15 years, approached him with an opportunity to partner in starting a sushi business. Daniel happily accepted, and they launched Sushi Uno, a pop-up food vendor serving fresh sushi at outdoor farmers’ markets and festivals. The combination of his years of business experience and his new partner's talent as a sushi chef enabled their fledgling business to slowly gain a loyal following at the two farmers’ markets where they regularly sell. 
	
Sushi Uno strives to produce the highest quality products possible while keeping it affordable. They buy their fish fresh from Catalina Offshore, a company that is ethical and sustainable, and once their food truck is up and running, Sushi Uno aims to be fully organic. 

“Our sushi is something different,” said Daniel. “We want to not only offer the freshest fish available to our customers, but also put our own Mexican twist on it.”

This $10,000 Kiva loan will enable Sushi Uno to go mobile by starting a sushi food truck. They plan to renovate a truck, as well as pay for the supplementary costs, such as permits and licenses. Daniel has done his research on food trucks in the area and sees a lot of room for their unique business. He plans to focus on serving customers outside of breweries, while also maintaining their interest in the San Diego farmers’ markets scene. With a focus on customer service and providing top quality food at affordable prices, Daniel wants to build a top-notch brand while also giving back to the community.
	
Daniel is committed to this business and is pictured above in the center working alongside his employees, Azucena and Bertin. He hopes that diversifying his business revenue will allow him to go full-time at Sushi Uno, and eventually allow him to hire other relatives. 
	
Check out their Square website at: http://squareup.com/market/sushi-uno

loans.use: to renovate a food truck, as well as pay for the supplementary costs, such as permits and licenses.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Sonnie from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 6 children. She began this business to be independent and take care of her family.  

Sonnie runs a retail business selling charcoal. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business eight hours per day and seven days per week. Sonnie says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Sonnie has requested a loan to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Brighter Mothers Group

texts.en: Brighter Mothers is a group of women who live in Murang'a county, located in central Kenya. The group was formed in February 2012 with an aim of pooling members' funds to enable them start up a small business. They opened a stall to sell charcoal and have been successfully running this small business since April 2012. Individual members share the profits from this business. They took their first loan to purchase energy-saving cook stoves to sell concurrently with the charcoal. This was successful and they were able to fully pay back their loan. As a result, other women from Murang'a county have been able to take advantage of energy-saving cook stoves. This has created more awareness and cook stoves are in high demand in the region. The group has taken a second loan to purchase more cook stoves to meet the demand from the region. Part of the loan will also be used to purchase solar lamps as a introductory product in this region.The loan will be paid in 12 months.

loans.use: To restock their stall with cook stoves and solar lamps

loans.name: Lecene

texts.en: Lecene has already taken out three loans to launch his clean energy retail business. He is selling his EarthSpark clean energy products on a rent-to-own basis in his community. After renting out the entire inventory, he bought clean energy products with his last loan and still has customers calling him with more orders. He is taking out a fourth loan to help meet the demand in his community for a source of renewable energy that will allow customers save money while helping the environment.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent a shop in the center of Mazatenango.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina se dedica  a la venta de comida en la ciudad de challambamba en uno de los mercados de la ciudad antes mencionada desde muy temprano y todos los días. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Ella continua perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, aceite, leche, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Marcelina sells food in the city of Challambamba in one of the town's markets very early in the morning every day. She has already put several years into this business and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She continues to belong to the communal bank "Sol Naciente de Mojopata" ["Rising Sun of Mojopata"]. The Mojopata community is located in the district of Challabamba, in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Peru. This time she requires a loan for the opportunity to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil, bags of rice, sugar, and other products. 

She appreciates and values this loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall such as vegetables, meats, cooking oil, and more.

loans.name: Berta Lucía

texts.es:
Berta es una mujer pujante y trabajadora, madre soltera de un hijo al que ha sacado adelante con mucho empeño y dedicación.
Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, inició con una tienda de abarrotes en la que trabajó durante varios años, pero la cerró porque se trasladó para otro pueblo, luego de radicarse comenzó un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas y de manera alterna, presta el servicio de manicure y pedicure a domicilio; de esta forma ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia.
El crédito que solicita será utilizado para la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas con plancha y freidora incluida, esto le permitirá agilizar el proceso de preparación de los alimentos que ofrece y así mejorar el servicio, logrando fidelizar a sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos para su familia.
Berta manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder acreditar y fortalecer sus negocio y poder brindar oportunidades de empleo, lo que permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y la de las personas que le colaboren.
texts.en:
Berta is a vigorous and hard-working woman. She is the single mother of a son whom she has raised with great effort and dedication.

During her working life she has worked as an independent businesswoman. She set up a grocery store in which she worked for a number of years, but she closed it because she moved to another town. After settling there, she began a business of selling fast food, and as an alternative, she offers manicure and pedicure services in her home. In this way, she has managed to generate sufficient resources to pay the expenses of her family.

The loan that she is applying for will be used to purchase a fast-food cart with a griddle and a fryer included. This will allow her to speed up the process of preparing the food that she offers and thus improve her service, building customer loyalty and improving the income for her family.

Berta states that her greatest wish is to be able to position her business in the market and strengthen it so that she can offer employment opportunities, which will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family and that of the people who work with her.

loans.use: to buy a fast food card with a griddle and fryer included

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 51 years old, married, and has 12 children.
Petronila has been in the farming business with her husband for more than two years now.  She wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this in mind, she joined CEVI in order to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to micro entrepreneurs like her.  Petronila is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is thirty-four years old and is a mechanic who owns a retail shop. He does motorcycle transportation for additional income.  He works seven days a week and twelve hours a day.  He started business in 1992 so as to improve  his family's welfare.  He gets side income from a bar. He is a member of Goodlife solidarity group, where members guarantee each other so as to access credit.  His business is affected by weather changes.
Patrick is acquiring a loan to restock beers and soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Kurniati

texts.en:
Kurniati lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. She is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Kurniati began working with Ruma five months ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $33 – $34 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Gidget

texts.en:
Gidget got her start in the holistic wellness industry in Hawaii as a massage therapist specializing in sports therapy.  With a desire to expand her skills, she began exploring other types of holistic health treatments, eventually learning how to provide skincare as an esthetician.  She opened her first day spa in Hawaii in 2002 and grew it into one of the most popular spas on the islands.

A single mom with three kids, Gidget is always looking for new opportunities to grow her business and expand her talents to better provide for her family.  In 2006, with a desire for ongoing training, she moved to California to pursue her Masters of Esthetics degree, as well as receive her international esthetics certification.  

After spending a couple of years mastering her skills, she opened another day spa in Chula Vista, CA in 2012.  Xscape Day Spa specializes in offering a range of unique skin treatments not found in other spas.  Gidget prides herself in staying up-to-date with the latest treatments and is constantly investing in new equipment to offer her clients the most luxurious experiences.

Gidget will use her $4,500 Kiva loan to purchase an infrared machine to expand her services for her clients.  According to Gidget, the infrared skin treatment is “the new body wrap.”

As Gidget continues to expand her spa services, she hopes to continue gaining more loyal clients and expand her spa.  She also hopes to begin training others in the unique treatments that she offers, and be able to share her passion with others.

“I love what I do,” said Gidget. “I will do it until the day I die.”

loans.use: to purchase an infrared machine

loans.name: Dankay

texts.en:
Meet Dankay.  She is in her late twenties and is from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children. For the past five years, Dankay has had her clothing material business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business.

Dankay requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Dankay plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y continua a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde cosecha manzana, duranzo, menbrillo y otros productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Celestino lives in the community of Mojopata and continues to work in agriculture. He has several plots of land on which he grows apples, peaches, quinces, and other products. Celestino has been in this business for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. He is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”.

Celestino is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. He appreciates and values the loan, so he promises to handle his monthly payments with great responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba, Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dúo Exlusivas Group

texts.es: Dúo Exclusivas, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Sarai de 24 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de helados desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para seguir helaborando helados ya que sus clientes han aumentado y tiene buena oportunidad de crecer en su negocio es el primer credito que solicita a kiva y espera que le puedan apoyar
texts.en: The "Dúo Exclusivas" group includes Sarai, a 24 year old who has worked selling ice cream for many years.  She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to purchase more supplies to continue making ice cream because her customer base has increased, and she has a good chance to grow her business.  This is the first loan that she has requested from Kiva, and she hopes that they will be able to help her.

loans.use: purchase supplies to make ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Ramakanta

texts.en:
Ramakanta is a 31-year-old differently able man. He lives in a small village of Phulbani district of Odisha state, India, with his father, a younger brother, his wife and child, aged 5 years. 

He owns a betel shop where he sells betel, biscuits, chocolates, cosmetic items, cold drinks, etc. He keeps cold drinks on ice for selling. He wants to purchase a fridge for the keeping of cold drinks. 

His father is a farmer engaged in paddy cultivation, and his brother goes to university. Ramakanta’s wife and father help him in his business activity.

Ramakanta has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR to purchase a fridge, stationery items and cosmetic items. He is very happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge, stationery items and cosmetic items.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Doña Blanca, tiene 46 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y reside en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Lleva 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa como ser pantalones, vestidos, camisas, blusas y ropa intima para damas y caballeros. Su forma de vender es ambulante y por pedidos. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y con el va comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas, vestidos  y ropa interior para surtir su negocio y poder aumentar sus ventas. Su meta que propone es mantener el negocio para ayudar a sus padres en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca is 46 years old and lives in free union with her husband. She resides in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro. For eight years, she has made a living selling clothing, like pants, dresses, shirts, blouses, and underwear for men and women. Her form of selling is in street markets and by order.

The loan she is requesting is for 10,000 HNL and with it, she is going to buy clothing like pants, shirts, dresses, and underwear to stock her business and be able to increase her sales. Her proposed goal is to maintain her business in order to help her parents with what they need.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale, including pants, dresses, shirts, and underwear for women and men.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier is a forty five-year-old married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children. He has been a farmer for twelve years, and his main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. He has a side income of a drug shop where he earns an extra income.

Xavier has a vision of buying land to grow crops, moving his business to a more permanent location and expanding his business to new markets. He needs a loan to buy mulches and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy mulches and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Carolina Maricela

texts.es: Carolina tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Carolina se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias desde hace 8 años. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante en las principales zonas de su localidad. Carolina desea construir una pila con baño para almacenar el agua ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava. Espera poder contar con este apoyo dado que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso por su cuenta.
texts.en:
Carolina is 25 years old and lives in a house with her family.  Carolina has worked selling clothing and sandals for the past 8 years.  She sells her products on foot in the main areas of her city.  

Carolina hopes to build a sink with a reservoir to store water as she currently does not have an adequate place to do so.  For this, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing bricks, cement, sand and gravel.  She hopes to receive this support as she does not have the resources to pay for the materials on her own.

loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, sand and gravel to build a sink.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata.  She is a 32-year-old  from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has two children between the ages of 7 and 12 years. Her children are currently attending school. For the past five years, Fatmata has had her tailoring business. She began her business because she wanted to create a permanent source of income to support her children. She works at the business eight hours per day and six days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

 Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase different kinds of clothing material for resale.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Channov's Group

texts.en: Channov is 50 years old, a mother of six children, and a resident of Kampong Cham province. Rice farming, which she has been involved in for 21 years, is the only main source for her to earn income in order to support her family. She has been a borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two past loans. Her past loan, which she has completely to repay, has enabled her build one decent latrine for her household for a better standard of living. Now, she is a leader of a group consisting of two members to get a new loan. For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for purchasing fertilizer. She highly believes that she can gain a good and better yield than before.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children. All her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a boutique selling second hand clothes. She sells her products ona  retail basis at the market. She works for six days a week. She has been in this business for the last three years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACC0 to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality.  Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children and also buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has one child.  For five years, Salamatu has had her clothing material business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family welfare and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Agustín, tiene 27 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa y reside en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura ayudando a su padre al cultivo de maíz y arroz y hace 5 años que se dedico a la producción de arroz con su propia parcela. La producción es vendida en la misma zona donde vive. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para fumigar y dar asistencia al cultivo de arroz. Tiene como meta cultivar una manzana más de arroz y lograr hacer su propia casa.
texts.en:
Agustín is 27 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife.  They live in the city of Negrito, Yoro.  He has always worked in agriculture, helping his father grow corn and rice.  Five years ago, he devoted himself to growing rice on his own plot of land.  His harvest is sold in the same area in which he lives.

He has requested a loan for 15,000 Lempiras to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor to fumigate and care for his rice crops.  His goal is to cultivate another 7,000 square feet of rice and build his own home.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and pay for labor to fumigate and care for his rice crops.

loans.name: Nityananda

texts.en:
Nityananda is a 31-year-old differently able man. He lives with his father, wife and two children in a small village of Phulbani district of Odisha state, India. 

Nityananda owns a grocery shop and is also engaged in paddy cultivation. His father helps him in his livelihood activity. He earns 3,000 INR per month from his grocery shop and also earns 40,000 INR annually from his paddy cultivation.

Nityananda wants to increase his business turnover by adding a fridge and household items in bulk so he can increase his profit. For that, he has applied for a loan with People's Forum (Kiva's partner) to purchase a fridge, rice, edible oil, flour, sugar, biscuits, etc. He is thankful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge, rice, edible oil, flour, sugar, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para fumigar sus terrenos agrícolas. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
