Mario lives in Mojopata and is a farmer who raises livestock and small animals such as Guinea pigs.  He has been farming for several years and things have been going well thanks to his dedication.  He is a member of the “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” and needs a loan to fumigate his farmland.

He is grateful and values this loan and is committed to making her monthly payments responsibly. (Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district in the Paucartambo province, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to fumigate his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Claudia Noemy

texts.es: Claudía tiene 29 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, abuela e hija. Ella se dedica a la venta de huevos desde hace hace dos años y es así como ha venido sacando lo necesario para mantener a su familia. Ella desea terminar de construir su vivienda dado que por falta de recursos no ha logrado hacer el corredor de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, hierro y cemento. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Claudía is 29 years old and resides in her own home with her life companion, her grandmother, and her daughter. She has been selling eggs for two years and this business has enabled her to provide what she needs to sustain her family.

Claudía wants to finish the construction of her home, but she lacks the resources that are needed to build a corridor for her house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, iron, and cement. She hopes to receive this loan because she wants better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, iron, and cement for building a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: FRANCISCO vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar dos ganados. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Francisco lives in Mojopata and farms and raises livestock.  He is a member of the “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” and needs this loan to buy two livestock.  He is grateful for and values this loan and is committed to making his payments on time and responsibly.  (Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district in the Paucartambo province, Cusco, Peru)

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Carlos Hilario

texts.es: HILARIO vive en la comunidad de Mojopata y se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y venta de flores, él pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas flores. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: HILARIO lives in Mojopata and farms, raises livestock, and sells flowers.  He is a member of the “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” and needs this loan to buy more flowers.  He is grateful for and values this loan and is committed to making his payments on time and responsibly.  (Mojopata is located in the Challabamba district in the Paucartambo province, Cusco, Peru)

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en: Venancio is a 29 year-old married man with two children living in Kagadi-Uganda.  He has operated a laboratory since 2001, delivering health services to clients and generating income to his family.  He also owns video halls. He is also a doctor, and he hopes to grow his business. However, he is challenged by having a small number of clients due to the lack of some machines. Venancio intends to use the loan to buy an HB meter and HAEMO for laboratory use.

loans.use: to buy HB meter and HAEMO for laboratory use

loans.name: Kathery Fernanda

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos es un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora, este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, en el mismo su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando concierto y bailes populares en este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio la señorita Kathery una joven luchadora de 18 años ella es soltera y vive con su madre viene de una familia humilde de bajos recursos económicos lo que le impidió continuar con sus estudios y tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su madre en los gastos del hogar. 
Se dedica a la producción de cerdos aprendió de este negocio junto con la mamá,trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre el negocio y el empleo que tiene en un almacén del Cantón, este crédito lo invertirá en el negocio comprará unos cerdos más y el alimento para los mismos. Kathery agradece a fundación alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a settlement with a warm climate, very friendly and hardworking people, and various tourist attractions.  Its people are happy and like to enjoy the popular concerts and dances.  Kathery lives and has her business in this settlement.  She is 18 years old, single, and lives with her mother.  She comes from a humble family of limited resources which kept her from finishing school.  She had to go to work to help her mother with the household expenses.

She raises pigs and learned this from her mother, and works an average of 10 hours a day between this business and her job at a store.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more pigs and feed.  Kathery is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunity to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Julia  Elena

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su  gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, como la cascada del amor y el teleférico para llegar a la misma en este Cantón su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando concierto y bailes populares. 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Julia una mujer luchadora de 51 años ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos y sus padres no le pudieron dar el estudio, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos la mayor tiene 28 años y la ultima tiene 15 años, solo la última vive y depende de ella, ella se dedica al negocio de los cerdos, aprendió de esta actividad desde su niñez junto con los papas,  trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias además del empleo que tiene en un restaurante del sector. Solicita el crédito para iniciar un puesto de comidas, y espera que su situación y las de su hija mejore, la señora Julia agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a warm and humid canton, whose people are very kind and hardworking.  This canton has many tourist attractions like the Waterfall of Love and the cable car that takes you to the waterfall.  The people of the canton are very happy and like to take part in the many organized festivities, concerts and folk dances.  Julia lives and owns a business in this canton.  She is a 51 year fighter who comes from a low-income family, and her parents were not able to put her in school.  She is a single mother and has four children.  The eldest is 28 years old, and the youngest is 15.  Only the youngest lives with her and depends on her.  

Julia works raising pigs.  She learned this activity from her parents as a young girl.  She works about 10 hours a day in addition to her job in an area restaurant.  She is seeking this loan to start a food stall.  She hopes that her and her daughter's situation will improve.  Julia thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the help and support they have provided.

loans.use: to open her food stall.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone!  This is 44-year-old Aminata from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has four children. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Aminata runs a retail business.  She sells palm oil for resale. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business 15 hours per day, six days per week. Aminata says that the business is doing well because out of the profit she is able to take care of the home.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallon of palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Doña Josefina, tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos,vive en una comunidad que pertenece a San Francisco de Yojoa junto a dos de sus hijos y nietos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio y a la agricultura. Cuenta con una finca donde produce café, plátanos, pimienta gorda y frijoles. Para el cultivo le ayudan sus hijos y la producción que sacan la venden en el mercado local de la zona. La principal producción es el café. Ha solicitado un tercer préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar el fertilizante necesario para mejorar el cultivo de café y en limpieza de la finca. Con esta inversión espera aumentar el cultivo y las ventas. Su plan es enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar bien la agricultura y poder seguir adelante.
texts.en: Josefina is 53-years-old and is widowed. She has three children and lives with them and her grandchildren in a village which is part of San Francisco de Yojoa. She has always worked in trade and farming. She has her own plantation where she grows coffee, bananas, allspice and beans. Her children help her on the plantation and they sell the produce at the local market. The main crop is coffee. She is requesting her third loan of 20,000 lempiras to buy the necessary fertilizer to improve the coffee crops and to pay for cleaning of the plantation. With this investment, she hopes to increase the harvest and her sales. Her plan is to teach her children to be good farmers so that they can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for coffee and to pay for cleaning of the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Aurora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ella es la estudiante Aurora Elizabeth, la cual se encuentra estudiando Adminitracion Empresarial en campo alto, se encuentra en segundo semestre, pero en este momento no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para cancelar el valor de las cuotas mensuales, ya que sufrió un accidente en los ultimo meses con la mama el cual las dejo en una situación económica un poco complicado, por ese mismo hecho ella necesita del convenio con kiva, ya que le quedaría un valor mas económico a la mama para poder cancelar las cuotas de campo alto y poder terminar con alegría el semestre que empezó.  

Ella comenta que se intereso por esta carrera ya que vio la necesidad constante de la superación intelectual como condición básica y fundamental para un adecuado desempeño laboral, dentro de un ambiente día a día más competido y exigente,  con toda la estabilidad laboral y económica que esta carrera conlleva,  en el ejercicio de las respectivas áreas de enfoque profesional, son estas las razones que impulsan a los jóvenes y mas específicamente a Aurora Elizabeth a prepararse académica mente de manera consciente desde  la elección de las carreras ya sean a nivel técnico, tecnológico  o profesional, según sean las capacidades  disponibilidades.
texts.en:
She is the student Aurora Elizabeth, the one who is studying Business Administration in Campo Alto. She is in her second semester, but in this moment, she does not count on sufficient financial resources to pay the full value of the monthly bills because she suffered an accident with her mother in the past couple of months which left them in a complicated financial situation. For this fact, she needs a loan with Kiva because it will give her and her mother more resources in order to be able to pay the tuition installments and be able to finish the semester she already began with happiness.

She comments that she became interested in her degree program because she saw the constant need of intellectual capacity as a basic condition and a fundamental for adequate job performance within an environment that becomes more competitive and demanding day by day. The job security and financial stability that this career track carries, with the development of different areas of professional focus, are the reasons that motivate young people and specifically Aurora Elizabeth to prepare themselves academically and consciously from the selection of their concentrations to the technical or professional level, given the resources available.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for one semester

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en: Hillary wants a loan to buy more maize for selling. He lives in Hoima, Uganda.  He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children. He deals in produce buying and selling. He earns additional income from motorcycle transport, commonly known as bodaboda.  Poor roads threaten his business. He desires to expand the business and finish his house.

loans.use: buy more maize for selling.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a thirty-eight year old married man with four children.  He deals in agriculture located in the rural area, plus a saloon business for additional income. Peter started the business to look after his family.  He intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs, like fertilizers, to improve his banana plantation. Peter hopes to open up another saloon.  However, inadequate capital is the challenge he faces.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs, like fertilizers

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel tiene 22 años de edad y trabaja como jornaleo desde hace 5 años. Es un joven muy conocido en su localidad y sus vecinos dan buenas referencias de él como un joven responsable y trabajador. Manuel desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que ha tomado la decisión de construir un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: Manuel is 22 years old and has worked as a day laborer for the past five years.  He is a very well known young man in his community and his neighbors regard him well as a responsible and hardworking young man.  Manuel wishes to improve his living conditions, which is why he has made the decision to build a bedroom.  For this reason, he has requested a loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, iron and pay for the construction labor.

loans.use: purchase bricks, cement, sand, iron and pay for labor to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet Mabinty.  She is in her early forties and is from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has two children.  For 20 years, Mabinty has had her food stand. She began her business because she wants to develop her standard of living.  She works at the business seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to expand her business.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Dúo Rosario De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Rosario de San Mateo
Este dúo está conformado por doña María Priscila, ella tiene 51 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos básicos, así como venta de desinfectante ubicado en su domicilio de San Mateo, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su verdureria , así como para compra de material para hacer desinfectante. Su dedeos es seguir creciendo y surtiendo su negocio, ya que sus clientas cada vez le solicitan  más productos.
texts.en: Dúo Rosario de San Mateo Este is partly formed by Doña María Priscila. She is 51 years old and makes a living selling vegetables and basic grains, along with disinfectants, in her neighborhood of San Mateo. She is requesting a loan to invest in her vegetable business and also to buy the material to make the disinfectant. Her desire is to continue growing and stocking her business, now that her customers ask her for more products each time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (vegetables) to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana se siente contenta por el apoyo del credito pues le ayudo mucho con el negocio y le fue muy bien. Juana continua viviendo con sus hijos en la ciudad de Challabamba, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se  dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Juana is pleased with the support of this loan since it will be of great help to her business, which is doing very well. She continues to lives with her children in the city of Challabamba. Juana is an enterprising and hardworking woman who raises small animals, such as guinea pigs and pigs. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”.

Juana is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy guinea pigs. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to handle her monthly payments with great responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba, Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es: La señora Sebastiana tiene 55 años y tiene dos hijos de las edades de 18 y 30 años,  ella se dedica a la actividad de confección  de variedad de chalecos y overoles, tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Charapaqui,  este es su primer crédito con la institución la señora Sebastiana va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una máquina de coser  over para realizar un mejor trabajo ya que la que tiene le está presentando algunas fallas, ya que  tiene muchos pedidos que tiene que entregar ya que por estas fechas tiene mucha demanda, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de ciudad de El Alto y también entrega a distintos mercados de la ciudad,  la señora Sebastiana es una persona muy trabajadora tiene ganas de seguir delante de mejorar  su calidad de vida y con el tiempo poder ofrecer sus productos a distintos mercados del interior del país como a distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Sra. Sebastiana is 55 years old and has two children, ages 18 and 30. She manufactures a variety of vests and overalls. Sebastiana has a workshop that is located in the District of Charapaqui.

This is her first loan with Emprender. Sra. Sebastiana will use the loan to buy an overstitch sewing machine so that she can do a better job. Her existing machine has a few defects and she has many orders that have to be delivered since there is currently a great deal of demand.

Sebastiana sells her products at different fairs in the city of El Alto, but she also makes deliveries to various markets in the city. She is a very hardworking individual who has the drive to press forward and improve her quality of life. Over time she wants to offer her products to different markets in the interior region of the country, as well as at the various fairs within the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to buy an overstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel  está en su ciclo número 2° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Liz es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una persona muy dedicada que ayuda también a su grupo, dándoles el ánimo a seguir luchando e incentivándolas. Ella es peluquera, y comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela ya que siempre da un buen servicio a sus clientes, y es por ello que le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, tijeras, peines, y demás insumos para poder usarlos en su salón. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, lo cual le ayudará a seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“San Miguel” is a group that is in its second loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. All of them work and help one another get ahead. They have been able to improve their poverty situation because of their efforts, their continuous work, and their application of vital behaviors that are associated with successful women.

Liz is the group president. She is a very devoted person who helps her group, provides them the encouragement to move forward, and gives them incentives. Liz is a beautician and says that she has built up a very good clientele. She always provides good service to her clients, which explains why she is doing very well.

Liz is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of dyes, scissors, combs, and other supplies that are used in her salon. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will help her continue providing good service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, combs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ana Natividad

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos es un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos, en el mismo su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando concierto y bailes populares en este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio la señora Ana una mujer luchadora que día con día da su mejor esfuerzo para salir adelante con sus hijos ella tiene 36 años es casada es madre de 3 hijos el mayor de ellos tiene 16 y el ultimo tiene 8 ellos están estudiando en la escuela y colegio del Cantón. 
Tiene una dulcería que es la fuente de ingresos para su hogar aprendió de este negocio desde su niñez junto con sus padres ya que ellos se dedicaban a este negocio, trabaja un promedio de 13 horas diarias recibe la ayuda del esposo en el negocio, este crédito lo invertirá en el negocio para ampliación del mismo he incremento de nueva mercadería, con este crédito espera que su calidad de vida mejore obteniendo una mejor rentabilidad, la señora Ana agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a settlement with a warm climate, very friendly and hardworking people, and various tourist attractions.  Its people are happy and like to enjoy the popular concerts and dances.  Ana is a hardworking woman who puts forth her best daily effort to get ahead with her children.  She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children, the oldest being 16 and the youngest 8.  They attend the local school.

She has a candy store that is the source of her income and learned this business as a child, from her parents who used to work in this business.  She works an average of 13 hours a day and her husband helps her in the business.  She will use the money from this loan to buy new merchandise.  She expects her quality of life to improve through better profits.  Ana is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria vive en la hermosa ciudad de Challabamba y sigue dedicandose a la elaboración de textiles con diferentes tipos de lanas y elabora como por ejemplo chullos, mantas, chalinas y otras cosas más. Ella sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y oveja. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Victoria lives in the beautiful city of Challabamba and continues to produce textiles of different types that are made of wool. Her products include caps, blankets, scarves, and other items. She is still a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”.

Victoria is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy materials for her work, such as alpaca and sheep’s wool. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to handle her monthly payments with great responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba, Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as alpaca and sheep’s wool.

loans.name: Elsy Francisca

texts.es: Elsy tiene 33 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su familia conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos de 13 años, 9 años y 5 años de edad. Elsy se dedica a la prestación se servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite ganarse el pan de cada día y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Elsy desea reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que con el tiempo y sol se ha deteriorado y no es muy seguro. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos y así proceder a la mejorar lo antes posible.
texts.en: Elsy is 33-years-old and lives in very humble conditions with her family which is made up of her husband and three children who are 13, 9 and 5 years old. Elsy has worked as a domestic cleaner for a long time, allowing her to feed herself and take home money for the family. She wishes to repair the roof of her house because it has worn out over time and is not very safe anymore. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails so that she can start the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Xochilth Johana

texts.es: Xochilth de 24 años, originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, Departamento de Chinandega, es una joven, casada, con una hija, Universitaria, honesta, trabajadora, responsable, se desempeña como secretaria en Alcaldía Municipal de San Francisco del Norte, a pesar de su edad y los tropiezos de la vida a sabido salir adelante, actualmente esta iniciando los módulos para optar al titulo que la acredite como Lic. en enfermería, por lo que visito a Ceprodel con el motivo de solicitar un crédito para suplir el pago de módulos y así cumplir su sueño de ser una profesional y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Xochilth is 24 years old and is from the San Francisco del Norte municipality in the Chinandega department. She is young, married, and has one daughter. She is a university student and is honest, hardworking, and responsible. She works as a secretary in the mayor's office in San Francisco del Norte. 

Despite her age and setbacks in life, she has figured out how to move forward. She is currently beginning to pay the fees to enroll in a nursing school program, which is why she came to Ceprodel. She has requested a loan to pay the fees so that she can achieve her dream of becoming a professional and improving her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay fees to enroll in a nursing school program.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, chicken

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a farmer residing in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are of school-going age. Juliet's income is derived from producing and selling bananas and cereals, but she wants to expand her farming by selling milk from dairy goats. She enjoys the food and income she gets out of the farming. Her biggest challenge is shortage of rainfall.
Juliet chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help farmers. During the training, Juliet learnt how to develop a lifestyle of saving. This loan will lead to an increase in income and food, and her family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Rosendo Eladio

texts.es:
El señor Rosendo un hombre de 42 años padre de una hija de 12 años su ex esposa vive en el extranjero junto con su hija, él se dedica a la producción de pollos se inició en esta actividad porque siempre le gusto y cuando tuvo la oportunidad y los recursos decidió dar inicio y como en todo negocio que se le pone dedicación le va excelente trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias entre el negocio y el empleo que tiene como chofer de taxi. 
Él vive y trabaja en San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tenemos las fiestas del Cantón en  las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes. 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio ampliara los galpones para incrementar la producción, con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar los ingresos económicos para pronto poder cumplir parte de sus sueños que sería tener su casita propia, el señor Rosendo agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 42 and is the father of a 12-year-old girl. His ex-wife lives abroad with their daughter. He works at raising chickens. He started this job because he had always liked it, and and when he had the opportunity and the resources to do it, he decided to take the initiative. As is the case with all businesses where someone puts in lots of dedication, it is going really well. He works an average of 10 hours a day, which he shares between this business and his job as a taxi driver.

He lives in San Miguel de los Bancos in the "Canton of Love", a canton with a warm, humid climate and with several leisure areas that are often visited by domestic and foreign tourists. The canton has a traditional festival with folk dances and the famous burning of a model castle. People from this canton are very friendly and relaxed with all their visitors.

Rosendo is asking for this loan to invest in his business by widening the bird sheds to increase production. With this new investment, he hopes to improve his income and soon be able to fulfil part of his dream to own his own house. Rosendo is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for the support and the opportunity they are offering.

loans.use: to widen the sheds for the animals and increase production.

loans.name: Athanas

texts.en:
Athanus is a farmer living in the Siongiroi area with his wife and three children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been doing farming for eight years with his primary income source being from producing and selling milk, eggs, maize, beans, and sugarcane. He loves farming because of the good returns he gets out of it. He experiences a challenge when there is a season of drought and his crops don't do well and so he succumbs to losses.

Athanus chose Juhudi Kilimo because they give loans to small-scale farmers at low interest rates and their loans have a grace period. This loan will bring in more income because of purchasing the chaff cutter which means his animals will have enough provision of food and hence produce more. Which means more milk, and this will improve their living standards and also cater for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a chuff-cutter.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La señora Luz tiene la edad de 48 años, es madre soltera y con 7 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos estan en edad escolar. habita en la ciudad de chichigalpa desde que nacio. ella se dedica a la elaboracion de tortillas desde la edad de 20 años, cuenta con una clientela fija de alrededor de 50 personas, nos comento que cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para la elaboracion de sus tortillas ya que son 3 tiempos los que ella atiende, su trabajo le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y hacer de ellos hombres y mujeres de bien y los cuales hoy se sienten orgullosos de tener una madre esforzada, emprendedora y con deseos de superacion.
Los creditos le han permitido invertir en su negocio, ya que ella compra materia prima, ademas esto le ha permitido darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
El mayor de sus sueños es continuar preparando a sus hijos y continuar trabajando con mucho esfuerzo, ya que ella ama su trabajo a pesar de que es muy cansado.
texts.en: Luz is 48-years-old and is single mother of seven children, three of which are of school age. She has lived in the city of Chichigalpa since she was born. She has worked making tortillas since she was 20-years-old. She has around 50 customers. Her daughter helps her to make the tortillas because they works three different shifts. Her work has allowed her to provide for her children and turn them into good men and women. They are proud to have a mother who is hard-working, enterprising and with personal ambition. The loans have enabled her to invest in her business and buy the supplies she needs. They have also helped her to improve her quality of life and that of her children. Her greatest dream is to continue educating her children and to carry on working hard; as she enjoys her work, even though it is very tiring.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a wide variety of medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cloth and clothes to add to her current stock for sale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer residing in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya with his wife and two children. He has been doing agriculture for the past seven years. His primary income comes from milk, eggs, crops, and a retail business,he wishes to enlarge his banana farming which does very well in Nkubu area. He loves horticultural farming because it is promising, you get good returns within a short period of time and it is not expensive compared to the long term crops. His biggest challenge is a shortage of rain and a lack of farm inputs like fertilizer, which frustrates him especially during planting.

James chose Juhudi Kilimo because they are transparent with their clients and they provide the clients with answers when necessary. During the training, he learned how to develop a savings culture, which has helped him a lot in managing his finances. Through this loan, he will improve the living standards of his family as well as pay school fees for his two children.

loans.use: For banana farming..

loans.name: Sacinta

texts.en:
Sacinta is a very hardworking farmer who hails from the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has 4 children ranging from the ages of 9 to 18 years. Sacinta has done farming for 15 years. What she enjoys most is banana farming, which she says provides her with enough money to educate her children. Her biggest challenge is insufficient capital and poor markets. 
Sacinta chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans and they are quick in loan processing. During the training, she learned how to develop a savings culture. With this loan, she will be able to get whatever is needed to plant more bananas and thus get a high yield and he will be able to educate her children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: For banana farming.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a farmer who lives and farms in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya with her husband and 3 children. She loves farming, especially horticultural farming. She has been doing it for 10 years. Her primary income source is milk, eggs, tea, and crops. Her biggest challenge is insufficient capital to buy irrigation equipment.
She chose Juhudi Kilimo because of their favorable interest rates. During the training, she learned how to plan and budget in order to minimize costs and maximize revenue. Through this loan,she will get more seeds and grow more horticultural crops, hence she will get more income and thus be able to cater to her children's needs.

loans.use: For horticultural farming.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Hello, this is Kadiatu, a hard-working local woman from Waterloo, west of Sierra Leone’s capital city, Freetown. 

Kadiatu has four children. Her oldest child is 25 years and her youngest child is 13 years. Three of her children are going to school. Kadiatu’s husband does local labor work. Kadiatu sells palm oil, which is used by her customers as the base for the local spicy dishes (such as crain-crain stew or cassava leaf stew) that are popular in the area. She started her business to have more income to support her children. She works for seven hours a day, seven days a week. Although her business is going well, she says that the local poor transportation network is a big challenge. 

Kadiatu would like this loan to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon) to increase her businesses profits. Kadiatu is a diligent member of BRAC Sierra Leone, having already taken out and repaid five loans to grow her business. In the future, she would like to run a larger business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil by the gallon for her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a farmer living in Nkubu area of Meru, where she lives with her husband and three children, all of school-going age. 

She loves farming, and more so horticultural farming. She has been doing this for thirteen years, with her primary income source being milk, eggs, horticultural crops and her retail business. Her biggest challenge is insufficient water, leading to low production.

She said that she chose Juhudi Kilimo because of their quick loan processing and favorable interest rates that suit her horticultural farming. Through the loan she will be able to plant more horticultural crops like tomatoes,vegetables,french beans and the profit she gets out of the horticultural farm will help her get more income that will provide school fees to educate her children.

loans.use: to finance horticultural farming.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Meet Rodah, a farmer living in the rich highlands of Litein with her husband and two children, all of whom are of school-going age. She has been farming for the past four years, with her primary income source being the sale of milk and eggs. She enjoys farming because this is her source of livelihood, but her challenge is unpredictable weather.

Rodah chose Juhudi Kilimo because it provides easy and accessible services. During the training, she learnt that micro finance institutions help transform the lives of low income earners. Through this loan, she will construct a greenhouse which will lead to more income because she will be able to monitor the growth of her crops. She will use this income to educate her children.

loans.use: to construct a green house.

loans.name: Ricardino

texts.pt:
Ricardino de 51 anos de idade ế casado, pai de 5 filhos e vive na casa propria com mais pessoas ( netos e sobrinhos) .
Tem bastante experiencia na sua actividade ( criacao de frangos de corte) e com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material de construcao para construir mais um pavilhao ( apoera grande) para aumentar a producao de modo a satisfazer a demanda do mercado. Vive numa zona potencial para a actividade que exerce.
Tem como desafio termiar a obra para poder concorrer em igualidade com outros produtores. Sonhar tornar um produtor industrial.
texts.en:
Ricardino is 51 years old and married. He has five children and lives with other people (grandchildren, nieces and nephews) in a house that he owns.
He has a great deal of experience in his line of work (raising broiler chickens). With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies so he can build another pavilion (large coop) in order to increase production. That way he'll meet the demand of the market. He lives in an area with a lot of potential for his business.
His challenge is to finish the construction work so he can compete on equal terms with other chicken farmers. He dreams of becoming an industrial producer.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies so he can build another pavilion (large coop).

loans.name: Ivan

texts.pt: Senhor Ivan tem 25 anos de, é casado e não é pai ainda, vive somente com a sua esposa a qual sustenta na casa própria, é segurança de uma empresa privada,trabalha em turnos, e em momentos livres repara computadores. Com o dinheiro do empréstimo pretende custear as despesas da carta de condução visto que matriculou se numa escola de condução para aprender a dirigir carro.No futuro pretende continuar a estudar e aranjar um emprego melhor.Manter o sustento condígno da familia e liquidar o empréstimo são os seus maiores desafios.
texts.en: Mr. Ivan is 25 years old and married. He doesn't have children yet. He lives with his wife, whom he supports, in a house that he owns. He's a security guard for a private company. He works by shifts and in his spare time he repairs computers. With the money from the loan he intends to pay for the costs of getting a driver's license, since he signed up for driving lessons so he can learn to drive a car. In the future he intends to keep on studying and get a better job. Providing decent living conditions for his family and repaying the loan are his biggest challenges.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of getting a driver's license.

loans.name: Idan

texts.en:
Idan is a hardworking farmer in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya. She is married and has three children. She has been farming for the past 15 years, where her primary income is milk, tea, and a retail business. Her biggest challenge is marketing her farm produce.
Idan chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because Juhudi has an interest in elevating the quality of life for rural small holder farmers. During the training, she learned that micro finance institutions help low income earners get financing. 
This loan will increase production in her farm through purchasing more farm inputs like (animal feeds,hoes,jembes,pangas),and thus lead to more income. This will improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Lenet

texts.en:
Lenet lives and farms in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya. She loves farming and has been at it for 15 years where her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and bananas.  Her biggest challenge is marketing her products.
She said that she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help farmers to achieve their dreams in farming.  During the training, she learned that micro finance institutions help low income earners get financing for their projects. Through this loan, she will purchase poultry for more income production. This will enable her to better educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Villa Bolivar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA BOLIVAR” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: heladería, taller de electricista, tejido de chompas, venta de calzados, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, venta de queso, venta de ropa, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de leche por mayor) que adquirirá en las barracas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las amigas de su banca.
texts.en:
The Villa Bolivar Communal Association is entering its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Santiago II Center.  The group is made up of nine members, led by a board of directors of which Victoria is President.  The association members own businesses such as a neighborhood store that sell a variety of goods, among them ice cream, woven sweaters, footwear, cosmetics, cheese, clothing, and fruits.

The loan that they're taking out will benefit small business owners, like Victoria. She reports that she's been a member of Pro Mujer for six years, which she joined at the invitation of a friend who was also a member. Currently, she owns a cheese shop, which she opened several years ago of her own initiative.

The loan that she's taking out now is to increase her business capital by buying milk in bulk from the vendors in the city of El Alto. Once she's made her cheese, she will sell it in her sales booth. This work allows her to obtain the resources she needs to support her family, as she lives with her partner and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes her friends from the bank.

loans.use: to buy milk in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more jeans, shirts, televisions, and DVD sets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough used clothing to increase her sales.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
La joven Juana Isabel,  posee un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace ocho  años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia que está compuesta por sus cuatro hijos siendo  madre  soltera. 

La Joven  se traslada a su puesto de trabajo desde las 4:00 am para abrir a las 5:00 am y cierra su negocio a las 5:00pm labora de lunes a domingo  en este mismo horario Ella compra su producto a mayorista que viajan a la ciudad de Managua dos veces por semana. 

El  crédito que solicito a CEPRODEL lo quiere para comprar sandía, mandarina, banano, tomate y chiltoma  y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de productos y precios más accesibles para satisfacer la demanda, lo cual tendría mayores ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel has had a fruit and vegetable selling business in one of the city markets in Leon for 8 years. She does this work to support her family made up of four children. She is a single mother. 

She goes to her work place at 4:00 a.m. so she can open at 5 a.m. and close her business at 5:00 p.m. She works Monday to Sunday with this schedule. She buys her products from a wholesaler that travels from the city of Managua twice a week.   

She wants the loan she asked  CEPRODEL for to buy watermelon, tangerines, bananas, tomatoes and chiltoma peppers. This way, she can offer her customers a variety of products and more accessible prices to meet demand. This will bring in more income to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy watermelon, tangerines, bananas, tomatoes, and chiltoma peppers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onion, etc. to attract more customers.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick wants a loan to buy more corn to sell. 

He lives in Hoima Uganda and takes care of eight children; five attend school.

He buys and sells produce and earns additional income by selling other items. Poor roads threaten his business yet he desires to expand his business and build a residential house.

loans.use: to buy corn to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is the age of 40, living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her son is a motorcycle mechanic by profession; he repairs and troubleshoots the motorbikes. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides the services nearby his hometown. Mostly people of who have bikes, like to repair their bikes from him.
He has been running this business for many years and using very expensive tools for repairing which have gone wearing off. He wants to replace these tools with new one but he does not have money to buy new tools. 
Therefore, Fatima has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy new repairing tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycle. She thanks to kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bike's repairing tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en: Saleem is an active borrower of Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. He has been running a crockery shop for the past five years. He is married and lives in Wazirabad, Pakistan. He is a father of one child. Saleem wants to expand the size of his business and he will buy different types of crockery items for reselling purpose and to provide quality products such as home accessories and crockery. He needs financial assistance to buy different kinds of merchandises for his business purpose. Therefore he has applied for Kiva's S.E.P loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can provide better services of selling home accessories  and to expand his business, which will be good for him to earn maximum profit and save to fulfill his business needs in the future. Saleem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Expansion in business and to buy different types of crockery items for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 57 years old married woman; she is living along her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been troubleshooting transformers in small firms. He is a sole earner for entire family. Her son's income is very low; therefore she decided to increase the source of income in the form of an electrician shop. Her son wants to troubleshoot the transformer and other electrical goods at his own shop. Now he has become very experts in his profession and can hold the full affairs of an electrician’s shop. 
Safia wants to buy initial electrical goods and repairing tools to setup newly opened electric shop for her son. For this is the reason she contacted with the kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her son can be able to buy initial stock such as socket, bulb, tube lights, switches and repairing tools.
Safia hopes the lenders of kiva will take a warmth participation to help her. She is very thankful to the kiva, Kiva's lenders and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy initial stock such as socket, bulb, tube lights, switches and repairing tools for electrician's shop.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en: Amir is an active borrower at Kiva's Field Partner BRAC Pakistan. He has been running a crockery shop for the past five years. He is married, lives in Gujrat, Pakistan, and is a father of five children. Amir wants to expand the size of his business and purchase different kinds of crockery items for his business purpose. Therefore, he needs financial assistance to increase the size of his business. With the help of this loan, he will buy different types of merchandises for his business purpose and he can enable himself to expand his business, this will be good for him to earn maximum profit and make savings to fulfill his business needs in the future. Amir is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To expand the size of his business and purchase different kinds of crockery items for his business purpose.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is 28 years old and resides in Taxila, Pakistan. She is a simple housewife. Her husband is a government servant. He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Kiran has been running her own beauty saloon for the past five years. She also contributes her incomes to her husband's to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not able to buy these items for her business. Therefore, Kiran has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Kiran is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is the age of 45, living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her son manufactures tetra packs at home and sells it to the dairy farms for milk packing. She helps him for the completion of his daily tasks. He uses polyethylene, paper board, aluminium sheet to protect the product from moisturizing, sun light and for long run usage of pruduct. He takes order from dairy farms and manufactures tetra packs. For the time being he has been fulling many contracts but this time he has gotten huge contract than earlier. Major problem is that he does not have enough cash  in hand to buy raw material for manufacturing tetra pack.   
Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy raw material such as polyethylene, paper board, aluminium sheets to continue his business.

loans.use: To buy polyethylene, paper board, aluminium sheets for manufacturing tetra packs.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees aged, 49, she is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a scrap shop and deals with the scrap goods such as waste papers, bottle, bread and iron. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells it to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses he does not have amount to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell for getting money.
Therefore, Balqees has requested a loan for her son, so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods like waste papers, bottle, bread iron for selling to the recycling factories.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays daily fair because this rickshaw does not belonging to him. He belongs to the ultra poor family and has been feeding his sibling and children. Now his children are growing old and their needs as well. He was worried for many days that how to abstain from daily fair, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 
Samina has been making savings for many days to buy new auto rickshaw for her son but at the time of purchasing some money became short. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  Now he does not have any need to pay daily affair to no one. Samina is a 51-years old woman, living with her seven children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Samina hopes that now her son would be able to generate more income because now he will not pay daily fair to anyone. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks to kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 41-year old married woman, living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  
Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a shoe maker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has lot experience about his profession. He sews leather and rexine shoes through machine, after that attached its sole through stitching by his hands. In this way he is getting income for his family. He has bee making shoes at home, now he established a shop to continue his business on wide level. But he does not have amount to buy initial raw material for making shoes.
Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy initial raw material for making shoes.
Her family has to do hard work to getting income for huge family. 
She thanks to Kiva, field partner and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy initial raw material for making shoes

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 49 years old, a married woman and mother of eight children. Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. Her son drives an auto rickshaw by days and nights. He has been continuously driving rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Parveen has applied for a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for the maintenance of rickshaw. Her son will maintain the engine and body of rickshaw. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her family and will bring positive changes for the business.
Parveen thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To maintain the engine and body of rickshaw by her son.

loans.name: Shaheena

texts.en:
Shaheena is the age of 35, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family, she is the mother of two sons and a daughter. To manage her household expenses she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughter at home. Shaheena and her daughter have been stitching cloths for many years. Her daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Shaheena wants to buy a new juki machine so that her daughter could contribute in her income by sewing cloths.
Therefore, Shaheena has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy new juki machine for her daughter. She wants to make some savings so that she could gather the dowry of her daughter. 
Shaheena thanks to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy juki machine for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Irfan

texts.en:
Irfan is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Wazirabad, Pakistan. He has two children and by profession he is a cotton merchant in the local market. Irfan is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his family and to manage the entire house hold.
He wants to expand his cotton business for this purpose he needs to buy cotton in bulk for his business purpose but due to some financial constraints he is unable to buy the cotton to fulfill his business needs. Therefore Irfan has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 
With the help of this loan he can enable himself to buy the relevant merchandises for his business purpose and he can also expand the size of his cotton business.
On this financial assistance Irfan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Expansion in his cotton business.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya from Pakistan! She is married and has five children. 
Suriya has requested a loan for her son; he offers Alu Chat (A Pakistani food) over wooden stall at evening to the common people of his area. For this purpose he has better needs for potatoes, tomatoes, yogurt, onion, spices etc in large quantity.  She helps her son during preparing alu chat in noon.  He wants to offer more alu chaat to his customer because the demand has been increasing time to time. 
She is the age of 48, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that through this loan her son would be able to generate more income than earlier. She thanks to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan team.

loans.use: To buy potato, yogurt, spices, onion, for making chaat.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 37-years old married woman, living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore. Her husband is a wholesaler of rice; he buys the rice from harvesters on low price and sells in Lahore city to the retailers. He buys the rice of various kinds such as basmati, super kernel etc. He has been doing same practice for many years and has many reputed retailers like to buy rice from him on large quantity. In this tenure he has built up positive relationship among the retailers, his customers are become the cause of his advertisement as well. 
With the increment in new customers and demand he wants to buy rice in bulk, so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand. In this way he would be able to increase his monthly income, savings and could cherish his children in well manners.  
Sajida praises honorable supporter; she thanks to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rice from the harvesters and sell to the retailers.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 36-years old lady; she is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides the services to maintain the motorbikes; he is profession in his techniques and can easily fix the bikes in no time. He has to use various types of tools for the fixation; a few days ago he shifted his workshop to another place, due to replacement some of important and expensive tools have misplaced.
Uzma has requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to compensate against this loss. He will buy repairing tools, spare parts, tyres, break shoe etc for motorbike repairing workshop. 
She wants to provide better education and living standard to her children. She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this amount in positive way and his monthly income would be increase. She thanks to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy repairing tools, spare parts, tyres, break shoe etc for motorbike repairing workshop.

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan is a 52-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a small firm in which he has planted few compression molding machines. He takes order for manufacturing plastic accessories; he appointed labors over molding machines on daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different category and quality raw material. This time he has taken a huge contract than earlier but does not have enough amounts to buy additional molding machine and crushing raw material to continue his manufacturing. 
Therefore, Maqsoodan has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy crushing plastic raw material for molding machine. 
She has to look after a huge family, she has to take care of her each kid, their school fees, their diet and about their health. For these purposes she has need of huge income and his son is only single person who is responsible to bear household expenses. 
She is very happy after taking this loan and thanks to kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy raw material for manufacturing plastic's accessoires.

loans.name: Shareefa

texts.en:
Shareefa is a 46-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son. He is a shoe maker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing baby shoes for many years. This is the reason he has lot experience about his profession. He sews rexine shoes through machine, after that attached its sole through stitching by his hands. In this way he is getting income for his family. Nowadays he gotten a huge contract but he does not have amount to buy raw material to complete the contract.
Therefore, Shareefa has requested a loan for her son so he can buy raw material such as rexine, threads, glue, sole etc.
Shareefa is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for shoe making.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is 35 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, he is a father of three children. By profession he is a fabric merchant and he has been doing his business for many years. Amin lives in Wazirabad with his family, he is the guardian of his family and responsible to manage the entire family's house hold.
Amin wants to expand the size of his business to provide the vast range of clothes variety to the local customers, to fulfill his business needs he want to buy different types of clothes stuff in bulk but due to financial problems he is not in suitable position to buy the clothes in bulk to fulfill his business needs.
Therefore Amin has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount he will enable himself to fulfill the business needs.
Amin is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Expansion in his Fabrics business.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is 34 years old, a married woman and mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Sakina has applied for a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and little bit engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband will bring positive changes to his business.
Sakina thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new tires and little bit engine maintenance for rickshaw.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is 40 years old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular uses. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore, Farida has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Farida is so much thankful to kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new auto rickshaw

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a 44-years-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past several years. 
She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income received to support her entire family. Her sewing machine has become out of order. 
However, due to lack of savings and funds, Jamila is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason; she has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. 
She intends to use this loan amount to buy new sewing machine to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may generate a healthier source of income.
Jamila hopes that this loan will prove positive and beneficial for her and will be the cause for getting more income. She thanks to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Aslam

texts.en:
Aslam is 55 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a father of five children. he has been running a general store for many years, he is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. he wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 
Aslam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Expansion in his general store business.

loans.name: Musarat's Group

texts.en:
Musarat is a 46-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her repeated loan cycle but it will be the first loan with kiva and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: To buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en: Parveen is the age of 42; she is mother of five children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, his some relatives like to purchase from his General Store. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business running well. Due to good relation his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope the demand. Therefore, Parveen requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Parveen thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. for general store

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is the age of 40; she is mother of six children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a General Store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, his some relatives like to purchase from his General Store. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone; he has built up very good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town that is the reason his business running well. Due to good relation his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope the demand. Therefore, Asia requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Asia thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan. Asia hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand. She thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Gazala

texts.en:
Gazala is 37-years old married woman living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband is a butcher by profession; he sells chicken over shop. His daily practice is to buy broilers from the market and sell it over his shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop. 
Therefore, Gazala has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy broilers to sell over shop. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. 
She thanks to Kiva and field partner, brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy broilers for chicken shop.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 40-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband; he newly conducted a motorbike repairing workshop. He has been working over many workshops on daily wages. To grow his monthly income; he wants to buy new spare parts on cheap rates to set up newly opened workshop. But due to financial constraints he is compel for taking a loan. 
Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to buy new spare parts, plastic furniture and engine oil.
Shazia thanks to the kiva, kiva’s lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy repairing tools, plastic furniture, engine oil and spare parts.

loans.name: Mudassir

texts.en:
Mudassir is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, he lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. he is 35 years old and a father of three children. he has been working as wood carpenter for many years, he is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. 
He wants to buy  pieces of wood and other tools for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy these merchandises. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. with the help of this loan he can purchase the relevant items for his business purpose and earn profitable income to meet the daily needs of family and business.
Mudassir is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Expansion in his carpenter business.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is 48 years old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is housewife and looks after her family . Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore, Suriya has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Suriya is very thankful to kiva and its field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: Maintenance of auto rickshaw

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years with regularities.  With the passage of time it has been getting depreciated which reached till disposal. His children are growing old and their needs as well. He was worried for many days that how to buy new auto rickshaw so he can abstain from maintenance cost, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 
Parveen has been making savings for many years to buy new auto rickshaw for her son but at the time of purchasing some money became short. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan for him so he can buy new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  
Parveen hopes that now her son would be able to buy more income because now he does not have any need to spend his income over maintenance cost.

loans.use: To buy new auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Summaira

texts.en:
Summaira is a 31-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She has requested a loan for her husband; he provides the services to carry the goods from one place to another over donkey cart. He wants to use mule instead of a donkey because the mule can carry more goods than donkey. In this way he can easily carry the more goods in short time which will be the cause of increase in income and savings as well.
Therefore, Summaira has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy mule to keep continue his business. 
Summaira wants to save the excess profit amount so that she could utilize these saving for future sudden needs and for her children education. 
She thanks to kiva and to its filed partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy mule cart for services.

loans.name: M.ali

texts.en:
M.Ali, age 40, is a father of three children. he owns an embroidery shop in the market. Which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping himself.
He will purchase embroidery machine and new variety of embroidery materials. M.Ali is feeling happy that he will be able to help himself with the loan amount. he is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Expansion in his embroidery material shop

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is the age of 44-years, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income for household expenses. He always tries to establish his business through offering latest cosmetics products. Nowadays latest cosmetics products introduced in the market which are very demanding and expensive as well. He is not enough financial strong to buy these expensive beauty products. This is the reason; Anwar has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; she will give full amount to her husband so that he can buy latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish etc. She hopes that through this amount would be enhance the businesses. Anwar is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish etc.

loans.name: Zohra's Group

texts.en: Zohra is 31 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4 daughters and one son. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last one year. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.
