He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore Zohra has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zohra is so much thankful to kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Auto rickshaw repairing

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en: Riffat is 38 years old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children.  Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges in his shop. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Riffat has requested for a loan amount from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Riffat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fruits.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is the age of 35, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fan, washing machine and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components as well over his shop such as bulb, switches, sockets etc. 
He wants to buy new inventories for his shop but does not have amount to buy new inventory. Therefore, Lubna has requested to the kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband become empower to buy his desired inventory. 
Lubna thanks to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Safdar

texts.en:
Safdar is 45 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. he has been running electronic sales business for many years, he is only responsible to feed entire family and manage overall house hold.
Safdar needs to buy different types of accessories and different types of electronics items for business purpose but due to insufficient financial resources he is not in position to buy these accessories to fulfill his need. Therefore Safdar has requested for kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan he can buy all above items relevant to his business and enable himself to earn maximum profitable income by providing better services.
On this financial assistance Safdar is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Expansion in his electronic shop business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen, age 26, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market. Which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new variety of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that his wife, Shaheen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase embroidery machine and raw material of embroidery. Shaheen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new variety of embroidery material.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is the age of 40, mother of two children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has sold fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits. So, Sakina  demanded for loan so that her husband would be able to buy more fresh fruits for selling. Sakina is very thankful to kiva and field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for selling.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 25 years old, a married woman and mother of two children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason; Shazia has applied for a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and little bit engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.
Shazia thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance of Rickshaw.

loans.name: Razai

texts.en:
Razai is the age of 57, living with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her son has been running a mobile shop for eight years and earning sufficient income. He troubleshoots the mobile, sells the mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable etc and provides the recharge facilities of different networks. 
Nowadays a lot of demand increased of mobile accessories and for recharge, sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he already has spent his all savings over household expenses. 
Therefore, Razai has requested a loan for her son so that he could empower to buy addition accessories and extra credit for recharge facility. She thanks to kiva and to field partner, for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy mobile accessories for her son's mobile shop.

loans.name: Mariyam's Group

texts.en:
Mariyam is the age of 23, living with her two daughters in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is providing polishing services for newly constructed floors. He polishes the concrete and marble floors. For this purpose he uses floor polishing machine; he has been providing these services for many years. Few days ago his floor polishing machine has become out of order due to fluctuation in electricity. For this is reason he wants to buy new machine but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy new floor polishing machine.
Therefore, Mariyam has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new floor polishing machine so that he can continue his services smoothly.

loans.use: To buy floor polishing Machine for floor polishing services.

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en:
Hajran is 40 years old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. She is a house wife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard her husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing Iron's accessories to improve his shuttering work, so that he can generate more income for financially support of his family. Hajran is applying for loan from kiva field partner for her husband work.
She is thankful to brac Pakistan and kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for shuttering work.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en: Parveen is the age of 43; she is mother of three children. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is house wife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products like milk, curd, butter, for sale. He owns a small dairy farm consists of buffaloes and cows. He daily sells milk to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earning from milk sale. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through milk sale. So, Parveen demanded for loan so that her husband would be able to buy a buffalo. In this way she can support to her husband's business. she thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milk sale business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen belongs to the poor family, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her son is a blacksmith; he manufactures the iron accessories door and windows which usable in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld the broken accessories as well.
Few days ago his welding plant has become out of order due to overheating and need to be replacement with new one. He wants to buy new welding plant and iron's accessories but he does not have money due to lot of household expenses. 
Therefore, Nasreen  has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her son would be able to buy welding plant and iron's accessories for manufacturing.

loans.use: to buy welding plant and iron's accessories for manufacturing.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a Taxi for seven years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his Taxi because the current condition of his Taxi is not good it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Shakeela has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Shakeela's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Shakeela  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Shakeela is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To make repairing of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 57-years, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children; she is very hard work and honest lady. Her daughter owns a small beauty parlor at home and contributes her full income for household expenses. With the passage of time her beauty products have gone finish and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 
Parveen has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; she will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, seizers and comb, for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her businesses. 
She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her daughter's parlor.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 29 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for past two years, he is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Sonia's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore Sonia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 
Sonia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some commodities i.e sugar, rice, tea and cooking oil for her husband's business.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 55 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children and her husband is an electrician by profession, he is only responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Shehnaz has also been doing her business of cloth selling for past ten years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.
Shehnaz needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose therefore She has applied for Kiva group loan with another member from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of Clothes for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 49 years old and a mother of five children. Her husband has been working as wood carpenter for thirty years, he is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. 
Fareeda's husband wants to buy Sofaa set covers, pieces of wood and other tools for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy these merchandises. Therefore Fareeda has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. with the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business purpose and earn profitable income to meet the daily needs of family and business.
Fareeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of accessories for her husband's furniture polish Business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 27 years old active borrower of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of a daughter. Her Husband is a owner of auto spare parts shop, he has been running his business for past fiteen years. Razia's husband wants to expand the size of his business so that he can fulfill the demands of his daily customers and provide better reselling services of auto spare parts, but due to financial problems he is not in such position to bear these expanses.
Therefore Razia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to afford all relevant expanses in the expansion of his business and buy the above relevant items to fulfill his customers needs. On this financial assistance Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new Auto spare parts for reslling purpose.

loans.name: Feezan

texts.en:
Feezan is the age of 35, living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband provides floor polishing services for newly constructed floors. For this purpose he uses floor polishing machine; he has been providing these services for many years. Few days ago his floor polishing machine has become out of order due to continuously working. For this is reason he wants to buy new machine but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy new floor polishing machine.
Therefore, Feezan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new floor polishing machine so that he can continue his services again

loans.use: To buy floor polishing Machine for services.

loans.name: Shabeena

texts.en:
Shabeena is 34 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession, he is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Shabeena has been running her own beauty saloon for past four years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the house hold. 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty saloon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Shabeena has applied for Kiva loan in group with other two members. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
on this financial assistance Shabeena is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business purpose.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 41 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her 3 children. Her husband is a taxi driver by profession, he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Tahira is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold. 
She is needs different kinds of goods e.g Needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Tahira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of clothes, ribbons, nidles, threds and etc for her  business purpose.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 34 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of a son and her husband is a plumber by profession, he is only responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Shazia has also been doing her business of cloth selling for past six years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.
Shazia needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose therefore She has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.
On this financial assistance Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of Clothes for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Shahzad

texts.en: Shahzad is 45 years old active borrower, residing in Sialkot, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for past six years, he is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Shahzad wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. Shahzad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of consumer items for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar is 40 years old man. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With four children, her children are doing study. he has been running his own business of clothes selling for 10 years, he is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore he is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that he can purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. He wants also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 
Zafar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, which is East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. The substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Catherine is married and has nine children. She runs a small business to sell fruit and vegetables. She and her husband have been farming for twenty years and they grow maize, bananas, and beans. Catherine is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey, earn her some income, and the bees will help to pollinate her crops.

This is Catherine's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her hives to pay school fees for her children. Catherine's hope for the future is to have all her children educated.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en: Imran is 28 years old active borrower, residing in Sialkot, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for past seven years, he is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Imran wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. Imran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of consumer items for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 42 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is out of country, he is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Noreen has been running her own beauty saloon for past fifteen years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the house hold. 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty saloon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. Therefore Noreen has applied for Kiva loan in group with other two members. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers, it will also helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
on this financial assistance Noreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her business purpose.

loans.name: Rizwan

texts.en:
Rizwan is 34 years old active borrower, residing in Sialkot, Pakistan. He has been running a general store for past ten years, he is only responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Rizwan wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore he has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable him to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 
Rizwan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: Expansion in his general store business and to buy different types of consumer's goods for reselling purpose.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is 34 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her one son. Her husband has been working as cable operator for many years, he is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Farah is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold. 
She is needs different kinds of goods e.g Needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Farah is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of clothes, ribbons, nidles, threds and etc for her  business purpose.

loans.name: Niamat

texts.en:
Niamat is 25 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi,Pakistan; with his family, has three children. Niamat has been running his own shop of cosmetics items sales for past five years, he is well known cosmetics retailer in the local market. And he is also responsible guardian of his family.
He want to purchase different types of cosmetics accessories for his business purpose but due to some financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy these above accessories there for he has requested for kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount he will enable himself to buy relevant cosmetics items to fulfill his business needs.
Niamat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of cosmetics items for his business purpose.

loans.name: Julio Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Julio tiene la edad de 52 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Nos comento que paso buen tiempo desempleado y le pidio trabajo a un amigo que contaba con triciclo y fue alli donde el comenzo a tener experiencia, al ver don Julio que el servicio de triciclo era un negocio bastante rentable, comenzo a indagar como obtener una consecion de triciclo y asi comprar la consecion y el triciclo para ser dueño de su propio negocio y fue de esta forma que el obtuvo su triciclo desde hace 5 años. nos comenta que su trabajo le gusta mucho,como podran ver en su fotografia va con una de sus clientas y hasta la fecha cuenta con una clientela fija de alrededor de 15 personas. su meta es llegar a comprar otros dos triciclos con la ayuda de los creditos, esto con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 52 years old and is married with 4 children who are now all adults. He tells us he was unemployed for quite a while and he asked a friend who had a tricycle to give him some work. This is how he started to build up his experience.  

Seeing that the tricycle service was quite a profitable business, Julio began to look into how to get a tricycle concession and then buy the concession and the tricycle so he could be the boss of his own business. This is how he got his tricycle 5 years ago. He tells us that he really likes his work. As you can see in the photo he is transporting one of his customers and to date he has a regular clientele of around 15 people. 

His goal is to eventually buy two more tricycles with the help of the loans, with the aim of increasing his income and having a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy tyres, a canopy and a tricycle.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver lives in Hoima Uganda. She is 39 years old and has a bar and lodge business. She started with a small restaurant and was able to save money. She then started her current business.

She desires to educate her children and build them good homes.   However, limited capital and competition hinder her business.

Oliver requests a loan to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: el señor Alfredo tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado central desde hace 10 años , su negocio lo administra desde que su esposa fallecio,  es un señor bien trabajador se esfuerza por llevar el sustento a su hogar, antes el señor trabajaba como contador en una empresa , luego al fallecer su esposa el decidio seguir viendo el negocio que por años sacaron adelante a sus hijos, solicita el financiamiento para comprar  mercaderia a su negocio como tres cajas de vainilla y frambuesa.
texts.en:
Alfredo has owned a stall in the main market for ten years. He has been managing the business since his wife passed away. He is a very hardworking gentleman who strives to provide for his family. He used to work as an accountant for a company, but when his wife passed away he decided to keep their market stall going, a business which for years helped them provide for their children.

He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for his business, such as three boxes of vanilla and raspberry drinks.

loans.use: to buy hammock liners, raspberry and vanilla drinks, vinegar, and wheat in bulk.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 54 years old married to Mary. They have 5 children whose ages range from 20 to 32. Edward raises cattle but also grows crops corn to supplement his income.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy a motorcycle to assist with transportation while monitoring his cattle. 
 
He says the only challenges he faces are drought and cattle diseases. He describes himself as a hardworking person.  He is hard working and honest. 

He thanks UGAFODE for the spirit of loving.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Julia Saturnina

texts.es: la señor julia se dedica a la venta de refrescos desde hace 6 años , vende en los sectores aledaños del  mercado mayoreo el bisne , vende de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, es una señora bien trabajadora se esfuerza por sacar adelante el sustento de su hofar,  solicita el financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio comprando , bolsas para los refrescos, frutas y verduras , azucar por quintal para seguir luchando y mantener su sustento diario.
texts.en:
Julia has been earning a living by selling drinks for six years. She sells in the areas surrounding the El Bisne wholesale market. She works from Monday through Sunday, from 7 in the morning till 3 in the afternoon. She is a hard working woman who is trying to get ahead and support her household. 

Julia is requesting this loan to invest in her business by buying bags for the drinks, fruit and vegetables, and sugar. This will allow her to keep striving forward and support herself from day to day.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for making drinks.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: la señor Claudia trabaja desde hace 8 años en la alcaldia, labora como secretaria  con su trabajo ha sacado adelante su hogar y a sus hijos con sus estudios. trabaja de lunes a viernes  desde las ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, solicita el financiamiento para mejoras de su vivienda, aprovechar el tiempo antes que sea invierno para que no se le pase el agua.
texts.en:
Claudia has worked in the town hall for the last 8 years. She works as a secretary and through her work she has been able to support her household and support her children in their education. She works from Monday to Friday from 8am to 5pm.

She is asking for the loan to carry out home improvements, making the most of the time before the winter comes so that water does not get into the house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc, nails, cement, cinder blocks and iron.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es: la señora Maria Irene   labora en la alcaldia desde hace 25 añso se desempeña como operaria de limpieza , trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, la señor irene se ha mantenido en su trabajo por el sustento de sus dos hijos , es madre soltera y solo depende de su ingreso de salario, solicita el financiamiento para compra de utiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Irene has been working for City Hall for 25 years. She works as a janitor Monday through Friday from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm. Irene has kept her job in order to provide for her two children. She is a single mother and her salary is her only source of income.

She is requesting this loan to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, notebooks, backpacks, uniforms, and shoes.

loans.name: Darling Del Socorro

texts.es: la señora Darling  es madre de cuatro niños tres de ellos estan en edad escolar, la joven madre trabaja en la alcaldia desde hace9 años , labora como operaria de limpieza , se esfuerza por mantener su trabajito, ellla labora de lunes a viernes desde las seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde. solicita un financiamiento para compra de materiales de contruccion para hacerle una mejora a su casa  y brindarle poco a poco una vivienda digna a sus hijos.,
texts.en:
Darling has four children, three of which are in school. This young mother has been working for City Hall for nine years. She works as a janitor and does her very best to keep up with her job. She works Monday through Friday from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials in order to improve her home and work towards providing decent housing for her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sheet metal, cement, and bricks.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 56-year-old lady and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is the mother of five children and her son owns a furniture shop to make wooden T.V. trolleys. He has been making trolleys for many years and taught his younger brother this trade.
 
Naseem's younger son has become a fine carpenter and can easily handle a separate business. She opened a new shop for her younger son. Now he wants to buy his own tools and raw material to make furniture.
 
Therefore, Naseem requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son will be able to buy raw material such as glass, glue, chipboard, paint, and sheets to make T.V. trolleys. 

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy glass, glue, chipboard, paint, and sheets for making T.V. trolleys.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 42-year-old lady. She is a very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and uses wooden planks and bamboo.

Her husband is unable to continue his business because of his low supply of wooden boards and bamboos. Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business.  

She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes into her life and generate maximum profit. 

Shehnaz is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy sheltering material such as wooden smooth boards and bamboo to provide sheltering  services.

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, and she is the mother of four children. 

Kousar is doing embroidery work by hand at home and financially supporting her family. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She had been learning this art since her childhood and now she adopted it for her occupation. She enabled herself to be independent and earn sufficient income. 

Kousar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a stock of thread, silk, fancy sequins and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and her family. Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as thread, silk, fancy sequins and pearls of various colors for knitting embroidery.

loans.name: Maria Yadira

texts.es: la señora Maria Yadira se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado desde hace 23 años. es madre de tres hijos, solo uno depende de ella, es soltera, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde se esfuerza por llevar el sustento a su hogar, solicita financiamiento para compra de ropa interior variadas para aprovechar la entrada de clases y obtener mejores ganancias
texts.en:
Maria Yadira has worked in her business selling clothing in the market for 23 years. She is single and has three children, with only one dependent on her. She works from Monday to Sunday from 7 o'clock in the morning to 5 o'clock at night. She works hard to provide for the household.

She is asking for a loan to buy various items of underwear so she can take advantage of the start of the school year and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy school socks, sports shirts, camisoles, women's underwear, bikinis and socks.

loans.name: Eufemia Auxilliadora

texts.es: la señora Eufemia se dedica a atender un cafetin en un centro de salud desde hace 3 años y medio, es madre  de dos hijos ninguno depende de ella, la señora trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana a ocho de la noche , en su negocio vende desayunos , almuerzos, y cenas todos los días, solicita el financiamiento para surtir su negocio y ofrecerles a sus cliente mas productos.
texts.en:
Eufemia works serving customers at a snack stand located in a health center. She has been doing this for three and a half years. She has two children who live on their own. She works Monday through Sunday from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm. Her business is open every day for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

She is requesting this loan in order to stock her business and offer her customers more products.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice and beans in bulk, vegetables, fruit, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a cattle trader in Kyarushangura–Kitojo in Bushenyi District and he started the business in 2003 for the purpose of making income which he could use to educate his five children.  Pius is an honest business man who also owns a bar which he operates when he is off the cattle trade business.  The bar business is a busy one, especially in the evenings and this boosts his income. 

His customers are mainly cattle traders in the area and they have supported him greatly since they give him a ready market for the cows.  Pius hopes to grow the business so that he can make greater sales and get more profits.  Pius would like to use the loan money, amounting to one million shillings, to buy more cows for trade so that he can grow his business.  However, Pius has a challenge of inadequate land for grazing cattle and this affects his business since he can't have many cows on the relatively small piece of land that he has, but he hopes to overcome this by buying land from the accumulated profits from the business.Pius is pictured(middle) standing in the plantation with his wife and the UGAFODE staff.

loans.use: To buy cattle to trade

loans.name: Jesnell

texts.es: Jesnell es una joven d 20 años, casada, con domicilio en la Ciudad de Somotillo, responsable, honesta, dedicada a su trabajo, comerciante, cuenta con una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, manifiesta que gracias a Dios y a Ceprodel pudo apertura su pulpería lo que le ha mejorado su calidad de  vida, actualmente se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, café entre otros productos  y de esta manera expandir su negocio e incrementar su capital.
texts.en:
Jesnell is a twenty-year-old young lady who lives in the town of Somotillo. She is responsible, honest, and dedicated to her work. She is a retailer and has a grocery store located in her home. She says that thanks to God and Ceprodel she was able to open her grocery store, which has improved her quality of life. 

She is currently requesting a loan through Ceprodel in order to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, and other products so that she can expand her business and increase her capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, batteries, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat’s husband owns a car repair workshop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and his residence is near the shop. 

His workshop is situated beside a huge and reputed spare parts shop where customers like to fix their cars. Customers like the workshop due to it's large variety of spare parts. However, his shop does not have a large variety of spare parts to offer and attract customers. 

To grow his business, income, and become competitive, he plans to offer a variety of spare parts and modern repair tools. 

Therefore, Riffat requests a loan to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy spare parts and repair tools.

Riffat is a married woman and looks after her children alone. Her one son helps her husband.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools to repair cars.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells second hand clothes on a retail and wholesale basis at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 18 years. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 2,000,000 from MCDT – SACC0 to buy more bales of second hand clothes. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level, to become a wholesaler and to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia vive en la hermosa ciudad de Challabamba  a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donde continua preparando desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Ella continua en el banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, aceite, sacos de fideos, verduras y carnes. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Libia lives in the beautiful city of Challabama 15 minutes from the city of Paucartambo. She has a small restaurant in her home where she continues preparing breakfast, lunch and dinner. She continues as a member of the Sol Naciente de Mojopata Communal Bank and at this time needs a loan to purchase supplies, such as bags of rice, oil, bags of noodles, vegetables and meat.

She is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to responsibly making the monthly payments on time.

The community of Mojopata is located in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as bags of rice, oil, bags of noodles, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
For the last 20 years, Monica has been operating her farming business in Nakuru, from which she has been getting a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

She has applied for her first loan of  90,000 KES.  from VisionFund Kenya, which will be used to buy a motorcycle to transport customers for a fee. Monica hopes to use her profits from the expanded business to educate her children, improve on the current business and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

She is 38 years old and married to Harrison. They are blessed with eight children ages between the ages of 2 and 18. In the future, Monica hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 58-year-old mother from the Kakamega region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to John, who is a businessman, and their children are seven, eight, 12 and 15 years old respectively. For the last three years, Leonida has operated a business selling cows. She makes a monthly income of 36,000 KES. 

Leonida is requesting her first loan with VisionFund Kenya to buy more goats and cows for sale. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to plow back into her business. In the future, Leonida dreams of expanding her business and making it stable. She also hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cows for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther used the money in her first loan to buy fertilizers, chemicals and seeds. She is happy that the loan really helped improve her business.  

Esther has applied for her second loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy a cow. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. Esther hopes to take a bigger loan in the near future to help boost her business.

loans.use: To buy cow
